importStatus.note: Included fields: expansion, card title, cost, player count, vps, text, type. Invalid rows skipped: 28.

cards.name: 6th Sense Academy
cards.text: At the end of an Action, whenever you have 0 of exactly one of the goods shown below (G V W C R S), take 1 of that good from the general supply. You cannot convert goods to Food if you have exactly 1 of this good.

cards.name: Abandoned Willow
cards.text: Immediately remove 1 empty field from your farmyard and receive 4 Wood. (That space now counts as unused).

cards.name: Abort Oriel
cards.text: You can no longer play this card when any player (including you) has 5 or more cards in front of them.

cards.name: Absinthe
cards.text: Place 1 Food on the next 5 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds' Work phase, place the Food on an Action space of your choice. (The next player to use this space receives the Food.)

cards.name: Academic
cards.text: This card counts as 2 Occupations for Minor Improvements and when scoring the "Reeve" Occupation card.

cards.name: Accountant
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2/1/0 Wood in a 3/4/5 player game. Whenever any player plays an Occupation, add 1 Food to this card from the general supply. At any time, you may use this Food to buy Goods as follows: Sheep or Stone for 2 Food. Wild boar or Grain for 3 Food. Cattle or Vegetables for 4 Food.

cards.name: Acorns Basket
cards.text: Place 1 wild boar on each of the 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wild boar.

cards.name: Acreage
cards.text: When you Sow, you can plant 2 Grain fields on this card. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

cards.name: Acrobat
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, after all of the other players have finished their turns you may move that person to a free "Plow" or "Take 1 Grain" Action space and take the action.

cards.name: Action Artist
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you can return 1 animal of your choice to the general Supply and receive 4 Food in exchange. (You do not need a Cooking Improvement).

cards.name: Adoptive Parents
cards.text: When you take a "Family growth" action, you can pay 1 Food to immediately place the offspring in you hut. This allows you to take an action with it this round. If you do this, the offspring does not count as "newborn".

cards.name: Advisor
cards.text: The next time you use the "Fishing" Action space with a person, you also receive 2 Bonus points. After that, you receive 1 Bonus point whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space with a person.

cards.name: Agrarian
cards.text: At the start of each round, you may place 1 Food from your supply on the "Plow 1 field" Action space. Any player that uses that space also receives the Food. At the end of the round, if the space has not been used, you take the Food back and may Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Agrarian Fences
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grain Utilization" action space, you can take a "Build Fences" action instead of one of the two actions provide by the action space.

cards.name: Agricultural Fertilizers
cards.text: Each time after you turn at least 2 unused spaces into used spaces in one action, you get an additional "Sow" action.

cards.name: Agricultural Labourer
cards.text: Place 8 clay on this card. For each grain you obtain, you also get 1 clay from this card.

cards.name: Alchemist
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Wood. Whenever you receive Building resources or animals from an Action space, you may place 1 of the goods received on the space afterward and take 1 Wood or Clay from any Accumulation space.

cards.name: Ale-Benches
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, you can pay exactly 1 grain from your supply to get 1 bonus point. If you do, each other player gets 1 food.

cards.name: Alm
cards.text: When you play this card, you may remove 1 stable from your farmyard and receive 1 Cattle. This card can hold an unlimited number of Cattle. (This card does not count as a pasture when scoring).

cards.name: Almanac
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately take the Field and Breeding phases of a Harvest on your farmyard.

cards.name: Alms
cards.text: When you play this card, take 1 Food for each completed round of the game.

cards.name: Almshouse
cards.text: At the end of the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you may discard 1 Begging card that you received in any Harvest because you paid 1 Food less to feed your family.

cards.name: Alternative Designer
cards.text: Whenever you build stables or fences, you may replace Wood with the same amount of Clay or Stone. Whenever you build rooms, you may replace Wood with the same amount of Clay or Stone, to a maximum of 2 Clay and 2 Stone.

cards.name: Altruist
cards.text: Twice during the game, you may use the "Renovate" action to convert your Stone house back into a Wooden hut by paying 1 Wood per room and 1 Reed. When you do this, you receive 3 Bonus points per room and you receive 3 Clay.

cards.name: Amateur Fencer
cards.text: When you play this card, if you have no pastures yet, you can immediately fence exactly 1 space in your farmyard without paying wood for the fences.

cards.name: Amazon
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space in Round 7/9/11/13, you receive 1 additional Sheep/ Wild boar/ Cattle/ animal of your choice.

cards.name: Amusement Park
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on the next 2/3/4/5 remaining Round spaces if you have 1/2/3/4 pastures. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Anatomist
cards.text: Place 1 Guest token on each remaining space for Rounds 7, 10, and 13. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Guest token. You must place this Guest only with your last Action that round and only on an Accumulation space.

cards.name: Angler
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Fishing" Accumulation space while there are at most 2 food on that space, you get a "Major or Minor Improvement" action.

cards.name: Angry Duck
cards.text: When you play this card, if there is any Food on future Round spaces that you would later receive, you may place some or all of that Food on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3/4/5 Bonus points for 1/2/3/5/8 Food on this card. (You may not use the Food on this card.)

cards.name: Animal Activist
cards.text: If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most fenced stables gets 2 bonus points.

cards.name: Animal Brander
cards.text: Each time you use the "Animal Market" action space, you can pay 1 food to use the same option twice (instead of once).

cards.name: Animal Breeder
cards.text: Whenever you fence unused spaces to create at least one new pasture, you can buy a pair of animals: 2 Sheep for 1 Food, 2 Wild boar for 2 Food, or 2 Cattle for 3 Food.

cards.name: Animal Buyer
cards.text: At the end of the Field phase of each Harvest, you may buy 1 or 2 animals. Pay 2/3/4 Food for each Sheep/Wild boar/Cattle.

cards.name: Animal Catcher
cards.text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, instead of 2 food, you can get 3 different animals from the general supply. If you do, you must pay 1 food each harvest left to play.

cards.name: Animal Dealer
cards.text: Whenever you use one of the "Sheep", "Wild boar" or "Cattle" Action spaces, you can pay 1 Food to take 1 additional animal of that type. (The "Sheep", "Wild boar" and "Cattle" cards are added in Stages 1,3, and 4.)

cards.name: Animal Farm
cards.text: Once per round, you may return 1 of you animals to the supply for a Guest token, which you place this round as you would a Family member. (The Guest represents the animal.)

cards.name: Animal Farmer
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each of your pastures that can not contain any more animals than it does. If all of your pastures qualify, you receive 1 additional Bonus point. (To receive this point, you need to have at least 1 pasture.)

cards.name: Animal Feed
cards.text: Immediately before scoring, you receive 1 additional animal of each type that you already have, if you have space in your pastures. (This does not apply to the House Goat and the Horse.)

cards.name: Animal Feeder
cards.text: On the "Day Laborer" action space, you also get your choice of 1 sheep or 1 grain. Instead of that good, you can buy 1 wild boar for 1 food or 1 cattle for 2 food.

cards.name: Animal Handler
cards.text: Place 1 Sheep on the space for Round 7, 1 Wild boar on Round 10, and 1 Cattle on Round 14. At the start of these rounds, you can buy the animal for 1 Food.

cards.name: Animal Holder
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, each player who has the most animals receives 3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Animal Keeper
cards.text: You can keep Sheep, Wild boar, and Cattle in the same pasture. This applies to all your pastures (except the Forest Pasture).

cards.name: Animal Nursery
cards.text: You may place newborn animals of any type on this card immediately after their birth. They cannot be used for any purpose or moved off this card, but are counted at the end of the game. (This card does not count as a pasture or stable.)

cards.name: Animal Pen
cards.text: Place 2 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of each round, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Animal Reeve
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 1/2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with 2+/3+/4+ animals of each type gets 1/3/5 bonus points.

cards.name: Animal Tamer
cards.text: You can keep 1 animal in each room of your home. You may keep more than 1 type of animal in your home.

cards.name: Animal Teacher
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use a "Lessons" action space, you can also buy 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle for 0/1/2 food.

cards.name: Animal Trainer
cards.text: Whenever you take food from a "Traveling Players" space, you may immediately use it to buy animals: Pay 2 Food for each Sheep or Wild Boar and 3 Food for each Cattle.

cards.name: Animal Welfarist
cards.text: At the end of each Work phase in which you used both the "Build Stables" action on an Action space and the "Build Fences" action on an Action space, you receive 1 animal of each kind.

cards.name: Animal Yard
cards.text: On this card you can hold up to 2 animals of you choice. They need not be the same type of animal. (This card does not count as a pasture for scoring.)(This card does not give you animals.)

cards.name: Apple Man
cards.text: Once during each Returning home phase, you may pay 1 Vegetable from your supply to take a "Plow 1 field", "Build fences", or "Build stables" action without placing a person.

cards.name: Apple Orchard
cards.text: You receive 2 Bonus points for either Grain or Vegetables missing from your farm at the end of the game. (The fruit replaces this type of good.)(You still lose the points for the missing good.)

cards.name: Apple Picker
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" or "Take 1 Vegetable" action, you receive an additional 1 Wood and 1 Food.

cards.name: Apple Tree
cards.text: Place 1 Wood from the general supply on an empty field. This field still counts as a field, but can no longer be used for Sowing or other uses. In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Apprentice
cards.text: At the beginning of every Harvest, you receive 1 Food for every Major Improvement you own worth at least 2 Points without counting Bonus Points. (If you have purchased a Major Improvement as a Minor Improvement, that Improvement still counts for this card.)

cards.name: Apprenticeship
cards.text: Immediately play an Occupation if you have fewer Occupations than each other player.

cards.name: Architect
cards.text: Whenever you extend your home, you receive 2 Food for each new Room. Whenever you build stables, you receive 1 Food for each new stable.

cards.name: Archway
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space for all players. A player who uses it gets 1 Food and may move the person, immediately before the Returning home phase, to an empty Action space. (That Action ends the Work phase.)

cards.name: Archway
cards.text: This card is an action space for all. A player who uses it immediately gets 1 food. Immediately before the returning home phase, they can use an unoccupied action space with the person from this card.

cards.name: Ardennes
cards.text: Place 1 Wood on each remaining even-numbered Round space. At the start of these Rounds, you receive the Wood.

cards.name: Art Director
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" Action, you receive an additional Food and a building resource of your choice.

cards.name: Art Teacher
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 reed. Each time you pay an occupation cost, you can use food from the "traveling Players" accumulation space.

cards.name: Artisan
cards.text: At most once per Harvest, when you use an Improvement to convert a building resource to Food, you receive 2 additional Food.

cards.name: Artisan District
cards.text: During scoring, you get 2/5/8 bonus points for having 3/4/5 major improvements from the bottom row of the supply board.

cards.name: Artists Garden
cards.text: In the Returning home phase of each round, you may harvest 1 field.

cards.name: Asparagus Gift
cards.text: Each time you build a number of fences equal to or great than the current round, you immediately get 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Asparagus Knife
cards.text: In the returning home phase of rounds 8, 10, and 12, you can take 1 vegetable from exactly 1 vegetable field. You can immediately exchange it for 3 food and 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Assistant Tiller
cards.text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can also plow 1 field.

cards.name: Assistant Tiller
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you may also Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Astronomer
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Food. Whenever 3/4/5 of your Family members (or Guests) use 3/4/5 adjacent Action spaces (forming a vertical or horizontal line), you receive 1/3/5 Bonus points. The Action spaces must have the same dimensions.

cards.name: Attic
cards.text: Whenever your extend your home, you may place 1 Wood from your supply on each of the new rooms. You cannot use this Wood any more, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.

cards.name: Auctioneer
cards.text: Place 2 Reed, 3 Wood, 3 Clay, and 2 Stone on Rounds 7, 9, 11 and 13, respectively. At the start of these rounds, all players simultaneously bid Food for the resources (players secretly place Food in their hands, then reveal.) The highest bidder gets the resources and you get the Food. If you win, pay your Food to the supply. Ties are broken by this round's player order.

cards.name: Autodidact
cards.text: At the start of each Round, before Phase 1, you may pay 2 Food to immediately play an Occupation. (Only Occupations that do not require a person to be placed can be played this way.)

cards.name: Automatic Water Trough
cards.text: If you can accommodate the animal, you can immediately buy 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle for 0/1/2 food.

cards.name: Autumn Mother
cards.text: Immediately before each harvest, if you have room in your house, you can take a "Family Growth" action for 3 food.

cards.name: Award Winner
cards.text: Once per round, when you build a Major or Minor Improvement, you may pay 1 additional building resource of those already paid for 1 Bonus Point.

cards.name: Axe
cards.text: Whenever you add a room to your Wooden hut, you only pay 2 Wood and 2 Reed.

cards.name: Back Door
cards.text: Immediately place a person that is not already placed on an Action space on the "After Family Growth also 1 Minor Improvement" Action space even if it is occupied by you or another player and take that action.

cards.name: Backpacker
cards.text: In the Returning home phase of each even-numbered round, you may choose to not return home 1 person. When you leave a person on an Action space this way, immediately before the start of the next Work phase, take that action again (and keep space occupied). If you cannot, take 1 Begging card and return him home.

cards.name: Backyard
cards.text: Any 2x2 Unused farmyard space, where 1 of the spaces is orthogonally adjacent to your home, provides room for 1 person. (Once one of the spaces becomes used, move the Family member back to your supply or your home if you have room.)

cards.name: Backyard Well
cards.text: Once this game, at any time, you may place 1 Stone from the general supply on 1 Unused farmyard space next to your home. (It now counts as used.) If you do this, place 1 Food on each of the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. (Backyard Well counts as a Well.)

cards.name: Badger
cards.text: Immediately place a marker on an Action space of your choice. At the start of each round, you must move it to an orthogonally adjacent revealed Action space. Any player that uses that space also receives 1 Food.

cards.name: Bagpiper
cards.text: You immediately receive 2 Food. The Family member that took the "Occupation" action returns home as though it had not done any work yet this Round. (You place this Family member again as soon as it is your turn again.) The "Occupation" Action space returns to its unoccupied state and may be used again.

cards.name: Baguette
cards.text: During each Harvest, you may pay 1 Wood to Bake bread at the start of the Feeding phase if you have an Improvement with the bread symbol.

cards.name: Bakehouse
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Bake bread" Action, you can use the Bakehouse to convert up to 2 Grain into 5 Food each. When you play this card, you can also take the "Bake bread" Action.

cards.name: Baker
cards.text: During each Harvest, you may Bake bread at the start of the Feeding phase if you have an Improvement with the bread symbol. When you play this card, you may Bake bread as an additional action.

cards.name: Baker's Daughter
cards.text: If another player plays the Baker or Master Baker, you may play this card immediately at no cost. You can use the "Take 1 Grain" and "Sow and/or Bake Bread" Action spaces even if another player has placed a person on the space. When you play this card, you can immediately take a "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Baker's Kitchen
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you can use the Baker's Kitchen to convert up to 2 Grain into 5 Food each. When you play this card, you can also take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Baker's Oven
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you can use the Baker's Oven to convert up to 2 Grain into 5 Food each. When you play this card, you can also take the "Bake bread" Action.

cards.name: Baking Course
cards.text: At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can take a "Bake Bread" action. "Bake Bread" action: Grain â†’ 2 Food

cards.name: Baking Field
cards.text: When you Sow, you can plant Grain on this card as you would on a field. When harvesting, you must (and may) immediately Bake this field's harvested Grain. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

cards.name: Baking Powder
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Sow and/or Bake Bread" Action space, place 1 Grain from the supply on each of your Major Improvements. Whenever you play an Occupation, move these Grain to your supply. (Before scoring, discard the Grain from your Major Improvements.)

cards.name: Baking Sheet
cards.text: Each time you take a "Bake Bread" action, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 grain for 2 food and 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Baking Tray
cards.text: Clay Ovens and Stone Ovens are Minor Improvements for you. Clay, Stone and Wood-fired Ovens cost you 1 building resource (of your choice) less.

cards.name: Bale of Straw
cards.text: At the start of each harvest, if you have at least 3 grain fields (including field cards with planted grain), you get 2 food.

cards.name: Barbecue
cards.text: When you play this card, you can convert as many Animals to Food as you have Family members. For each Sheep, you receive 3 Food, for each Wild boar, 4 and for each Cattle, 5.

cards.name: Barber Shop
cards.text: For every Harvest remaining when you play this card, you receive 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: Bard
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Traveling players" action on an Action space, you receive 1 Food and 1 Wood from the supply.

cards.name: Bargaining Baker
cards.text: Whenever you build a Baking Improvement with the bread symbol, you receive 1 Grain before building the Improvement. Whenever you build an Oven, pay 1 Building resource less of your choice. (An Oven is a Baking Improvement with "Oven" in the name.)

cards.name: Barley Mill
cards.text: In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each grain field that you harvest.

cards.name: Barrow Pusher
cards.text: For each new field tile you get, you also get 1 clay and 1 food.

cards.name: Bartering Hut
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately buy up to 2 (same or different) animals from the general supply. Pay any 2 building resources for each Sheep, any 3 for each Wild boar, and any 4 for each Cattle.

cards.name: Baseboards
cards.text: You immediately get 1 wood for each room you have. If you have more rooms than people, you get 1 additional wood.

cards.name: Basin Maker
cards.text: For each Wild boar that you convert into Food, you can place up to 2 Wood from your personal supply on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1 bonus point for each Wood on this card except the 1st, 4th, 7th and 10th.

cards.name: Basket
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can exchange 2 wood for 3 food. If you do, place those 2 wood on the accumulation space.

cards.name: Basket
cards.text: Whenever you use a person's action to take Wood from an Action space, you can leave 2 of the Wood on the Action space and receive 3 Food in exchange.

cards.name: Basket Carrier
cards.text: Once each harvest, you can buy 1 wood, 1 reed, and 1 grain for 2 food total.

cards.name: Basket Chair
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately move the first person you placed this work phase to this card. If you do, immediately afterward, you can place another person.

cards.name: Basket Weaver
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately build the "Basketmaker's Workshop" major improvement for 1 stone and 1 reed.

cards.name: Basketmaker
cards.text: In each Harvest, the Basketmaker can convert up to 1 Reed to 3 Food.

cards.name: Basketmaker's Son
cards.text: Whenever you use the Basketmaker's Workshop in a Harvest, you receive 2 additional Grain. For this, you must have at least 3 Family members. (Guests are not counted.)

cards.name: Basketmaker's Wife
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 reed and 1 food. At any time, you can turn 1 reed into 2 food.

cards.name: Basketmaker's Workshop
cards.text: Harvest: At most 1 time Reed â†’ 3 Food Scoring: 2/4/5 Reed â†’ 1/2/3 bonus points

cards.name: Basketmaker's Workshop
cards.text: In each Harvest, you can use the Basketmaker's Workshop to convert at most 1 Reed to 3 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/4/5 Reed.

cards.name: Bassinet
cards.text: Each work phase, you can place a(nother) person on the first non-accumulating action space used by any player (including you), as long as there is only 1 person on that space.

cards.name: Bathroom
cards.text: Each time you convert a Grain or Vegetable into Food, you may place it on this card. For each field you Sow, you may take 1 Good of the same type from this card and add it to that field. (Goods on this card do not count for points when scoring.)

cards.name: Beach Chair
cards.text: Whenever any player uses the "Fishing" Action space, they may pay you 1 Food afterward for 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: Bean Basket
cards.text: Place 2 Vegetables from the general supply on this card. Whenever you Plow 1 field, you may take 1 Vegetable from this card. Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action space, you may place 1 Vegetable from the general supply on this card.

cards.name: Bean Counter
cards.text: Each time you use an action space on round spaces 1 to 8, place 1 food on this card. Each time this cards has 3 food on it, move the food to your supply.

cards.name: Bean Field
cards.text: When you Sow, you can plant Vegetables on this card as though it were a field. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

cards.name: Beanfield
cards.text: This card is a field that can only grow vegetables.

cards.name: Beating Rod
cards.text: You can immediately choose to either get 1 reed or exchange 1 reed for 1 cattle.

cards.name: Bed in the Grain Field
cards.text: At the start of the next harvest, you get a "Family Growth" action if you have room for the newborn.

cards.name: Bed Maker
cards.text: Each time you add rooms to your house, you can also pay 1 wood and 1 grain to immediately get a "Family Growth with Room Only" action.

cards.name: Bee Keeper
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately build 1 stable without paying Wood and place it on its side. This stable loses its regular animal functions. (It is still worth 1 additional point if fenced.) In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you receive 1 Food as long as the stable is on your farm.

cards.name: Beehive
cards.text: Place 2 Food on each remaining even-numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you take the Food.

cards.name: Beehive Oven
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you can use the Beehive Oven to convert up to 1 Grain into 4 Food. Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread without using the Beehive Oven, you receive 1 additional Food. When you play this card, you can immediately take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Beer Festival
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately take the "Bake Bread" action. If you have at least 3/6/9 Food left at the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Beer Keg
cards.text: In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange 1/2/3 grain for 0/1/2 bonus points and exactly 3 food.

cards.name: Beer Museum
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each harvest, you may convert 1 Grain to 6 Food, but you only receive the Food in the Field phase of the next harvest. (You do not need any improvement with the bread symbol for this conversion.)

cards.name: Beer Parlor
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain. Before each Returning home phase, if all of your Family members were placed on the same game board, you may convert 1 Grain from your supply into 3 Food. (All the Action spaces are distributed on 3 game boards. You do not need any improvement with the bread symbol for this conversion.)

cards.name: Beer Stall
cards.text: In the feeding phase of each harvest, for each empty unfenced stable you have, you can exchange 1 grain for 5 food.

cards.name: Beer Stein
cards.text: Each time you take a "Bake Bread" action, you can use this card once to turn 1 grain into 2 food and 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Beer Table
cards.text: At the end of the Field phase of each harvest, you may pay 1 Grain for 2 Bonus points. If you do, all other players receive 1 Food from the general supply.

cards.name: Beer Table
cards.text: At the end of the field phase of each harvest, you can pay 1 grain from your supply to get 2 bonus points. If you do, all other players get 1 food each.

cards.name: Beer Tap
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 food. In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can turn 2/3/4 grain into 3/6/9 food.

cards.name: Beer Tent Operator
cards.text: In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to turn 1 wood plus 1 grain into 1 bonus point and 2 food.

cards.name: Begging Letter
cards.text: Each of your opponents must give you 1 Minor Improvement card from their hand. Choose 1 of those cards and take it into your hand. Then shuffle the remaining cards and the Begging Letter and deal 1 card at random to each of your opponents. Immediately afterwards, you receive an additional "Minor Improvement" action.

cards.name: Begging Student
cards.text: When you play this card, you must immediately take 1 begging marker. At the start of each harvest, you can play 1 occupation without paying an occupation cost.

cards.name: Beguine Courtyard
cards.text: Once your home is shaped like the picture below (5 room home shaped like a "C"), you must immediately move all the people still in your supply into your home. They may take actions starting that round. (They count as adult Family members and not "newborns".)

cards.name: Belgian Shepherd
cards.text: You may keep up to 2 Sheep on exactly 1 Unused space in your farmyard. The space still counts as unused. You may not keep any animal other than the Belgian Shepherd in your home. (Even if you have special Occupations or Improvements.)

cards.name: Bellfounder
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, if you have at least 1 clay, you can use this card to discard all of your clay and get your choice of 3 food or 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Benefactor
cards.text: Once during the game, when you have 4 fenced pastures, you may return 1 animal to the supply to extend your Wooden hut by 1 room at no cost.

cards.name: Berry Picker
cards.text: Whenever you use a Family member's action to take Wood, you receive an additional 1 Food.

cards.name: Bible
cards.text: Each of your Family members who takes one of the following Actions in a Round that ends with a Harvest requires 1 Food fewer during the Harvest: "Plow fields", "Plow fields and Sow", "Take 1 Grain", "Take 1 Vegetable" or "Day Labor".

cards.name: Bielefeld Playing Cards
cards.text: Whenever you use an Accumulation space, place all the items received on this card instead of placing them in your supply. Whenever there is 4 or more of the same item on this card, move exactly 4 of those to your supply. (Before scoring, discard the items on this card.)

cards.name: Big Backer
cards.text: Whenever another player receives 2 or more animals of one type, you can buy one from him. A Sheep costs 2 Food, a Wild boar 3 Food, a Cattle 4 Food.

cards.name: Big Bang Theorist
cards.text: At the start of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th Harvest Phase, for every opponent that has 0-10/0-8/0-6/0-3/0 unused spaces on their farmyard, you receive 1 Food each.

cards.name: Big Country
cards.text: For each complete round left to play, you immediately get 1 bonus point and 2 food.

cards.name: Bird Trap
cards.text: In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 1 Food from the general supply and you can Harvest 1 additional resource from 1 field of your choice.

cards.name: Birdcage
cards.text: Each Harvest, you may place 1 Food on this card from your supply. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Food on this card. You may not hold Sheep, Wild boar, or Cattle in your home (even if another card allows this).

cards.name: Birthstone
cards.text: Whenever you grow your family, you may pay 1 Stone for 1 Bonus point. When you play Birthstone, you may immediately do this for any new Family member that you already received this round.

cards.name: Blade Shears
cards.text: You immediately get your choice of 3 food or 1 food for each sheep you have. (Keep the sheep.)

cards.name: Blueprint
cards.text: You can build the major improvements "Joinery", "Pottery", and "Basketmaker's Workshop" even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action. They each cost you 1 stone less.

cards.name: Boar Breeding
cards.text: When you play this card, take 1 Wild boar.

cards.name: Boat Painter
cards.text: At the end of each work phase, if both the "Fishing" and "Traveling Players" accumulation spaces are occupied, you get your choice of 1 grain or 2 food.

cards.name: Boatswain
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may place 1 Grain from the supply on each of your empty plowed fields. These fields are now considered planted fields. (This does not count as a "Sow" action)

cards.name: Bobbin Table
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space for you only. Whenever you use this space, you may afterward (and until the next Harvest) use Action spaces even if they are occupied.

cards.name: Bohemian
cards.text: At the start of each returning home phase, if at least one "Lessons" action space is unoccupied, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Bonehead
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately place 6 wood on it. Immediately after each time you play a card from your hand, including this one, you get 1 wood from this card.

cards.name: Bonfire
cards.text: Place 1 Wood from the general supply on 1 Unused farmyard space. As long as the Wood remains, the space counts as used. You may return it at any time to convert animals to Food for the rest of that round. Take 2/3/4 Food for each Sheep/Wild boar/Cattle converted.

cards.name: Bookcase
cards.text: Whenever you play an Occupation, you receive 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Bookshelf
cards.text: Whenever you play 1 Occupation you receive 3 Food before you pay the costs of the Occupation.

cards.name: Borrower
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 7 Food and 2 Begging cards. At any time, you may pay 3 Food to discard one of these 2 Begging cards or a Begging card you received instead of paying 1 Food to feed your family.

cards.name: Botanist
cards.text: Whenever another player receives exactly 3 Wood from a Wood Accumulation space with a person, you receive 1 Food from the general supply.

cards.name: Bottles
cards.text: For each person you have, you must pay an additional 1 clay and 1 food to play this card.

cards.name: Bottles
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately pay 1 Clay and 1 Food for each of your Family members. (Guests are not counted.)

cards.name: Boundary Stones
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3/5 Bonus points for having at least 2/3/4/5 fields that are orthogonally adjacent to exactly one other field.

cards.name: Bountiful Harvest
cards.text: If you harvest at least 2 resources and breed at least 1 animal during a Harvest, place 1 Food from the supply on this card. You may use this Food at any time. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Food on this card.

cards.name: Bovine Pioneer
cards.text: Each time you create at least one new pasture from unfenced farmyard spaces you get 1 cattle.

cards.name: Bowler Hat
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Fishing" Action space with a person, he must first pay you 1 Food. In the following Returning home phase, place 2 Food from the general supply on that Action space.

cards.name: Brabant
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 5 Bonus points if have 2 or 3 animal categories where you score 1 negative point. (You still lose the points for the missing animal types.)

cards.name: Braggart
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1/3/5/7/9 Bonus points for having 5/6/7/8/9+ Improvements in front of you.

cards.name: Brakelhuhner
cards.text: Lege 2 NW aus deinem allgemeinen Vorrat auf diese Karte. Solange in der Erntephase mindestens 2 NW auf der Karte liegen, lege 1 NW aus dem allgemeinen Vorrat dazu. Du kannst jederzeit NW von der Karte in deinen eignen Vorrat legen. *2 Siegpunkte bei mindestens 4 NW auf der Karte

cards.name: Branch Collector
cards.text: Whenever you use Clay or Stone for an extension, Renovation, or Improvement, you receive 1 Wood from the general supply (for each new Room, Renovation, or Improvement) before paying its costs.

cards.name: Brazier
cards.text: During the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you can use the Brazier to convert exactly 1 animal or Vegetable to Food as follows: 1 Sheep = 2 Food, 1 Wild boar = 3 Food, 1 Cattle = 4 Food, 1 Vegetable = 3 Food.

cards.name: Bread Carrier
cards.text: Once any player has built an Oven, place 1 Food on the remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. (If an Oven has already been built, place the Food immediately. If multiple Ovens are built, you only receive the Food once.)

cards.name: Bread Paddle
cards.text: Whenever you play an Occupation, you may also take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Bread Seller
cards.text: You receive 1 Food for the supply for each Grain that is baked whenever any player (including you) Bakes bread. (To Bake, you need a Baking Improvement with the bread symbol.)

cards.name: Breakfast Outdoors
cards.text: In each Feeding phase, you receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Breed Registry
cards.text: During scoring, if you gained at most 2 sheep from sources other than breeding during the game and have not turned any sheep into food, you get 3 bonus points.

cards.name: Breeder Buyer
cards.text: Each time you build at least 1 wood/clay/stone room and at least 1 stable on the same turn, you also get 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle.

cards.name: Brewer
cards.text: After each Round that does not end with a Harvest, the Brewer may convert up to 1 Grain into 3 Food or 1 Bonus point. (These rounds are 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 8, 10 and 12.)

cards.name: Brewer's Copper
cards.text: During the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you can use the Brewer's Copper to convert at most 1 Grain to 2 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point if you have at least 7 Grain.

cards.name: Brewery
cards.text: During the Feeding phase of the Harvest, you can use the Brewery to convert at most 1 Grain to 3 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for your ninth Grain.

cards.name: Brewery Pond
cards.text: Each time you use the "Fishing" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you also get 1 grain and 1 wood.

cards.name: Brewing Water
cards.text: Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you can pay 1 grain to place 1 food on each of the next 6 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Brick Hammer
cards.text: Each time after you build an improvement costing at least 2 clay, you get 1 stone.

cards.name: Bricklayer
cards.text: Pay 1 less Clay for each Improvement and Renovation. Pay 2 less Clay for each Room.

cards.name: Brickyard
cards.text: At the start of each round, if you have no Clay in your supply, place 1 Clay on this card. At any time when this card has 4 or more Clay on it, you may move all of the Clay to your personal supply.

cards.name: Brook
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 3 Wood", "Take 1 Clay", or "Take 1 Reed" Action spaces located above the "Fishing" Action space, you receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Brook
cards.text: Each time you use one of the four action spaces above the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 1 additional food.

cards.name: Broom
cards.text: Discard all the remaining Minor Improvements in you hand, and draw 7 new Minor Improvements. You can play 1 more Minor Improvement immediately. (You must pay the costs of the new Improvement and, where appropriate, meet the conditions for playing it.)

cards.name: Brotherly Love
cards.text: As long as you have exactly 4 people, in the work phase of each round, you can place your third and fourth person immediately after one another, even on the same action space.

cards.name: Brush Maker
cards.text: Whenever you convert Wild boar to Food, you can choose to place the boar on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/3/4 slaughtered Wild boar.

cards.name: Brushwood Collector
cards.text: You may replace the required Reed with a total of 1 Wood for any Renovation or Extension. (You use brushwood to make the roof.)

cards.name: Brushwood Roof
cards.text: Whenever you extend or renovate your home, you can replace 1 or 2 Reed with the same amount of Wood.

cards.name: Bucksaw
cards.text: Each time you renovate, you can also pay 1 wood to get 1 bonus point and 1 grain.

cards.name: Builder's Trowel
cards.text: You can Renovate your Wooden hut to a Clay hut at any time without using the "Renovate" action. (You must still pay for the Renovation.)

cards.name: Building Expert
cards.text: Each time you use the "Resource Market" action space with the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th person you place, you also get 1 wood/clay/reed/stone/stone.

cards.name: Building Material
cards.text: You receive either 1 Wood or 1 Clay when you play this card.

cards.name: Building Tycoon
cards.text: Whenever another player builds at least one Room, you can give him 1 Food and immediately build exactly one Room yourself (You must pay the Building costs for the Room(s)).

cards.name: Building Tycoon
cards.text: Each time after another player builds 1 or more rooms, you can give them 1 food to build exactly 1 room yourself. (You must pay the building cost of the room.)

cards.name: Building Tycoon
cards.text: Each time after another player builds 1 or more rooms, you can give them 1 food to build exactly 1 room yourself. (You must pay the building cost of the room.)

cards.name: Bullcatcher
cards.text: When both action spaces on round spaces 3 and 6 are occupied, you can use this card with a person to get 1 cattle and 2 food.

cards.name: Bunk Beds
cards.text: Once you have 4 rooms, your house can hold 5 people.

cards.name: Bureaucrat
cards.text: Place up to 3 Food from your own Supply onto this card. Once during each Round, you may pay 1 Food from this card to place a Person on an Action space that already holds 1 Person (whether your own or another player's). (You can take the Food from this card back into your Supply at any time.)

cards.name: Buried Treasure
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field/and or Sow" Action space, you also receive 1 Stone.

cards.name: Businessman
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Starting Player" Action space, you can play an additional Minor Improvement or a Major Improvement after you play the Minor Improvement.

cards.name: Businesswoman
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately play up to 2 Improvements (any combination of Major and Minor) by paying their costs.

cards.name: Bust
cards.text: The Bust cannot be carved (this card can not be played) once all other players have 2 or more Occupations. (3 Occupations in a 3-player game, 4 Occupations in a 2-player game).

cards.name: Butcher
cards.text: You can change your animals into Food at any time (even without an Improvement with the cooking symbol) Take 1 Food for each Sheep, 2 for each Wild boar and 3 for each Cattle.

cards.name: Butler
cards.text: If you play this card in round 11 or before, during scoring, you get 4 bonus points if you then have more rooms than people.

cards.name: Butter Churn
cards.text: Whenever you have Sheep during the Field phase of a Harvest, you receive 1 Food for each third Sheep. Whenever you have Cattle during the Field phase, you receive 1 Food for each second Cattle.

cards.name: Buyer
cards.text: Each time another player uses a reed, stone, sheep, or wild boar accumulation space, you can pay them 1 food to get 1 good of the respective type from the general supply.

cards.name: Cabbage Buyer
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) renovates and the builds no/ 1 minor/ 1 major improvement, you can buy 1 vegetable for 3/2/1 food.

cards.name: Cabbage Lover
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable. For each Vegetable that you convert into Food, you can place 1 Clay from your personal supply on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Clay on this card, up to a maximum of 5 points.

cards.name: Cabinetmaker
cards.text: In each Harvest, the Cabinetmaker can convert up to 1 Wood to 2 Food.

cards.name: Cafe Singer
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action, you may also convert 1 Sheep into 1 Vegetable or 1 Cattle into 2 Vegetables.

cards.name: Calcium Fertilizers
cards.text: Each time you use a "Quarry" accumulation space, add 1 additional good of the respective type to each of your planted fields growing a single type of crop.

cards.name: Camembert
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on 3 Action spaces (unoccupied or occupied) from the general supply. The next player to use the Action space receives the Food.

cards.name: Canal
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may take up to 2 different building resources that you do not have in your personal supply.

cards.name: Canal Boatman
cards.text: Each time you use "Fishing" or "Reed Bank", you can pay 1 food to immediately place another person on this card. If you do, you get your choice of 3 stone or 1 grain plus 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Canal Boatman
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" or "Take 1 Reed" Action space (on the second game board), you may later in the same round, pay 1 Food to place a person on this card. If you do this, you receive either 3 Stone or 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Canoe
cards.text: Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get an additional 1 food and 1 reed.

cards.name: Canoe
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Food and 1 Reed.

cards.name: Canvas Sack
cards.text: When you play this card paying grain/reed for it, you immediately get 1 vegetable/4 wood.

cards.name: Caravan
cards.text: This card provides room for 1 person.

cards.name: Caravan
cards.text: This card provides room for 1 Family member.

cards.name: Card Player
cards.text: From bottom to top, stack 1 Stone, Reed, Clay, and Wood on this card. At the end of each round, move the top resource to the bottom of the stack. Whenever you receive the top/bottom resource type, take 1 additional/fewer resource of that type. (Take from or move the resource to the supply).

cards.name: Caregiver
cards.text: In Rounds 12, 13 and 14, you may not use the Round spaces 12, 13 and 14 with your first 2 persons. You may place a Guest token in each of those rounds.

cards.name: Carp Pond
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each remaining odd-numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Carpenter
cards.text: To extend your home, you need only 3 of the appropriate building resource and 2 Reed for each new room. (For example, if you live in a Wooden hut, you need 3 Wood and 2 Reed.)

cards.name: Carpenter's Apprentice
cards.text: Wood rooms cost you 2 woods less. Your 3rd and 4th stable each cost you 1 wood less. Your 13th to 15th fence each cost you nothing.

cards.name: Carpenter's Axe
cards.text: Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, if you then have at least 7 wood in your supply, you can build exactly 1 stable for 1 wood.

cards.name: Carpenter's Bench
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can use the taken wood (and only that) to build exactly 1 pasture. If you do, one of the fences is free.

cards.name: Carpenter's Boy
cards.text: Each time another player builds a room, you immediately get 1 wood.

cards.name: Carpenter's Hammer
cards.text: Each time you build at least 2 wood/clay/stone rooms at once, you get a total discount of 2 reed as well as 2 wood/3 clay/4 stone.

cards.name: Carpenter's Parlor
cards.text: Wooden rooms only cost you 2 wood and 2 reed each.

cards.name: Carpenter's Yard
cards.text: You can build the "Joinery" and "Well" major improvement even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action, or you can build both with a single "Major Improvement" action.

cards.name: Carriage Trip
cards.text: If you play this card in the work phase, you can immediately place another person.

cards.name: Carriage Trip
cards.text: Immediately place 1 of your people.

cards.name: Carrot Cake Baker
cards.text: Whenever you convert Vegetables into Food, you may additionally take the "Bake bread" action. The Carrot Cake Baker can also convert 1 Vegetable into 2 Food at any time.

cards.name: Carrot Farmer
cards.text: Place 3 Vegetables from the supply on this card. Whenever you use the "Plow 1 Field" Action space, you may pay 1 Food for one of the Vegetables.

cards.name: Carrot Museum
cards.text: At the end of Rounds 8,10, and 12, you receive 1 Stone for each Vegetable field that you have; you also receive 1 Wood for each Vegetable that you have in your supply.

cards.name: Carrot Museum
cards.text: At the end of rounds 8, 10, and 12, you get 1 stone for each vegetable field you have and a number of wood equal to the number of vegetables in your supply.

cards.name: Cart
cards.text: Whenever there are at least 6 Wood, 5 Clay, 4 Reed, or 3 Stone on an Action space, only you can take this space with your first person in the Work phase.

cards.name: Case Builder
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 good of each of the following types, If you have at least 2 of that good in your supply already, food, grain, vegetable, reed, wood.

cards.name: Cash Crop
cards.text: When you Sow, you may Sow on this card as if it were 1 field. Whenever you harvest goods from this card during the Field phase of a Harvest, you must exchange these harvested goods for 1 Bonus point each.

cards.name: Cast-iron Oven
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Bake bread" Action or after you play an Occupation, you may convert 1 Grain into 4 Food with this Oven.

cards.name: Casual Worker
cards.text: Each time another player uses a "Quarry" accumulation space, you can choose to get 1 food or build a stable without paying wood.

cards.name: Cat Lover
cards.text: If there are 1/2/4/7 animals on your farm, you may pay 1/2/3/4 fewer building resources of your choice for each new Wooden room.

cards.name: Cat Tongue
cards.text: Whenever you use a "Family growth" Action, you receive a Guest token which you may use immediately in a Work phase to place it on the "Fishing" Action space only.

cards.name: Catcher
cards.text: Each time you place your 1st/2nd/3rd person in a round on a building resource accumulation space with exactly 5/4/3 building resources, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Cattle Breeder
cards.text: Your Cattle breed at the end of Round 12, if there is space for the calf. When you play this card, you receive 1 Cattle.

cards.name: Cattle Buyer
cards.text: Each time another player uses the "Fencing" action space, you can buy exactly 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle from the general supply for 1/2/2 food.

cards.name: Cattle Caregiver
cards.text: At the start of each round, if 3/4/5+ players each have at least 1 cattle, you get 1/2/3 food.

cards.name: Cattle Dealer
cards.text: Whenever you fence a new pasture that covers at least 3 farmyard spaces, you can pay 1 Reed to receive 2 Cattle.

cards.name: Cattle Farm
cards.text: For each pasture you have, you can keep 1 cattle on this card.

cards.name: Cattle Feeder
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space, you can also buy 1 cattle for 1 food.

cards.name: Cattle Market
cards.text: When you play this card, return 1 Sheep to the supply and take 1 Cattle.

cards.name: Cattle Whisperer
cards.text: Add 5 and 9 to the current round. Place 1 Cattle on the corresponding Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Cattle.

cards.name: Ceilings
cards.text: Place 1 wood on the next 5 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood. Remove the wood promised by this card from future round spaces the next time you renovate.

cards.name: Ceramics
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Food. From now, the Pottery is a Minor Improvement for you and costs you nothing.

cards.name: Cesspit
cards.text: Alternate placing 1 clay and 1 wild boar on each remaining round space, starting with clay. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.

cards.name: Chain Float
cards.text: Add 7, 8, and 9 to the current round and place 1 field on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you can plow the field.

cards.name: Chairman
cards.text: Each time another player uses the "Meeting Place" action space, both they and you get 1 food (before taking the actions). If you use it, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Chamberlain
cards.text: At the start of Round 11 (or immediately, if you play this card after the start of Round 11), turn over the Round cards for the remaining rounds. You (and only you) can use these actions immediately; the other players must wait until the appropriate round.

cards.name: Chameleon
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Wild boar. You may keep 1 Wild boar in each of your pastures that hold Sheep. (Pastures can still only hold the normal amount of animals).

cards.name: Changeover
cards.text: At any time, if a field contains exactly 1 good as a result of a harvest, you can discard that good and immediately take a "Sow" action limited to that field.

cards.name: Changing Plans
cards.text: Immediately return 1 or 2 stables from your farmyard to your supply. Afterward, Plow 1 field for every stable returned (in the same or different space). (Normal plowing rules still apply.)

cards.name: Chanson Singer
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action, you may leave 1 Food on the space and take 1 Wood. You may leave a second Food for 1 Clay, a third for 1 Reed, and a fourth for 1 Stone.

cards.name: Chapel
cards.text: The Chapel is an additional Action space. Players who use this Action can return up to 2 Begging cards. Each Begging card costs 1 Stone, which is placed on the Chapel. At the end of the game, each Stone on this card is worth 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: Chapel
cards.text: This is an action space for all. A player who uses it gets 3 bonus points. If another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 grain.

cards.name: Chaplain
cards.text: Whenever another player uses a "Family growth" action, you may immediately afterward place a person out of turn.

cards.name: Charcoal Burner
cards.text: You receive 1 Food and 1 Wood whenever any player (including you) builds a Baking Improvement with a bread symbol.

cards.name: Cheese Carrier
cards.text: In the Breeding phase of each Harvest, you receive half a Food from the general supply for each other player who has at least 1 Sheep, rounded up. Also, you receive 1 Food for each other player who has at least 1 Cattle. (Your animals do not count.)

cards.name: Cheese Market
cards.text: At the end of each round that does not end with a Harvest, the player with the most dairy animals receives 1 Grain. (Dairy animals are Sheep and Cattle). Cattle count double in this calculation. If you tie for the most, only you receive the Grain. If two other players tie or no one has dairy animals, no one receives the Grain.

cards.name: Cheese Seller
cards.text: When you play this card, you may immediately buy 1 Sheep and/or 1 Cattle for 1 Food each. Whenever you end a round with the number of your Sheep plus twice the number of your Cattle greater than or equal to the current round number, you receive 1 Food. (If the current round ends with a Harvest, you may count your animals after the Harvest.)

cards.name: Chemist
cards.text: Whenever you use a person's action to take Wood from a building resource Accumulation space, you may immediately place 1 Clay from your supply on another building resource Accumulation space to receive 2 Food.

cards.name: Chick Stable
cards.text: Add 3 and 4 to the current round and place 2 food on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Chicken Coop
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on the next 8 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Chief
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each room in your Stone house. (In total, you receive 3 points per room instead of 2.) Playing this card costs an additional 2 Food.

cards.name: Chief Forester
cards.text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you also get a "Sow" action for exactly 1 field.

cards.name: Chief's Daughter
cards.text: If another player plays the "Chief" card, you can play this card immediately at no cost. (You can also play it using an Action space in the usual way.) At the end of the game, you receive 3 Bonus points if you have a Stone house, 1 if you have a Clay hut.

cards.name: Child Care Worker
cards.text: Whenever another player uses a "Family Growth" action, you may convert 1 Wood to 2 Food, or 1 Wood and 1 Reed to 5 Food.

cards.name: Child Ombudsman
cards.text: From round 5 on, if you have room in your house, at the end of each person action, you can take a "Family Growth" action with that person. If you do, you get 2 negative points.

cards.name: Child Prodigy
cards.text: Whenever you have Family growth, you can immediately pay 1 (or 2) Wood for 1 (or 2) Bonus points.

cards.name: Childless
cards.text: At the start of each round, if you have at least 3 rooms but only 2 people, you get 1 food and 1 crop of your choice (grain or vegetable)

cards.name: Chimney Sweep
cards.text: Renovating to stone costs you 2 stone less. During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each other player living in a stone house.

cards.name: Chimney Sweep
cards.text: Renovating to stone costs you 2 stone less. During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each other player living in a stone house.

cards.name: Chisel Maker
cards.text: Place an Arrow marker on a revealed Round Action space and point the Arrow toward nobody. The next player to use this space receives 1 Stone. Whenever any player uses this Action space, point the Arrow toward that player. At the start of each round, the player whom the Arrow points toward receives 1 Wood.

cards.name: Chocolate
cards.text: Place 4 Food from the supply on this card. This food can only be used to pay for Occupations.

cards.name: Choir Boy
cards.text: You may only play this Occupation when you have 3 or less resources and it is Round 11 or before. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Family member. (Resources are Grain, Vegetables, and building resources. You may return building resources to the general supply for nothing at any time.)

cards.name: Chophouse
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grain/Vegetable Seed" action space, place 1 food on each of the next 3/2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Christianity
cards.text: When you play this card, all other players get 1 food each.

cards.name: Chronicle
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each remaining Major Improvement on the Major Improvements Board. When these Improvements are acquired, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Church Warden
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, any player who performed actions with at least 5 people in Round 14 receives 3 Bonus points. (A Guest is counted.)

cards.name: Churchyard
cards.text: Place 2 food on each remaining round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food. (*Occupations and Improvements)

cards.name: Civic Facade
cards.text: Before the start of each round, if you have more occupations than improvements in your hand, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Clapper
cards.text: Whenever you use a "Family growth" action (or already have a person on that space when you play the Clapper), place 1 additional Grain on any of your fields that already contains at least 1 Grain.

cards.name: Claw Knife
cards.text: Each time you use the "Sheep Market" accumulation space, place 1 food on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Clay Baker
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Clay. At any time you may convert 1 Clay into 1 Food.

cards.name: Clay Carrier
cards.text: Wne you play this card, you immediately get 2 clay. At any time, but only once per round, you can buy 2 clay for 2 food.

cards.name: Clay Deliveryman
cards.text: Place 1 Clay on each of the spaces for rounds 6 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Clay.

cards.name: Clay Deposit
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space. A player who uses this action must pay you 1 Food and receives 5 Clay. If you use the Clay Deposit yourself, you may choose to take 2 Bonus points instead of the Clay.

cards.name: Clay Digger
cards.text: Include the "1 Clay" Action card from the 3-player game as an additional Clay pit. Immediately place 3 Clay on this card and add 1 Clay at the start of each round. Any player who uses this action must pay you 3 Food.

cards.name: Clay Embankment
cards.text: You immediately get 1 clay for every 2 clay you already have in your supply.

cards.name: Clay Firer
cards.text: You can use the Clay Firer at any time to convert 2/3 Clay to 1/2 Stone.

cards.name: Clay Hut Builder
cards.text: Once you live in a Clay hut, place 2 Clay on each of the next 5 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Clay. (If you already live in a Clay hut or a Stone house when you play this card, place the Clay on the Round spaces immediately.)

cards.name: Clay Hut Extension
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately extend you Clay hut by 1 room. (The room does not cost anything, but you must pay the cost shown to play this card.)

cards.name: Clay Kneader
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 2 clay. Each time after you use a "Grain Seeds" or "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you get 1 clay.

cards.name: Clay Mixer
cards.text: Whenever one of your people's actions gives you only Clay, you receive 2 additional Clay.

cards.name: Clay Oven
cards.text: "Bake Bread" action: At most 1 time Grain â†’ 5 Food When you build this improvement, you can immediately take a "Bake Bread" action.

cards.name: Clay Path
cards.text: The player with the most valuable street receives 2 Bonus points when scoring. (The Paved Road that cost 5 Stone is more valuable than this Clay Path which is more valuable than the Wooden Path that costs 1 Wood.)

cards.name: Clay Pit
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you receive 3 additional Clay.

cards.name: Clay Plasterer
cards.text: Renovating you Wooden hut to a Clay hut costs you only 1 Clay and 1 Reed. Each room of you Clay hut costs you 3 Clay and 2 Reed.

cards.name: Clay Puncher
cards.text: When you play this card and each time after you use a "Lessons" action space or the "Clay Pit" accumulation space, you get 1 clay.

cards.name: Clay Roof
cards.text: You can replace 1 or 2 Reed with the same amount of Clay whenever you extend or renovate your home.

cards.name: Clay Seller
cards.text: You can use the Clay Seller an any time to convert: 2 Clay to 1 Sheep or 1 Reed, 3 Clay to 1 Wild boar or 1 Stone, and/or 4 Clay to 1 Cattle.

cards.name: Clay Starter
cards.text: When you play this card, if you have only 2 rooms in your Wooden hut, immediately pay 1 Food to renovate it to Clay for free.

cards.name: Clay Supply
cards.text: Place 1 clay on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the clay.

cards.name: Clay Supply
cards.text: Place 1 clay on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the clay.

cards.name: Clay Supports
cards.text: Each time you build a clay room, you can pay 2 clay, 1 wood, and 1 reed instead of 5 clay and 2 reed.

cards.name: Clay Supports
cards.text: Whenever you add a room to your Clay hut, you can pay 2 Clay, 1 Wood and 1 Reed instead of 5 Clay and 2 Reed.

cards.name: Clay Thief
cards.text: Once this game, at the start of a work phase of your choice, you can turn this card face down to get all of the clay on the "Hollow" action space.

cards.name: Clay Warden
cards.text: Each time another player uses the "Hollow" accumulation space, you get 1 clay. In a 3-/4-player game, you also get 1 additional clay/food.

cards.name: Clay Worker
cards.text: Whenever you use an action to take Wood or Clay, you also receive 1 additional Clay.

cards.name: Claypipe
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, if you gained at least 7 building resources in the preceding work phase, you get 2 food.

cards.name: Cleanacre
cards.text: Each time you use the "Farmland", "Cultivation", or "Farming Supplies" action (the latter only being available with 6 players), you also get 2 clay.

cards.name: Clear Cutting
cards.text: Whenever you Plow 1 or more fields, you receive 1 Wood from the supply for each field you just plowed.

cards.name: Clearing Spade
cards.text: At any time, you can move 1 crop from a planted field containing at least 2 crops to an empty field.

cards.name: Clockwork Man
cards.text: Clockwork Man counts as 1 Occupation and 1 Minor Improvement.

cards.name: Clogs
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for a Clay hut or 2 Bonus points for a Stone house.

cards.name: Cloister Dweller
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each of the 5 columns of your farmyard that is either all rooms, all fields or all in the same pasture.

cards.name: Cloister Ruins
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Cloth Maker
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Take 1 Sheep" Action space, you receive 1 Sheep from the general supply. (If you use the Action space, you do not receive a benefit.)

cards.name: Club House
cards.text: Place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces and 1 stone on the round space after that. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.

cards.name: Clutch Drive
cards.text: Whenever you use the Round space with the number that is equal to the total of Wood in your supply, you receive 1 Wood from the general supply afterwards.

cards.name: Clutterer
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each card played after this on that has "accumulation space(s)" in its text.

cards.name: Cob
cards.text: At the start of each work phase, if you have at least 1 clay in your supply, you can exchange exactly 1 grain for 2 clay and 1 food.

cards.name: Cockaigne
cards.text: Once during the game, when you have at least 1 Food, 1 Grain, and 1 Vegetable in your personal supply and 1 Sheep and 1 Wild boar on your farmyard, you may choose to not place any people in a round and instead receive 7 Bonus points.

cards.name: Cocotte
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you can also play a Minor Improvement or pay 1 Food to play a Major Improvement.

cards.name: Coffee Break
cards.text: Place 1 Food on the next 5 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. If you play an Occupation before receiving the last Food, immediately remove this card's remaining Food from future Round spaces.

cards.name: Coffee House
cards.text: The Coffee House is an Action space for all players. Whenever a Player uses the Coffee House, that player and the card's owner each receive 1 Food from the general Supply. (If you use the card yourself, you receive 2 Food.) In the next Round, the Person from this space can be placed before the Starting player places his first Person.

cards.name: Collector
cards.text: This card is an action space for you only. When you use it for the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th time, you get 1 begging marker and 6/7/8/9 different good of your choice.

cards.name: Collector
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space for you only. When you use this Action space the 1st/ 2nd/ 3rd/ 4th time, you receive 1 Begging card and 6/7/8/9 different Goods of your choice. (Goods are Grain, Vegetables, building resources and animals.)

cards.name: Collier
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Clay Pit" or "Hollow" accumulation space, you get 1 wood. On "Clay Pit" you also get 1 additional reed.

cards.name: Comic Shop
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space for all players. It can only be used if the player using it has no more Family members in his home afterwards. In the Work phase of the following 2 rounds, that player may place up to 2 persons whenever it is his turn.

cards.name: Companion
cards.text: In the round you play this card, all Action spaces count as unoccupied for you. (Even if one of your people use it.) From now, Action spaces that are used by another player's last person count as unoccupied for you.

cards.name: Compulsory Education
cards.text: Whenever you have Family Growth, you can pay 1 Food to immediately play an Occupation. (If you can also play a Minor Improvement, you must first play the Occupation).

cards.name: Con Artist
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Traveling Players" action, they must pay you 1 Food and you receive 1 additional Food from the general supply. (You receive no benefit if you use the "Traveling Players" action.)

cards.name: Confidant
cards.text: Place 1 food from your supply on each of the next 2, 3, or 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food back and your choice of a "sow" or "Build Fences" action.

cards.name: Conjurer
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you receive 1 Grain in addition to the Food.

cards.name: Conservator
cards.text: You can renovate your Wooden hut to a Stone house without first needing to renovate it to a Clay hut.

cards.name: Conspiracy
cards.text: In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 1 Food for every 2 BI-Deck cards you have played. At the end of the game, every player receives 1/2/3 Bonus points for 1/3/5 played BI-Deck cards.

cards.name: Constable
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, any player who has no negative points receives 5 Bonus points.

cards.name: Consultant
cards.text: When you play this card in a 1-/2-/3-/4- player game, you immediately get 2 grain/3 clay/2 reed/2 sheep.

cards.name: Contortionist
cards.text: Place 4 Wood, 3 Clay, 2 Reed, and 2 Stone in a container. Whenever you take the "Traveling Players" action, draw 2 resources at random. If they are the same, keep both. If they are different keep 1 and return the other to the general supply.

cards.name: Contractor
cards.text: Whenever you build a room, renovate your home, or build a Major Improvement, you can replace up to 1 Building resource of your choice with 1 Food.

cards.name: Convict Number 24601
cards.text: Starting from next round, you cannot take actions with 1 of your Family members. At the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus Points for every round after playing this card, including the current round.

cards.name: Cook
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, only 2 of your people eat 2 Food each; all others are satisfied with only 1 Food.

cards.name: Cookery Lesson
cards.text: Each time you use a "Lesson" action space and a cooking improvement on the same turn, you get 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Cookery Outfitter
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each cooking improvement you have.

cards.name: Cookies
cards.text: For each Grain that you Bake, you may place 1 Food from your supply in 1 of your rooms. You may have a maximum of 1 Food in each room. You cannot use these Food any more, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.

cards.name: Cooking Corner
cards.text: At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 4 Food Sheep: 2 Food Wild boar: 3 Food Cattle: 4 Food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 3 Food.

cards.name: Cooking Hearth
cards.text: At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 3 Food Sheep: 2 Food Wild boar: 3 Food Cattle: 4 Food Whenever you use the "Bake bread: action, you may convert: Grain: 3 Food.

cards.name: Cooking Hearth
cards.text: At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 3 Food Sheep: 2 Food Wild boar: 3 Food Cattle: 4 Food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 3 Food.

cards.name: Cooking Hearth
cards.text: At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 3 Food Sheep: 2 Food Wild boar: 3 Food Cattle: 4 Food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 3 Food.

cards.name: Cooking Hearth Extension
cards.text: Each harvest, you can use each of your cooking improvements once to get double the amount of food for 1 animal or vegetable.

cards.name: Cooper
cards.text: Whenever you or another player receives more than 2 Food from an Action space, you receive 1 Food from the General supply.

cards.name: Cooperative Plower
cards.text: Each time you use the "Farmland" action space while the "Grain Seeds" action space is occupied, you can plow 1 additional field.

cards.name: Copse
cards.text: When you Sow, you can plant up to 2 Wood on this card as shown. The Wood is treated the same as sown Grain and is harvested during the Field phase. (This card does not count as a Field when scoring.)

cards.name: Cordmaker
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) takes at least 2 reed from the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can choose to take 1 grain or buy 1 vegetable for 2 food.

cards.name: Corf
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) takes at least 3 stone from an accumulation space, you get 1 stone from the general supply.

cards.name: Corn Maze
cards.text: At the start of each round, you receive 1 Wood and 1 Reed if you have 4 Grain fields arranged in 2x2. (In the Field phase of each Harvest, you may not skip harvesting.)

cards.name: Corn Profiteer
cards.text: You can convert 1 Grain to 3 Food at any time. Any other player can stop this by paying you 2 Food to buy the Grain for themself. If more than one player offers, you choose one of them.

cards.name: Corn Schnapps Distillery
cards.text: Once per round, you can pay 1 grain to place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Corn Scoop
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space, you get 1 additional grain.

cards.name: Corn Scoop
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action, you receive 1 additional Grain.

cards.name: Corn Sheaf
cards.text: When you play this card, take 1 Grain.

cards.name: Corn Storehouse
cards.text: Whenever you have empty Fields after the Field phase of the Harvest, you can Sow Grain in them immediately. Place 1 fewer Grain from the Supply on these fields.

cards.name: Cornrick
cards.text: Place 1 Grain each on the spaces for rounds 7 and 9. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Grain.

cards.name: Corral
cards.text: You may keep up to 2 animals of the same type on each unsowed field orthogonally adjacent to your home. Different Corrals may hold different types of animals. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each of these fields that holds at least 1 animal.

cards.name: Corral Builder
cards.text: When the "Pig Market" and "Cattle Market" action space cards are each revealed (and placed on the round space), you can immediately fence exactly 1 farmyard space without playing wood.

cards.name: Cosmographer
cards.text: Place 1 Reed and 1 Stone from the general supply on different Unused farmyard spaces. These spaces still count as Unused. You may take the Reed and Stone into your supply at any time. At the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus points if Sheep and the Reed share the same farmyard space. The same applies for Wild boar and the Stone.

cards.name: Cottager
cards.text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can also either build exactly 1 room or renovate your house. Either way, you have to pay the cost.

cards.name: Country Doctor
cards.text: Once during the game, when you have 3 planted fields, you may play the "Family growth" action as "Family growth even without room.

cards.name: Countryman
cards.text: After all players have placed their Family members, you may move one of your Family members from a "Take 1 Grain" or "Take 1 Vegetable" Action space to a free "Sow" Action space after you have taken the Grain or Vegetable.

cards.name: Courtyard Garden
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus points for each Unused farmyard space orthogonally adjacent to your Stone house. (These spaces still count as unused when scoring.)

cards.name: Covetous Farmer
cards.text: Once each round, during one of your turns, you may take 1 Building resource from the general supply of a type that you do not have and every other player does have.

cards.name: Cow Bell
cards.text: You may keep up to 2 Cattle on each Unused space on your farmyard, to a maximum of 4 Cattle. (The spaces still count as unused.)

cards.name: Cow Prince
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each space in your farmyard (including rooms) holding at least 1 cattle.

cards.name: Cowboy
cards.text: You can use the "Take 1 Sheep", "Wild boar" or "Cattle" Action spaces even if they are occupied. If you do this, take 1 animal of that type. Additionally, you can keep 2 animals of the same type on 1 of your Unused farmyard spaces. (The space still counts as unused.)

cards.name: Cowboy And Mother
cards.text: From Round 4 on, at the end of any Work phase in which you used 2 or fewer Action spaces and have 2 or fewer Family members, you receive 1 Food. From Round 8/12, you may choose to receive an animal/Plow 1 field instead.

cards.name: Cowherd
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Cattle" Action space, you receive 1 additional Cattle from the supply. (The "Take 1 Cattle" Action is added in Stage 4.)

cards.name: Crack Weeder
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. For each vegetable you take from a field in the field phase of a harvest, you also get 1 food.

cards.name: Craft Brewery
cards.text: In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange 1 grain from your supply plus 1 grain from a field for 2 bonus points and 4 food.

cards.name: Craft Teacher
cards.text: Each time after you build the major improvement "Joinery", "Pottery", and "Basketmaker's Workshop", you can play up to 2 occupations without paying an occupation cost.

cards.name: Craftsmanship Promoter
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 stone. You can build any of the major improvements in the bottom row of the supply board even when taking a "Minor Improvement" action.

cards.name: Credit
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 5 food. At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you must pay 1 food, or else take a begging marker.

cards.name: Crib
cards.text: At the end of any Work phase in which you have taken a "Family Growth" action, you may take 2 Food from the general supply or pay 2 Food for 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: Crooked Plow
cards.text: Once during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" action, you can Plow 3 fields instead of 1. This does not apply to the "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action.

cards.name: Crop Rotator
cards.text: Whenever you remove the last Grain/Vegetable from a field, you may immediately Sow a Vegetable/ Grain in that field. When you play this card, immediately take 1 Grain or Vegetable from each of your fields and place them in your supply.

cards.name: Cross-Cut Wood
cards.text: You immediately get a number of wood equal to the number of stone in your supply.

cards.name: Cross-Cut Wood
cards.text: You immediately get a number of wood equal to the number of stone in your supply.

cards.name: Crown Prince
cards.text: In Round 14, immediately before the Starting player places his first person, you may use 1 of your people to use all the Action spaces for Rounds 11,12,13 and 14 in any order. Leave your person on the last space you used. The Work phase is over for you. (You cannot place anymore people.)
