cards.name: CruditÃ©
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately buy exactly 1 vegetable for 3 food. At any time, you can discard 1 vegetable on top of another vegetable in a field to get 4 food.

cards.name: Cube Cutter
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. In the field phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 wood and 1 food for 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Cube Cutter
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. In the field phase of each harvest, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 wood and 1 food for 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Cube Cutter
cards.text: During the Field phase of each Harvest, you can exchange 1 Wood and 1 Food for 1 Bonus point. (Note the Bonus points in the appropriate section of the scoring pad.)

cards.name: Culinary Artist
cards.text: Each time another player uses the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can exchange your choice of 1 grain/sheep/vegetable for 4/5/7 food.

cards.name: Cultivator
cards.text: For each new field tile you get, you also get 1 wood and 1 food.

cards.name: Curator
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, if you return at least 3 people from accumulation spaces, you can buy 1 bonus point for 1 food.

cards.name: Custard
cards.text: You immediately receive 1 Food for every Harvest remaining when you play this card. Whenever you take Stone from an Accumulation space leave 1 Stone on the space.

cards.name: Cut Willows
cards.text: Place 2 Wood from the general supply on this card. Whenever you take Wood from an Accumulation space, this card gets 1 additional Wood. Whenever you pay at least 1 Wood with a person's action, you may use 1 Wood from this card as payment.

cards.name: Cypress
cards.text: Immediately remove the person who played this Minor Improvement from the game completely. This person does not occupy space in your home anymore. (You can only play this card using a Family member's action. The Cypress stands for death and mourning. *without guest)

cards.name: Dance Instructor
cards.text: You receive 4 Food before you pay the costs of playing this Occupation. Immediately return this card to your hand.

cards.name: Dancer
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you receive at least 4 Food. (If there are 1 to 3 Food are on the space, take Food from the general supply until you total 4 Food.)

cards.name: Dancer and Spy
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you may move any person from an Action space with exactly 1 person on it to "Traveling players" also. (They don't use action.) Afterward, you may immediately use the freed Action space with another person.

cards.name: Deaconess
cards.text: As long as you have exactly 2 Family members, in the Feeding phase of Harvest 1/2/3/4/5/6, you receive 1/2/3/4/5/6 Food.

cards.name: Debris Dealer
cards.text: When you renovate your Clay hut, you receive 2 Clay afterward. Once you live in a Clay hut or Stone house, whenever another player renovates their Wooden/Clay hut, you receive 2 Wood/Clay.

cards.name: Debt Collector
cards.text: When you play this card, place a Guest token on any Round space at least 3 higher than the current round. At the start of that round, pay the Starting player (which may be you) 1 Food and place the Guest. After that, play starts with the starting player as usual.

cards.name: Debt Security
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each major improvement you have, up to the number of your unused farmyard spaces.

cards.name: Den Builder
cards.text: When you live in a clay or stone house, you can pay 1 grain and 2 food. If you do, for the rest of the game, this card provides room for exactly one person.

cards.name: Diamond Mine
cards.text: Place 1 Stone each on the next 2 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Stone.

cards.name: Diamond Trading Post
cards.text: Place 3 Stone from the general supply on this card. At any time, you can move these Stone in your supply. At the start of each Harvest, if you have more Stone in your supply than there are on this card, you may return 1 Stone on this card for a pair of animals. You receive Sheep/ Wild boar/ Cattle with the 1st/ 2nd/ 3rd return.

cards.name: Diary
cards.text: Whenever you play an Occupation, you receive 1 Wood.

cards.name: Digging Spade
cards.text: Each time you use a clay accumulation space, you also get a number of food equal to the number of wild boar in your farmyard.

cards.name: Diplomat
cards.text: Once during Round 14, you may use an Action space even if it is occupied by other players. If you play this card in Round 7 or before, you may do this twice instead.

cards.name: Discoverer
cards.text: Add 3 to the current round number and place the person who played this Occupation on the corresponding round space. (It is no longer considered part of your family until then.) At the start of that round, you receive the person back, even if you have no room in your home, and you receive 2 Food, 1 Bonus point, and 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Distant Princess
cards.text: If there are still 6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, the player who grew to 5 Family members last receives 2 Bonus points.

cards.name: District Manager
cards.text: At the end of each work phase, if you used both the "Forest" and "Grove" accumulation spaces, you get 5 food.

cards.name: Ditch
cards.text: When you Sow, you can plant Vegetables between orthogonally adjacent field tiles as though the gaps were fields. (These gaps do not count as fields when scoring.)

cards.name: Dock Worker
cards.text: At any time, you can use the Dock Worker to convert 3 Wood to either 1 Clay, 1 Reed or 1 Stone, or to convert 2 Clay, 2 Reed or 2 Stone to 1 other building resource.

cards.name: Docker
cards.text: At the start of each Work phase, you may take 1 Building resource of your choice from the general supply. If you take Stone or Reed, skip your first chance to place a worker this Round (you still get to take the Action later). If you take Wood or Clay, skip your second chance to place a worker instead.

cards.name: Domestician Expert
cards.text: You can keep 2 sheep on the border between each pair of orthogonally adjacent rooms.

cards.name: Domestician Expert
cards.text: You can keep 2 sheep on the border between each pair of orthogonally adjacent rooms.

cards.name: Donkey
cards.text: From now on, one of your pastures can not contain animals. (Mark this pasture with 1 Clay from the general supply.) Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action space, you may Plow 1 additional field.

cards.name: Double-Turn Plow
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately plow up to 2 fields.

cards.name: Doula
cards.text: As long as you did not have family growth yet, whenever one of your opponents grows their family, you receive 1 Grain from the general supply.

cards.name: Dove Hunter
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, the Chandler can convert either 1 Sheep to 4 Food or 1 Cattle to 6 Food.

cards.name: Dovecote
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on the spaces for rounds 10 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Downsizing
cards.text: Once during the game, when you build at least 1 fence, you may return 1 Wooden room that you built this game and build up to 7 additional fences from your supply at no cost. If there was a person in that room, move them into the rest of your home.

cards.name: Dozing Bull
cards.text: As long as you have at least 1 Cattle in your farm, you can knock down your fences and rebuild them at any time, for no cost. (Your animals do not run away.) (Fences must always be placed according to the rules.)

cards.name: Drained Pond
cards.text: Add 4 to the current round and place 1 field on the corresponding Round space. At the start of that round, you may pay 1 Food to add the field to your farm.

cards.name: Draw Well
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each remaining even numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Drawing Genius
cards.text: Immediately after using the most recent Round card, you may play 1 Major or Minor Improvement. (Pay costs for the Improvement normally.)

cards.name: Drift-Net Boat
cards.text: Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get an additional 2 food.

cards.name: Drill Harrow
cards.text: Each time before you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you can pay 3 food to plow 1 field.

cards.name: Drinker of Absinthe
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on the spaces for rounds 7 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Drinking Trough
cards.text: Each pasture (with or without a stable) can hold up to 2 more animals.

cards.name: Drudgery Reeve
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 1/2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with 1+/2+/3+ building resources of each type gets 1/3/5 bonus points.

cards.name: Duck Pond
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each of the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Dunghill
cards.text: Whenever you have 2/3 different types of animals at the beginning of the Field phase, you may add 1 more resource on 1/2 of your planted fields (or planted cards). (Animal cards like House Goat do not count, but animals kept on cards do.)

cards.name: Dutch Claypipe
cards.text: In the Returning Home phase after each Work phase where you gained at least 7 building resources, you receive 2 Food.

cards.name: Dutch Mountains
cards.text: You immediately receive 1 Stone.

cards.name: Dutch Windmill
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action in a round immediately following a Harvest, you receive 2 additional Food.

cards.name: Dutch Windmill
cards.text: Each time you take a "Bake Bread" action in a round immediately following a harvest, you get 3 additional food.

cards.name: Dwelling Mound
cards.text: Whenever you Plow, you must pay 1 Food for each new field.

cards.name: Dwelling Plan
cards.text: You can immediately take a "Renovation" action.

cards.name: Early Cattle
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 cattle.

cards.name: Early Grain
cards.text: Immediately harvest 1 Grain from each of your Grain fields.

cards.name: Early Riser
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Sheep. For you, the Breeding phase of the Harvest precedes the Field and Feeding phases. You may immediately cook baby animals if you do not have room to keep them.

cards.name: Earthenware Potter
cards.text: If you play this card in round 4 or before, after the final harvest, you get 1 bonus point for each person for which you then pay 1 clay.

cards.name: East India Company
cards.text: Place 1 Grain, 1 Vegetable, 1 Sheep, 1 Wild Boar, 1 Cattle, 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed, and 1 Stone on this card. At the start of each round, before Phase 1, you randomly take 1 good. (Goods on this card at the end of the game do nothing.)

cards.name: Ebonist
cards.text: Each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 wood into 1 food and 1 grain.

cards.name: Ebony Shoe
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Clay. After playing this card, the next player to have no Unused farmyard spaces receives 3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Edible Roots
cards.text: Whenever you harvest the last good from a field and place it in your supply, you receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Education Bonus
cards.text: After you play your 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th occupation this game, you immediately get 1 grain/clay/reed/stone/vegetable/field (not retroactively).

cards.name: Educational Building
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space for you only. The first time you use your 3rd and/or 4th Family member this game, you may use it on this card and alternate placing 1 Wood and 1 Stone on each remaining Round space. Start with Wood. At the start of these rounds, you receive the resource.

cards.name: Educator
cards.text: Whenever another player plays an Occupation card, you can pay 3 Food to play one yourself. From you 4th Occupation on, this only costs 2 Food. (If you play an Occupation yourself, you cannot use this card to play a second Occupation.)

cards.name: Elder
cards.text: When you play this card, place 2 Food from the general supply on it. After each Returning home phase, you may return 1 Food from this card to use the "Fishing" or "Bake bread" action without placing a person. You can use the Food on this card at any time without the additional action.

cards.name: Elephantgrass Plant
cards.text: Immediately after each harvest, you can use this card to exchange exactly 1 reed for 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Emergency Housing
cards.text: Select 1 of your built Stables. It is now a Room for one of your Family members. The Stable loses its original function, but is still worth 1 additional point if fenced.

cards.name: Emissary
cards.text: At any time, you can place a good from your supply on this card to get 1 stone. You must place different goods on this card. (Food is also considered a good.)

cards.name: Employer
cards.text: Add 4,7, and 10 to the current Round and place 1 Guest token on each corresponding Round space. In those rounds, you may place the Guest token once as you would a person and return it after the Work phase. (The Guests do not need room in your home.)

cards.name: Encircling Wall
cards.text: When you play this card, you may immediately fence 1 space in your farmyard. (You do not need to pay Wood for the fences).

cards.name: Endive Field
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable. In Rounds that end with a Harvest, you may Sow Vegetables on this card as if it were 1 field. (This card counts as a field but not for scoring.)

cards.name: Engineer
cards.text: Whenever you play an Improvement, you receive 1 Food before paying the costs of the Improvement. If the Improvement has a printed Stone cost, you receive 2 Food instead of 1.

cards.name: Environmentalist
cards.text: Whenever you play or buy an Improvement, you can replace 1 Building resource of your choice with 1 Wood.

cards.name: Equipper
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can play a minor improvement.

cards.name: Errant Oven
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Established Person
cards.text: If your house has exactly 2 rooms, immediately renovate it without paying any building resources. If you do, you can immediately afterward take a "Build Fences" action.

cards.name: Estate Manager
cards.text: At the end of a 3/4/5 player game, if no player has more animals of any type than you, you receive 2/3/4 Bonus points.

cards.name: Estate Master
cards.text: Once you have no unused farmyard spaces left, you get 1 bonus point for each vegetable that you harvest.

cards.name: Estate Worker
cards.text: Place 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 stone in this order on the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective building resource.

cards.name: Eternal Rye Cultivation
cards.text: After each harvest in which you have 2 or 3+ grain in your supply, you get 1 food and 1 additional grain, respectively.

cards.name: Evening Prayer
cards.text: If you have 1/2 plowed fields, immediately pay 1/2 Food to play 1/2 Occupations.

cards.name: Excavator
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Wood and 1 Clay.

cards.name: Excavator
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you get 1 additional wood and clay, and you can buy 1 stone for 1 food.

cards.name: Excursion to the Quarry
cards.text: You immediately get a number of stone equal to the number of people you have.

cards.name: Expert Builder
cards.text: Whenever any player (including you) builds 1 or more rooms, they must place 1 resource of those paid on this card. You may use these resources to pay for your extensions or renovations.

cards.name: Extra Effort
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately build a Major Improvement. (Pay costs for the Improvement normally).

cards.name: Facades Carving
cards.text: When you play this card, you can exchange any number of food for 1 bonus point each, up to the number of completed harvests.

cards.name: Family Counselor
cards.text: Whenever at the end of a Work phase all of your adult Family members were placed on the same piece of cardboard, you receive 1 Food, if it were 2 Adults. For 3 Adults, you receive 1 Grain. For 4+ Adults, you receive 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Family Friend Home
cards.text: Each time you take a "Build Rooms" action while having more rooms than people already, you also get a "Family Growth" action and 1 food.

cards.name: Family Planner
cards.text: Add 4, 7 and 10 to the current round and place up to 1 person still in your supply on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds and not earlier, you may take the person as a new Family member, if you have room. It counts as a Newborn, and may take actions the following round.

cards.name: Family Portrait
cards.text: Pay 2 Food for each of your Family members, and receive 4 Bonus points. (Write them on the scoring pad).

cards.name: Family Singers
cards.text: During the Action phase, you can place any number of People on the Family Singers space instead of on an Action space. For each Person you place on the space, you receive 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: Farm Building
cards.text: Each time you build a major improvement, place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Farm Cart
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Sow" action, you can Sow 1 Grain on an existing Vegetable field or 1 Vegetable on an existing Grain field. (You can have at most 1 pile of Vegetables and 1 pile Grain on each field.)

cards.name: Farm Hand
cards.text: Once you have 4 field tiles arranged in a 2x2, you can use a "Build Stables" action to build a stable in the center of the 2x2. This stable provides room for a person but no animal.

cards.name: Farm Lawyer
cards.text: Immediately take Food from the general supply until you have as much Food as another player of your choice has in their supply. Afterward, pass this card to that player who adds it to his/her hand. Place a face-down card from the deck in front of you to indicate a played Occupation.

cards.name: Farm School
cards.text: Whenever you harvest at least 2 goods during the Field phase of a Harvest, you may immediately afterward pay 2 Food to play an Occupation.

cards.name: Farm School Graduate
cards.text: You may only play this card as your first Occupation. From now, you may not use any Occupation action on any Action space. At the start of each Harvest, you may pay 2 Food to play an Occupation.

cards.name: Farm Steward
cards.text: Once you live in a Clay hut or Stone house, play your next "Family growth" action as "Family growth even without room." (Similar to the Round card from Stage 5. All future Family growth is carried out as normal.)(If you use the Stage 2 Family growth space to take this action, you can still play a Minor Improvement afterwards.)

cards.name: Farm Store
cards.text: After the feeding phase of each harvest, you can exchange exactly 1 food for 2 different building resources of your choice or 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Farmer
cards.text: The next time you build fences, take 1 Wild boar. Each time you build at least 1 fence after that, take 1 Cattle.

cards.name: Farmer's Daughter
cards.text: Once you have built a Clay hut, place 1 Grain on each remaining even numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Grain. (If you already have a Clay hut or Stone house when you play this card, place the Grain immediately.)

cards.name: Farmers Market
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Farmers' Ball
cards.text: When this card is played, each Player who immediately pays 5 Food into the general Supply receives 3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Farmstead
cards.text: After each turn in which you make at least one unused farmyard space used, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Farmyard Manure
cards.text: Each time you build 1 or more stables in one turn, you place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Farmyard Worker
cards.text: At the end of each work phase in which you placed at least 1 good on 1 of your farmyard spaces, you get 2 food.

cards.name: Fast Mason
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you can renovate your house to clay/stone without paying reed.

cards.name: Fatstock Stretcher
cards.text: Each time you turn a sheep or wild boar into food using a baking improvement, you get 1 additional food.

cards.name: Feed Fence
cards.text: For each new stable you build, you get 1 foodâ€”for your last one, get 3 food. Each time you build stables, you can build exactly 1 stable for 1 clay instead of wood.

cards.name: Feed Pellets
cards.text: During the Feeding Phase of each Harvest, you may trade 1 Vegetable for 1 of any type of Animal that you already have in your farmyard.

cards.name: Feeding Dish
cards.text: Each time you use an animal accumulation space while already having an animal of that type, you get 1 grain.

cards.name: Feedyard
cards.text: This card can hold 1 animal for each pasture you have, even different types. After the breeding phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each unused spot on this card.

cards.name: Fellow Grazer
cards.text: During scoring, you get 2 bonus points of reach pasture you have covering at least 3 farmyard spaces.

cards.name: Fence Builder
cards.text: When you play this card, place one of your fences on an Action space of your choice. If you use an action on the Action space, you can also build fences as an additional action. (From now on, you only have 14 fences available for building.)

cards.name: Fence Dealer
cards.text: You may only build 12 fences. (Remove the other 3 fences from the game.) Whenever you build fences you may build 2 fences for every 1 Wood paid.

cards.name: Fence Deliveryman
cards.text: Add 6 and 10 to the current round. Place 4 of your fences on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you can pay 2 Food to build all 4 fences immediately. (You may build fewer than 4 fences. You do not need to pay Wood to build the fences.)

cards.name: Fence Helper
cards.text: Whenever another player builds at least 1 fence, you may pay that player 1 Food to immediately take the "Fences" action. (Pay costs normally).

cards.name: Fence Overseer
cards.text: Each round, for a cost of 1 Food, you can immediately Fence a pasture of 1 farmyard space around a stable that you just built. You do not need to pay Wood for the fences.

cards.name: Fencer
cards.text: Whenever another player builds 1 to 4 fences, you receive 1 Wood from the supply. Whenever another player builds 5 or more fences, you receive 2 Wood. (If you build fences yourself, you receive no benefit.)

cards.name: Fencing Master
cards.text: Whenever you play an Occupation (including this one), place up to 2 fences from your supply on this card. From your 4th Occupation on, place up to 1 fence instead. You build these fences for free when taking a "Fences" Action.

cards.name: Fern Seeds
cards.text: You get 2 food and 1 grain, which you must sow immediately.

cards.name: Fertility Shrine
cards.text: In the Breeding phase of each Harvest, if 2 or more animal types in your farm breed, you may return 2 newborn animals to the general supply and immediately take a "Family growth even without room" action. (You must have room for the baby animals on your farm first.)

cards.name: Festival Hall
cards.text: After the Field phase of a Harvest, you can use the Festival Hall to convert 1 Grain to 1 Building resource of your choice and 2 Food.

cards.name: Fiddler
cards.text: At the end of each round in which you did not receive any Building resources, you receive 1 Wood. If its an even-numbered round, you additionally receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Field
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Field Caretaker
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately exchange 0/1/3 clay for 1/2/3 grain. This card is a field.

cards.name: Field Clay
cards.text: You immediately get 1 clay for each planted field you have.

cards.name: Field Counter
cards.text: Each time another player plows a field, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.

cards.name: Field Cultivator
cards.text: Pile 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, 1 stone, 1 reed, 1 clay, and 1 wood on this card. Each time you harvest a field tile, you can also take the top good from the pile.

cards.name: Field Fences
cards.text: You can immediately take a "Build Fences" action, during which you do not have to pay wood for fences that you build next to field tiles.

cards.name: Field Merchant
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 reed. Each time you decline a "Minor/Major Improvement" action, you get 1 food/vegetable instead.

cards.name: Field Messenger
cards.text: Randomly choose 1 of your Unused farmyard spaces. Rules permitting, you may either fence this space or build a stable there without paying Wood. Alternatively, you may Plow 1 field there.

cards.name: Field Overseer
cards.text: Each time the other players harvest grain from at least 3/4/6 fields combined, you get 1 food/grain/vegetable.

cards.name: Field Warden
cards.text: You can use the "Take 1 Vegetable", "Plow 1 field" and "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action even if another player has placed a person on the space.

cards.name: Field Watchman
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action space, you can also Plow up to 1 field.

cards.name: Field Worker
cards.text: Whenever another player Sows one or more fields, you receive 1 Grain in a 3-player game or 1 Food in a 4 or 5 player game.

cards.name: Fieldsman
cards.text: Whenever you Sow 1 field, place 2 extra goods from the supply on it. Whenever you Sow 2 fields, place 1 extra good from the supply on each. (If you Sow three or more fields, there is no advantage.)

cards.name: Final Scenario
cards.text: Place the action space card for round 14 face up in front of you. Only you can use it until it is placed on the game board.

cards.name: Fire Protection Pond
cards.text: Once you no longer live in a wooden house, place 1 food on each of the next 6 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Fireplace
cards.text: At any time: Vegetable â†’ 2 Food; Sheep â†’ 2 Food; Wild boar â†’ 2 Food; Cattle â†’ 3 Food "Bake Bread" action: Grain â†’ 2 Food

cards.name: Fireplace
cards.text: At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 2 Food Sheep: 2 Food Wild boar: 2 Food Cattle: 3 Food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 2 Food.

cards.name: Fireplace
cards.text: At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 2 Food Sheep: 2 Food Wild boar: 2 Food Cattle: 3 Food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 2 Food.

cards.name: Firewood
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, place 1 wood on this card. Each time before you build a Fireplace, Cooking Hearth, or oven, move up to 4 wood from this card to your supply.

cards.name: Firewood Collector
cards.text: Each time you use the "Farmland", "Grain Seeds", Grain Utilization", or "Cultivation" action space, at the end of that turn, you get 1 wood.

cards.name: Fish Farm
cards.text: Whenever another player takes the "Fishing" action, you can take 1 Grain or Vegetable from each of your planted fields and place it in your personal supply. (This also applies to field cards.)

cards.name: Fish Farmer
cards.text: Each time there is 1/2/3+ food on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get an additional 2 food on the "Reed Bank"/ "Clay Pit"/ "Grove" accumulation spaces.

cards.name: Fish Hook
cards.text: Whenever you use an Action space orthogonally adjacent to the "Fishing" Action space, you may immediately take 1 Food from the "Fishing" Action space if there is Food on that space.

cards.name: Fish Pond
cards.text: Place 1 Clay from the general supply on 1 Unused farmyard space. It now counts as used. Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may place some or all of the Food on this card. At the end of the game, you receive -1/1/2/3/4 Bonus points for 0/1/4/6/8 Food on this card.

cards.name: Fish Seller
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may use Food that you take from the Action space (but not Fishing cards) to buy up to 2 (same or different) items. One building resource costs 1 Food. One Grain, Sheep or Wild boar costs 2 Food. One Vegetable or Cattle costs 3 Food.

cards.name: Fish Trap
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space or receive Reed from an Action space that provides Reed, you receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Fisherman
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you can choose to take twice as much Food as is on the space. If you do this, you must give 1 Food each to the Fishing Rod, Raft, Canoe, Fish Trap and Landing Net.

cards.name: Fisherman's Apprentice
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Fishing" Action space, you may pay that player 1 Food to play an Occupation.

cards.name: Fisherman's Friend
cards.text: At the start of each round, if there is more food on the "Traveling Players" than on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get the difference from the general supply.

cards.name: Fishing Pier
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may also take 1 Building resource from any other Action space.

cards.name: Fishing Rod
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive 1 additional Food. From Round 8, you receive 2 additional Food.

cards.name: Five Rings
cards.text: Whenever you play an Improvement, pay 1 Wood/Stone less if you chose Wood/Stone as the cost of this card. (Mark this card with 1 Wood/Stone from the supply.)

cards.name: Five-Year-Plan
cards.text: Mark 1 empty Field with a green arrow marker. You will never be able to Sow this field. The marked Field is no longer scored as a Field but only as a used Farmyard space. You can immediately Sow your remaining empty Fields. Place 2 additional Grain or Vegetables on each Field that you plant this way.

cards.name: Flagon
cards.text: Whenever the Well is built or upgraded to a Village Well, you receive 4 Food, and the other players receive 1 Food each. (If the Well has already been built, everyone receives the Food when the Flagon is played.)

cards.name: Flail
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" actions, you can also take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Flat Hill
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately Renovate your Wooden hut to a Clay hut for free.

cards.name: Flemish Patriot
cards.text: In each even-numbered round, you receive 1 Food after you use your first Action space. Afterward, place 1 Food from the general supply on each unoccupied Action space in the same game board column as that space. The next player to use these spaces receives the Food (even in a following round).

cards.name: Flower Pots
cards.text: If you play this in Round 6 or before, place 1 Vegetable on the space for Round 8. At the start of this round, you receive the Vegetable.

cards.name: Flying Housewife
cards.text: Whenever you use your second Family member to use the "Family growth" Action space in Stage 2, you may immediately afterward move it and use another Action space. The "Family growth" Action space remains occupied by your newborn.

cards.name: Fodder Chamber
cards.text: During scoring in a game with 1/2/3/4+ players, you get 1 bonus point for every 7th/5th/4th/3rd animal on your farm.

cards.name: Fodder Planter
cards.text: In the breeding phase of each harvest, for each newborn animal you get, you can sow crops in exactly 1 field.

cards.name: Foie Gras
cards.text: Whenever you use either the "Fishing" or "1 Reed" Action space on the middle game board, you get 2 Food if another person uses the other Action space later during this Work phase. (If the other Action space is already used, you gain nothing.)

cards.name: Fold Builder
cards.text: This card is an action space for all. It provides a "Build Fences" action and then 1 sheep. If another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 food.

cards.name: Food Basket
cards.text: You immediately get 1 grain and 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Food Chest
cards.text: If you play this card on the "Major Improvement" action space, you immediately get 4 food. Otherwise, you get only 2 food.

cards.name: Food Connoisseur
cards.text: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 Clay, Vegetable, Stone, Grain, Wood, Reed on this card. Whenever you use a person to take Food from the "Day Laborer", "Fishing" or "Traveling Players" Action space, additionally take the top item on this card.

cards.name: Food Critic
cards.text: The next time you use the "Fishing" Action space, place 1 Food from the supply on this card. Whenever you Bake bread or convert animals, Vegetables, or building resources to Food, you may place that good on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/4/6 Bonus points for 4/5/6/7+ different items on this card.

cards.name: Food Distributor
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain and, at the start of this returning home phase, an amount of food equal to the number of occupied action space cards.

cards.name: Food Merchant
cards.text: For each grain you harvest from a field, you can buy 1 vegetable for 3 food. If you harvest the last grain from a field, the vegatble costs you only 2 food.

cards.name: Footman
cards.text: Once each round, you may place a person on an Action space without immediately taking the action. Instead, you may take that action immediately after any of your other turns that round. At the end of that round, if you haven't taken the action, you receive 1 Begging card.

cards.name: Foreign Aid
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 6 food. You may no longer use the action spaces of rounds 12 to 14.

cards.name: Foreman
cards.text: At the start of the Work phase, you can place 1 Food from the general supply on an Action space of your choice.

cards.name: Forest Campaigner
cards.text: Each time before you place a person, if there are at least 8 wood total on accumulation spaces, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Forest Clearer
cards.text: Each time you obtain exactly 2/3/4 wood from a wood accumulation space, you get 1 additional wood and 1/0/1 food.

cards.name: Forest Farmer
cards.text: Place 3 Arrow markers on this card. Each round, between the Work and Returning home phase, you may pay 1 Wood and return 1 marker to move one of your people from the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action space to a free Action space and take the action.

cards.name: Forest Guardian
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 wood. Each time before another player takes at least 5 wood from an accumulation space, they must first pay you 1 food.

cards.name: Forest Inn
cards.text: This is an action space for all. A player who uses it can exchange 5/7/9 wood for 8 wood and 2/4/7 food. When another player uses it, they must first pay you 1 food.

cards.name: Forest Lake Hut
cards.text: Each time you use the "Fishing"/"Forest" accumulation space, you also get 1 wood/food.

cards.name: Forest Owner
cards.text: This card is an action space for all. If another player uses it, they get 3 wood and must give you 1 wood from the general supply. If you use it, you get 4 wood.

cards.name: Forest Pasture
cards.text: This card can hold an unlimited number of Wild boar. (This card does not count as a pasture when scoring.)

cards.name: Forest Plow
cards.text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can pay 2 wood to plow 1 field. Place the paid wood on the accumulation space (for the next visitor).

cards.name: Forest Reviewer
cards.text: Each time after any player (including you) uses the unoccupied "Grove" or "Forest" accumulation space while the other of the two is occupied, you get 1 reed.

cards.name: Forest School
cards.text: You can consider the "Lessons" action spaces not occupied. You can replace each food that an occupation costs with wood.

cards.name: Forest Scientist
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, if there is no wood left on the game board, you get 1 foodâ€”from round 5 on, even 2 food.

cards.name: Forest Stone
cards.text: Place 2 food on this card. Each time you use a wood accumulation space, move 1 of these food to your supply. Each time you use a stone accumulation space, add 2 food to this card.

cards.name: Forest Tallyman
cards.text: Each time both the "Forest" and "Clay Pit" accumulation spaces are occupied, you can use the gap between them as an action space to get 2 clay and 3 wood.

cards.name: Forest Trader
cards.text: Each time you use a wood or clay accumulation space, you can also buy exactly 1 building resource. Wood, clay, and reed cost 1 food each; stone costs 2 food.

cards.name: Forest Well
cards.text: Place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to the amount of wood in your supply. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Forester
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Sow" action, you can plant up to a maximum of up 3 Wood on this card, as shown. The Wood is treated the same as sown Grain and is harvested during the Field phase.

cards.name: Forestry Studies
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Forest" accumulation space, you can return 2 wood to that space to play 1occupation without paying an occupation costs.

cards.name: Founder of the Order
cards.text: At the end of each Work phase, if you used both the first and latest revealed Round cards, you receive 2 Food and 1 Grain from the general supply.

cards.name: Founding Father
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Traveling Players" Action with a person, you may place 1 stable from your supply on this card. Whenever you play an improvement, you may build 1 stable from this card without having to pay any Wood for it.

cards.name: Frame Builder
cards.text: In each renovation, you may replace exactly 1 Clay or 1 Stone with 1 Wood. In each extension, you may replace exactly 2 Clay or 2 Stone with 1 Wood.

cards.name: Franciscan Monk
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain. You may immediately discard a Begging card. At any time, you may exchange 1 Minor Improvement from your hand for 1 new Occupation taken randomly from the deck.

cards.name: Franki Pile
cards.text: Place 1 Stone from the general supply on as many of your unused Farmyard spaces as you choose. These spaces still count as unused; you may not use them any more except to build rooms on them. Whenever you build a room on such a space, pay 1 Building resource of your choice less and place the Stone from the space in your supply.

cards.name: Free-Range Chickens
cards.text: At the start of each round, if you have at least 1 Grain field, place 1 Food from the general supply on this card. You may use this Food at any time. At the end of the game you receive 1/2 Bonus Points for 3/6 Food on this card.

cards.name: Freedom Fighter
cards.text: When you play this card, pay 2 additional Food. Until the next Harvest, you may use Action spaces even if they are occupied by other players.

cards.name: Freeloader
cards.text: Each round, your first Family member may use an occupied Action space. Your first Family member can never take the "Starting Player" Action space. (Even if it is unoccupied).

cards.name: Freemason
cards.text: At the start of each Work phase, you receive 2 Clay/ Stone if you have a Clay hut/ Stone house with exactly 2 rooms. (You receive nothing if you have 3+ rooms or less than 2 rooms.)

cards.name: Freemason
cards.text: As long as you live in a clay/stone house with exactly 2 rooms, at the start of each work phase, you get 2 clay/stone.

cards.name: Fresco Painter
cards.text: Whenever you renovate, you may substitute 1 Reed with 1 Stone. Whenever you build a room, you may substitute 2 Reed with 2 Stone. For every Reed you substitute with Stone this way, you receive 2 Food from the general supply.

cards.name: Freshman
cards.text: Each time you get a "Bake Bread" action, instead of taking the action, you can play an occupation without paying an occupation cost.

cards.name: Friendly Pastures
cards.text: Your pastures with stables may hold 2 different animal types. (This card does not change the capacity of your pastures.)

cards.name: Front Garden
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Unused farmyard space diagonally or orthogonally adjacent to your home. (These spaces still count as unused when scoring.)

cards.name: Fruit Tree
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each remaining Round space for rounds 8 to 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Fruitcake
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of the next Harvest, each of your Family members (including newborns) require 1 Food less.

cards.name: Fry Cook
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, 2 of your adults eat 1 Food less and all other adults eat 1 Food more.

cards.name: Full Farmer
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 clay. During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each pasture you have holding the maximum number of animals.

cards.name: Full Peasant
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Grain Utilization" or "Fencing" action space while the other is unoccupied, you can pay 1 food to use the other space with the same person.

cards.name: Full-bottomed Wig
cards.text: You no longer need Reed when you renovate your home.

cards.name: Furnisher
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 wood. After each new room you build, you can build or play 1 improvement for 1 wood less.

cards.name: Furniture Carpenter
cards.text: Each harvest, if any player (including you) owns the Joinery or an upgrade thereof, you can buy exactly 1 bonus point for 2 food.

cards.name: Furniture Maker
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. Each time you play an occupation after this one, you get 1 wood for each food paid as occupation cost.

cards.name: Furniture Maker
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. Each time you play an occupation after this one, you get 1 wood for each food paid as occupation cost.

cards.name: Furrows
cards.text: You can immediately sow in exactly 1 field.

cards.name: Future Building Site
cards.text: Up until all other farmyard spaces are used, you cannot use the unused spaces that are orthogonally adjacent to your house.

cards.name: Game Catcher
cards.text: When you play this card, pay 1 food for each remaining harvest to immediately get 1 cattle and 1 wild boar.

cards.name: Game Catcher
cards.text: When you play this card, pay 1 food for each remaining harvest to immediately get 1 cattle and 1 wild boar.

cards.name: Game Designer
cards.text: You can exchange 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed and 1 Stone for 2 Food and 1 Bonus point at any time and as often as you like. (Note the Bonus points in the appropriate section of the scoring pad.)

cards.name: Game Provider
cards.text: Immediately before each harvest, you can discard 1/3/4 grain from different fields to get 1/2/3 wild boars.

cards.name: Game Teaser
cards.text: Each time you take 1/2/3 food from a food accumulation space, you also get 1 cattle/wild boar/sheep.

cards.name: Game Trade
cards.text: You immediately get 1 wild boar and 1 cattle. (effectively, you are exchanging 2 sheep for 1 wild boar and 1 cattle.)

cards.name: Garden Claw
cards.text: Place 1 food on each remaining round space, up to three times the number of planted fields you have. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Garden Designer
cards.text: At the start of scoring, you can place food in empty fields. You get 1/2/3 bonus points for each field in which you place 1/4/7 food.

cards.name: Garden Hoe
cards.text: Each time you take an unconditional "Sow" action planting vegetables in at least 1 field, you get 1 clay and 1 stone.

cards.name: Garden Wood
cards.text: You immediately receive 1 Wood for every Unused farmyard space orthogonally adjacent to your home.

cards.name: Gardener
cards.text: Take Vegetables from the supply and not your Vegetable field whenever you harvest themâ€”you keep the Vegetables on the fields.

cards.name: Gardener's Knife
cards.text: You immediately get 1 food for each grain field you have and 1 grain for each vegetable field you have.

cards.name: Gardeners' Bothy
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 Field" Action space, you may immediately afterward move that person to this card to receive 1 Grain. Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action space, you may immediately afterward move that person to this card to receive 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Gardening Enthusiast
cards.text: You immediately receive a loan of 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable. Before scoring, return the 2 crops from your supply. For each crop that you cannot or choose not to return, you receive 1 Negative point.

cards.name: Gardening Head Official
cards.text: If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with the most vegetables in their fields gets 2 bonus points.

cards.name: Gardening Tools
cards.text: Whenever another player Sows, you may pay 1 Food to the supply to immediately take a "Sow" action.

cards.name: Gauger
cards.text: At any time, any player can use the Gauger to convert 1 Grain into 2 Food. Whenever another player uses the Gauger to convert 1 or more Grain into Food, you receive 1 Food from the general supply.

cards.name: Gem Hunter
cards.text: Whenever you use a person to take Clay from a Building resource Accumulation space, you may also receive 1 Stone. In Round 9 or before, if there are 3 or more Clay on the space, you must leave 1 Clay on the space to receive the Stone.

cards.name: General
cards.text: At the end of the game, if you have 2x3 or 3x2 connected Unused farmyard spaces, you receive 9 Bonus points. (Your 6 Unused spaces are still scored as 6 Unused spaces.)

cards.name: Gentleman
cards.text: Whenever you manage to be the very last player to place a Family member in any round, you receive 1 Food after you take the final action. If you play the Gentleman card with the last Family member to be placed during the current round, you receive 2 Food.

cards.name: Geode
cards.text: Draw 3 Minor Improvements randomly from the deck. You may immediately play 1 of these Minor Improvements (pay costs and fulfill prerequisites normally), or add it to your hand. Discard the other 2 Improvements.

cards.name: Geologist
cards.text: Each time you use the "Forest" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you also get 1 clay. In games with 3 or more players, this also applies to the "Clay Pit".

cards.name: German Heath Keeper
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) uses the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you get 1 sheep from the general supply.

cards.name: German-by-Choice
cards.text: At the end of the game, if all your fields as well as all your pastures are arranged in a rectangle form (e.g. 3x2 or 1x3), your receive 3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Giant Pumpkin
cards.text: Place 1 Vegetable from your own supply on this card. At any time, you can Harvest this Vegetable and convert it to Food. If it is still on the card at the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus points. (You can count the Vegetable in scoring at the end of the game.)

cards.name: Gift Basket
cards.text: When you play this card, if you have exactly 2/3/4/5 rooms, you immediately get 1 vegetable/food/grain/vegetable.

cards.name: Gift Table
cards.text: Pile 1 of each on this card (from bottom to top) : Vegetable, Wood, Sheep, Wood, Grain. At any time, you may buy the top item for 1 Food. When you buy the Sheep: it moves to your supply, it can be exchanged for 2 Food at any time, it does not breed, and it counts for scoring.

cards.name: Gimlet
cards.text: Pay 1 less Wood/Clay/Stone for each Wood/Clay/Stone room. Each round you build stables, pay 1 less Wood for up to 2 stables.

cards.name: Glass Blower
cards.text: If you have an oven, the Glassblower may convert 1/2 Clay to 3/5 Food in each Harvest.

cards.name: Glassblowers Shop
cards.text: Each harvest you may convert up to 1 Clay to 3 Food . At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/4/5 Clay. (A repurchased Pottery does not give additional Bonus points, but can be used to convert an additional Clay each Harvest.)

cards.name: Glasses Maker
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Reed and 1 Food. Instead of the "Build Room(s)" action on the corresponding Action space, you may take the "Renovate" action and vice versa. (This card does not effect additional actions on those spaces.)

cards.name: Glutton
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of the last Harvest after feeding your family normally, you may pay 3 additional Food for 1 Bonus point, up to a maximum of 6 Bonus points.

cards.name: Goblet
cards.text: The Well is a Minor Improvement for you. When you build the Well, place 2 Food on the next 5 Round spaces instead of 1 Food. (If you already have the Well, then this card has no effect.)

cards.name: Godfather
cards.text: Whenever you use an Action space orthogonally adjacent to an occupied "Family growth" Action space from stage 2 or stage 5, you receive 1 Grain immediately before.

cards.name: Godly Spouse
cards.text: Each time you take a "Family Growth" action with the second person you place in a round, return the first person you placed home.

cards.name: Gold Medal
cards.text: When you play this card, choose one category from Grain, Vegetables, Sheep, Wild boar, Cattle, fields, pastures, or fenced stables. At the end of the game, all players with the most Points in that category receive 2 Bonus points.

cards.name: Gold Weigher
cards.text: Whenever another player plays an Improvement with 2 or more printed Victory points (excluding Bonus points), they must pay you 1 Food before.

cards.name: Golden Earring
cards.text: Each round, you may place your second person on this card instead of an Action space. If you do this, place 1 Grain from the general supply on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 7 Bonus points if there are 2 Grain on this card.

cards.name: Golden Hands
cards.text: Whenever you play a Minor or Major improvement, you may replace exactly 1 building resource with another.

cards.name: Golden Helmet
cards.text: Once each round that ends with a Harvest, immediately after placing 1 of your people, you may place 1 Food from the general supply on any Action space. The next player to use this Action space receives the Food (even in a following round).

cards.name: Golden Rose
cards.text: Whenever you pay Food to play an Occupation or a Minor Improvement, you may pay up to 2 Food less.

cards.name: Golem
cards.text: Place the 2 Clay you paid for this card on it. At the start of each of the next 2 Rounds, return 1 Clay from this card to the Supply. In these 2 Rounds, the first Family member that you place uses that space twice in a row. On Accumulating spaces, this means that for the second action you can take as many of the resource as are replenished each Round from the Supply.

cards.name: Good Friend
cards.text: Place 3 Wood, 2 Clay, 2 Stone, and 1 Reed on this card. Whenever another player pays building resources to build a Minor Improvement, you may take 1 building resource of the same type from this card.

cards.name: Goods Fraudster
cards.text: Place 2 Wood, 2 Clay, 1 Stone and 1 Reed on this card. You may only use these resources to pay any Building costs or functions of a card. At the end of the next Harvest, you receive 1 Begging card for each resource still on this card.

cards.name: Goose Pond
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on the next 4 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Governor
cards.text: Immediately take the 4 top Occupations from the face-down pile and select two of them. You may (if you fulfil the conditions on the card) immediately play one at no cost; placed the other into your hand. If you cannot or choose not to play either, take both into your hand.

cards.name: Governor General
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 and a half Bonus points for each room in your Stone house rounded down and your negative points are doubled. (This also applies to Begging cards.)

cards.name: Graduate
cards.text: When you play this card you immediately pay 1 food. If you do, you get 2 stone and 2 reed.

cards.name: Grafter
cards.text: During the Breeding phase of Harvest, if you have 2 or more Grain in your supply you receive 1 Grain from the supply. If you have 2 or more Vegetables, you receive 1 Vegetable from the supply. (Vegetables and Grains that are planted are not counted.)

cards.name: Grain Cart
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action space, you receive 2 additional Grain.

cards.name: Grain Depot
cards.text: If you paid wood/clay/stone for this card, place 1 grain on each of the next 2/3/4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the grain.

cards.name: Grain Elevator
cards.text: At the start of each round, add 1 Grain from the supply to this card, unless it has Grain equal to the number of players. Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" action, also take all the Grain on this card. Whenever another player uses the "Take 1 Grain" action, return all Grain on this card to the supply.

cards.name: Grain Farmer
cards.text: Whenever you have at least 1/4/7/10 planted Grain at the beginning of the Field phase of a Harvest, you receive 1/2/3/4 Food.

cards.name: Grain Harvester
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain. In each Field phase of Harvest, you may harvest 1 additional Grain from each of your Grain fields.

cards.name: Grain Lover
cards.text: If there are still 7 rounds to play, you may Plow 1 field, which you may immediately Sow with 1 Grain from your supply. At the end of the game, all players with the most Grain receive 2 Bonus points each.

cards.name: Grain Market
cards.text: Whenever you harvest at least 1 Grain, you may immediately afterward exchange 1 Grain from your personal supply for 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Grain Mill Oven
cards.text: You can't Bake bread with the Grain Mill Oven. Clay and Stone Ovens are Minor Improvements for you. You may discard this instead of paying an Oven's cost. When you play this card, you can immediately take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Grain Reaper
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 Field" or "Plow and/or Sow" Action space, you may take the Field phase of a Harvest on your farmyard before taking the action. (This does not count as a Harvest.)

cards.name: Grain Sheaves
cards.text: Whenever you play another Minor Improvement, you receive 1 Grain afterward.

cards.name: Grain Sieve
cards.text: In the field phase of each harvest, if you harvest at least 2 grain, you get 1 additional grain from the general supply.

cards.name: Grain Speculator
cards.text: Add 1, 3, and 5 to the current round and place 1 Grain on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Grain.

cards.name: Granary
cards.text: Place 1 Grain each on the spaces for rounds 8,10 and 12. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Grain.

cards.name: Grand Pensionary
cards.text: Each round, before the Work phase, you may mark 3 Action spaces. At most 2 of these spaces can be used by others. The third must remain free for you (even if you do not have any people left). You may choose not to use the third space.

cards.name: Grange
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food.

cards.name: Grasshopper Bundles
cards.text: In the Breeding phase of each Harvest, if you breed Sheep/ Wild boar/ Cattle and you have exactly 0-3/4-7/8+ planted Grain, you may receive 1 additional baby Sheep/ Wild Boar/ Cattle.

cards.name: Grassland Harrow
cards.text: Add 1 to the current round for each building resource in your supply and place 1 field on the corresponding round space. A the start of the round, you can plow the field.

cards.name: Green Grocer
cards.text: At the start of each round, you can make exactly one of the following exchanges: 1 Cattle â†’ 1 Vegetable; 1 Vegetable â†’ 1 Cattle; 2 Sheep â†’ 1 Vegetable; 1 Vegetable â†’ 2 Sheep; 2 Food â†’ 1 Grain; 1 Grain â†’ 2 Food

cards.name: Greengrocer
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action space, you also receive 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Greenhouse
cards.text: Add 4 and 7 to the current round and place 1 Vegetable on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you can pay 1 Food to take the Vegetable.

cards.name: Greenhouse Builder
cards.text: This is an action space for you only. It provides a choice of "Fencing", "House Redevelopment", or "Vegetable Seeds" if the corresponding action space is already in play.

cards.name: Greening Plan
cards.text: During scoring, if you then have at least 2/4/5/6 unplanted fields, you get 1/2/3/5 bonus points.

cards.name: Grey Matter
cards.text: You receive 1 Wood for every Improvement in front of you whose function you didn't use so far.

cards.name: Gritter
cards.text: At the end of each action in which you sow vegetables in a field, you get 1 food for each vegetable field you have (including the new ones).

cards.name: Grocer
cards.text: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 Vegetable, Reed, Clay, Wood, Vegetable, Stone, Grain, Reed on this card. At any time, you may buy the top item for 1 Food.

cards.name: Groom
cards.text: Once you have a Stone house, you can build 1 stable at the beginning of each round at a cost of 1 Wood. You do not need to place a Family member on an Action space to do this.

cards.name: Grotto
cards.text: Place 3 Clay and 2 Stone from the supply on this card. At the end of each round, you may pay 2 Food to receive 1 of these resources. Once this card is empty, it provides room for 1 Family member.

cards.name: Ground Pickaxe Plow
cards.text: Once during the game, when you use either the "Plow 1 field" or the "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action space, you can place 1 Wood from your supply on 1/2 orthogonally adjacent (revealed or unrevealed) Action spaces (to the used plow space) to Plow 1/2 additional fields.

cards.name: Growing Farm
cards.text: You can only play this card if you have at least as many pasture spaces as the number of completed rounds. If you do, you get a number of food equal to the current round.

cards.name: Grump
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, all players with the fewest Family members receive 2 Bonus points each.

cards.name: Guest
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive a Guest token, which you may place once in the next round as you would a person.

cards.name: Guest Worker
cards.text: Take a Guest marker. From the next Round, you can place this as you would a Family member. The Guest worker can use the most recent Round card even if it has already been taken. He occupies a Room in your Home and must be fed with 2 Food during the Feeding Phase of each Harvest.

cards.name: Guildmaster
cards.text: You receive 4 Wood when you acquire the Joinery or play the Cabinetmaker. When you acquire the Pottery or play the Potter, you receive 4 Clay. When you acquire the Basketmaker's Workshop or play the Basketmaker, you receive 3 Reed. If you have already played any of these cards when you play the Guildmaster, you receive 2 building resources of the appropriate type for each existing card.

cards.name: Gypsy's Crock
cards.text: Each time you use a cooking improvement to turn 2 goods into food at the same time, you get 1 additional food.

cards.name: Gypsy's Crock
cards.text: Whenever you convert any 2 goods to Food at one time using a Fireplace, Cooking Hearth or Cooking Corner, you receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Half-timbered House
cards.text: At the end of the game you receive 1 Bonus point for each room in your Stone house. (In total, you receive 3 points instead of 2 per room.)(If you have played the Mansion, you do not score extra points for having the Half-timbered House.)

cards.name: Half-Timbered House
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each stone room you have. You can only use one card to get bonus points for your stone house.

cards.name: Hammer
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately take a "Fences" action. Pay 1 Wood to every other player who has at least 1 fence.

cards.name: Hammer Crusher
cards.text: Immediately before you renovate to stone, you get 2 clay and 1 reed and you can take a "Build Rooms" action.

cards.name: Hammock
cards.text: One of your rooms can hold 1 additional Family member.

cards.name: Hand Mill
cards.text: During the Feeding phase of the Harvest, you can use the Hand Mill to turn either 1 Grain into 2 Food or 2 Grain into 4 Food.

cards.name: Hand Truck
cards.text: Each time before you take a "Bake Bread" action, you also get 1 grain for each of your people occupying an accumulation space.

cards.name: Handcart
cards.text: Before each work phase, you can take 1 building resource from at most one wood/clay/reed/stone accumulation space containing at least 6/5/4/4 building resources of the same type.

cards.name: Handplow
cards.text: Add 5 to the current round and place 1 field tile on the corresponding round space. At the start of that round, you can plow the field.

cards.name: Harbor Master
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive 1 additional Reed. Whenever another player uses the "Fishing" Action space, you receive 1 Reed and 1 Food from the supply.

cards.name: Hard Porcelain
cards.text: At any time, you can exchange 2/3/4 clay for 1/2/3 stone.

cards.name: Hardware Store
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can pay 2 food total to buy 1 wood, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 stone.

cards.name: Hardworking Man
cards.text: This card is an action space for you only. If each other player has more rooms than you, it provides the "Day Laborer", "Building Rooms", and "Major Improvement" actions (all three).

cards.name: Harlequin
cards.text: Whenever the Starting player of the current round uses the "Traveling Players" action, you receive 1 Vegetable. Whenever the player in position 2/3/4 uses it, you receive 1 Sheep/ Stone/ Bonus point.

cards.name: Harpooner
cards.text: Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space you can also pay 1 wood to get 1 food for each person you have, and 1 reed

cards.name: Harrow
cards.text: Once during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action, you can Plow 2 fields instead of 1. Each other player can also do this once during the game, but must pay you 2 Food to do it.

cards.name: Harvest Feast
cards.text: When you play this card, each player may immediately move any amount of their planted resources to their personal supply. (This does not count as a harvest).

cards.name: Harvest Festival Planning
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately carry out the field phase of the harvest. Afterwards, you get a "Major or Minor Improvement" action.

cards.name: Harvest Helper
cards.text: At the start of the Feeding phase in each Harvest, you can take 1 Grain from 1 field belonging to another player. That player receives 2 Food from the supply.

cards.name: Harvest House
cards.text: When you play this card, if the number of completed harvests is equal to the number of occupations you played, you immediately get 1 food, 1 grain, and 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Harvester
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, all players who harvest at least 5 goods during the final Harvest receive 3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Hash with Fries
cards.text: Immediately convert 1 Grain, 1 Vegetable and 1 Cattle to 3 Bonus points and 5 Food.

cards.name: Hauberg
cards.text: Alternate placing 2 wood and 1 wild boar on the next 4 round spaces. You decide what to start with. At the start of these rounds, you get the goods.

cards.name: Hawktower
cards.text: Place a stone room on round space 12. If you live in a stone house at the start of the round, you can build the stone room at no cost. Otherwise, discard the stone room.

cards.name: Hay Rake
cards.text: Each Work phase, the third person you place can use the "Plow 1 field" Action space even if it is occupied.

cards.name: Haydryer
cards.text: Immediately before each harvest, you can buy 1 cattle for 4 food minus 1 food for each pasture you have. (The minimum cost is 0).

cards.name: Hayloft
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1/2 Bonus points for 3/4 stables.

cards.name: Hayloft Barn
cards.text: Place 4 food on this card. Each time you obtain at least 1 grain, you also get 1 food from this card. Once it is empty, you get a "Family Growth Even without Room" action.

cards.name: Haystack
cards.text: Place 3 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Hayward
cards.text: You can build fences at any time without placing a person. (This is not considered a "Build Fences" action.)

cards.name: Head of the Family
cards.text: You can use any Build room(s) or Family growth Action space, even if another player has already placed a person on it.

cards.name: Head Of The Revolution
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. After playing this card, the next player to have no Unused farmyard spaces (who currently has Unused spaces) receives 3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Headmaster
cards.text: Whenever another player plays an Occupation, place 1 Food from the supply on this card. Whenever you play an Occupation, you may pay any costs using Food from this card. At the end of a 4/5 player game, you receive 1 Bonus point for every 3/4 Food on this card.

cards.name: Heart of Stone
cards.text: Each time a "Quarry" accumulation space is revealed, if you have room in your house, you can immediately take a "Family Growth" action without placing a person.

cards.name: Heatwave
cards.text: Immediately build a Fireplace for free or upgrade a Fireplace to a Cooking Hearth.

cards.name: Hedge Keeper
cards.text: Whenever you build at least 1 fence, you can build 3 additional fences without paying any additional Wood. (You can only place fences if they enclose a complete pasture.)

cards.name: Hedge Master
cards.text: Whenever you build fences, you receive 1 Bonus point. When you play this card, you may immediately build fences.

cards.name: Heiress
cards.text: At the start of round 6/10/13, you may (before phase 1) build 1 Wooden/ Clay/ Stone room if your home is made of the same material. Pay 1 less Clay for the Clay room and 2 less Stone for the Stone room. (When you play this card, place the Room tiles on the corresponding round spaces.)

cards.name: Helper
cards.text: You can use any "Renovate", "Build room(s)", or "Major Improvement" Action space, even if another player has already placed a person on it.

cards.name: Helpful Neighbors
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive either 1 Stone or 1 Reed.

cards.name: Henpecked Husband
cards.text: Each time you take a "Build Rooms" action with the second person you place, return the first person you placed home, unless it is on the "Meeting Place" action space.

cards.name: Herald
cards.text: At any time, you may look at all the remaining unplaced Round cards and re-sort them. (Cards must remain in the appropriate game stage.) When you play this card, you receive 2 Wood.

cards.name: Herb Garden
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each of the next 5 Round spaces. At the start of each round, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Herdsman
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you receive 1 additional Sheep. From round 6, you can choose to receive 1 Wild boar instead.

cards.name: Heresy Teacher
cards.text: Each time you use a "Lessons" action space, you get 1 vegetable in each of your fields with at least 3 grain and no vegetable. Place the vegetable below the grain.

cards.name: Hermit
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 6 Bonus points if this is the only Occupation you have played.

cards.name: Hero
cards.text: You immediately receive 3 Food. Once during the game, you can discard 1 Wild Boar to immediately take a "Family Growth" action without placing a Family member. The newborn Family member cannot take an Action until the following round, and requires a room in your Home.

cards.name: Herring Pot
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, place 1 Food on the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Herring Pot
cards.text: Each time you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Hide Farmer
cards.text: At the end of the game, you can pay 1 Food each for any number of unused fields. These do not lose you points in the scoring.

cards.name: Hill Farmer
cards.text: Whenever you build 1 or more fences or Plow 1 or more fields, you receive 2/1 Food if you have exactly 2/3 rooms.

cards.name: Hired Helpers
cards.text: Each round, you may place 1 Guest token as you would a Family member. If you do this, you must place 1 fewer person next round. You can not use this ability in consecutive rounds nor in Round 14.

cards.name: Hoarder
cards.text: Each Harvest, you can place 1 Building resource on this card from your supply. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3/5 Bonus Points for 1/2/3/4 different resources on this card.

cards.name: Hobby Farmer
cards.text: When you play this card, take 1 Vegetable that you may Sow immediately if you have an empty plowed field. (You can Sow just this one Vegetable with this extra action.)

cards.name: Hobby Mathematician
cards.text: In a game with 3/4/5 players, at the start of each Work phase, you may take 1 Wood if there is a total of 7/8/9 Wood on all Wood Accumulation spaces. Additionally, you may take 1 Clay if there is a total of 6/7/8 Clay on all Clay Accumulation spaces.

cards.name: Hobbyist
cards.text: Whenever another player plays an Occupation, you may pay 1 Food to the general supply to play 1 Minor Improvement, or 2 Food to build 1 Major Improvement. (Pay costs for the Improvement normally.)

cards.name: Hod
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 clay. Each time any player (including you) uses the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you immediately get 2 clay.

cards.name: Hoe Maker
cards.text: Whenever you build at least 1 fence, you may also pay 1 Food to Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Holiday House
cards.text: In Round 14, you cannot place any Family members. (Playing this card bans you from placing peopleâ€”including a Guestâ€”in Round 14.) Play this card at the latest during Round 13. (Be prepared to play two Harvests in a row.)

cards.name: Holiday Present
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately either discard 1 Begging card or take 1 animal (of your choice) from the supply.

cards.name: Hollow Gardener
cards.text: Each time you take at least 3 clay from the "Hollow" accumulation space, you also get 1 grain. If you take at least 6 clay from it, you also get 1 vegetable (instead of grain).

cards.name: Hollow Warden
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get a "Major Improvement" action to build a Fireplace. Each time you use the "Hollow" accumulation space, you also get 1 food.

cards.name: Home Brewer
cards.text: After the field phase of each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 grain into your choice of 3 food or 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Home Garden
cards.text: Whenever you renovate your home, or if you renovated this round, place 1 Food on the next 3 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Home Zoo
cards.text: This card can hold up to 1 Sheep, 1 Wild boar and 1 Cattle. You may only place animals here when you receive them from Accumulation spaces. While here, they do not participate in the Breeding phase of Harvest. During the last Harvest, you may exchange animals here for 1 Bonus point each.

cards.name: Homekeeper
cards.text: Exactly one clay or stone room in your house can hold an additional person if the room is adjacent to both a field and a pasture.

cards.name: Homework
cards.text: When you play this card, you may immediately play up to 2 Occupations. (You must still pay any additional costs of the Occupations.)

cards.name: Homo Ludens
cards.text: In a 4 player game, take the Action cards from the 5 player game and visa versa. At the beginning of each round, choose one randomly. This Action space is available for you only that round. (Fill any Accumulation space once.)

cards.name: Honeymoon
cards.text: In Round 14, you place 2 fewer Family members.

cards.name: Hoof Caregiver
cards.text: Immediately add 1 cattle from the general supply to the "Cattle Market" accumulation space. Afterward, you get 1 grain plus 1 food for each cattle on "Cattle Market".

cards.name: Hook Knife
cards.text: Once this game, when you have 9/8/7/6/5/5 sheep on your farm in a 1-/2-3-/4-/5-/6- player game, you immediately get 2 bonus points.

cards.name: Hops Field
cards.text: You can immediately pay 1 to 4 Wood to place that many Fences on one of your empty Fields. This Field can no longer be Sown, but is counted as a Field at the end of the game. For each Fence on the Field, you immediately receive 1 Food and you receive 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.

cards.name: Horse
cards.text: You receive 2 Bonus points for any one type of animal missing from your farm at the end of the game. (The horse replaces this type of animal.)(You still lose the points for the missing animal type.)

cards.name: Horse Barn
cards.text: Whenever you Sow, each field you Sow that is orthogonally adjacent to exactly 1 stable gets an additional 1 Grain or 1 Vegetable. Each field that is orthogonally adjacent to 2 or more stables, gets an additional 2 Grain or 2 Vegetables. (It does not matter if the stable is fenced.)

cards.name: Horse-Drawn Boat
cards.text: Alternate placing 1 food and 1 sheep on each remaining round space, starting with food. At the start of these rounds, you get the respective good.

cards.name: Horse-Drawn Boat
cards.text: Alternate placing 1 Food and 1 Sheep on each remaining Round space. Start with 1 Food. At the start of these rounds you receive the item.

cards.name: House Artist
cards.text: Each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you also get a "Build Rooms" action. Each room you build during the action costs you 1 reed less.

cards.name: House Boat
cards.text: Place 2 Guest tokens on this card. In the Returning home phase each Round, you can use one of these Guests to use the "Fishing" Action space. (Return the Guest to the general supply after using it.)

cards.name: House Goat
cards.text: In each Feeding phase, you receive 1 Food. Apart from the House Goat, you cannot hold any other animal in your home. (even if you have the Animal Tamer.)(You cannot choose to let the House Goat run free to make room for a different animal in your home.)

cards.name: House Steward
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, the player(s) with the most rooms in their home receive 3 Bonus points each.

cards.name: Housebook Master
cards.text: After playing this card, if you renovate to stone in round 13/12/11 or before, you immediately get 1/2/3 food and 1/2/3 bonus points.

cards.name: Housemaster
cards.text: During scoring, total the point values of your major improvements. The smallest value counts double. If the total is at least 5/7/9/11, you get 1/2/3/4 bonus points.

cards.name: Hovering Stone
cards.text: As soon as you use the Round space with the number that is equal to the total number of Wood in your supply, you receive 1 Wood from the general supply afterwards.

cards.name: Humble Farmboy
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, all players with the fewest cards in front of them receive 3 Bonus Points. (Count Occupations plus Improvements and exclude Begging cards.)

cards.name: Hunger Wall
cards.text: During each Harvest, each Player can pay 1 Clay instead of the required 2 Food for exactly 1 Family member. All that Clay paid is placed on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for every 2 Clay on the card.

cards.name: Hunter
cards.text: Whenever you receive animals outside the Breeding phase of a Harvest, you may immediately convert them into Food. Take 2/3/4 Food for each Sheep/Wild boar/Cattle converted.

cards.name: Hunting Trophy
cards.text: Improvements built on "House Redevelopment" cost you 1 building resource of your choice less. Fences built on "Farm Redevelopment" cost you a total of 3 wood less.

cards.name: Hunting Trophy
cards.text: Improvements built on "House Redevelopment" cost you 1 building resource of your choice less. Fences built on "Farm Redevelopment" cost you a total of 3 wood less.

cards.name: Huntsman
cards.text: Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, you can pay 1 grain to get 1 wild boar.

cards.name: Huntsman's Hat
cards.text: For each new wild boar you get from the effect of an action space, you also get 1 food.

cards.name: Hut Builder
cards.text: Play this card during Stage 1. At the start of Round 11, you can extend you hut by 1 room at no cost, as long as you have not yet renovated to a Stone house.

cards.name: Hutch
cards.text: Place 0, 1, 2, and 3 food in this order on the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Ice Skate Sharpener
cards.text: At the end of each Harvest, you may pay 1 Wood and 1 Food to use out of turn an Action space of your choice without placing a person.

cards.name: Ideal Landscape
cards.text: At the end of the game, if your farm contains exactly 4 pastures (totaling 6 pasture spaces), 5 fields and 4 rooms, you receive 4 Bonus points.

cards.name: Illusionist
cards.text: Each time you use a building resource accumulation space, you can discard exactly 1 card from your hand to get 1 additional building resource of the accumulating type.

cards.name: Immigrants Son
cards.text: When you play your 5th, 6th and 7th Occupation, you can Plow 1 field immediately afterward. (You cannot Plow immediately if you play this card as your 5th, 6th, or 7th Occupation.)

cards.name: Impossible Crate
cards.text: Add 3 to the current round and place 12 of your fences on the corresponding Round space. At the start of that round only, take your fences back and immediately take a "Fences" action without placing a Family member. (Pay fence costs normally)

cards.name: Informant
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. After each work phase, if you have more stone than clay in your supply, you get 1 wood.

cards.name: Inner Districts Director
