cards.text: Each time you use the "Forest" or "Clay Pit" accumulation space, you can place 1 stone from the general supply on the other space. If you do, you can immediately place another person.

cards.name: Institute Founder
cards.text: When you play this card, you may immediately pay 1 Food for 1 Grain. In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, your 4th and 5th Family members need only 1 Food.

cards.name: Interim Storage
cards.text: Each time you use a clay/reed/stone accumulation space, place 1 wood/clay/reed on this card. At the start of rounds 7, 11, and 14, move all the goods on this card to your supply.

cards.name: Interior Decorator
cards.text: Each time you renovate, place 1 food on each of the next 6 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Inventor
cards.text: All Improvements with a printed cost of 4 or more resources cost you 1 less resource of your choice.

cards.name: Investor
cards.text: When you play this card, you may immediately build up to 2 Major Improvements by paying 1 Food each and discarding your entire hand. (You do not need to pay the costs of the Major Improvements)

cards.name: Iron Plow
cards.text: Once during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, you may Plow 2 fields instead of 1 and take a "Sow" action afterward.

cards.name: Irrigation Canal
cards.text: Whenever you Plow a field that is orthogonally adjacent to a planted field, you may take 1 Grain or Vegetable from that field and Sow it immediately on the newly plowed field. Place 1 fewer Grain or Vegetable from the supply on the newly planted field.

cards.name: Islands of Peace
cards.text: Place 1 Food from the general supply on every junction point between 4 of your unused Farmyard spaces (maximum 5 Food, in rare cases 6). You receive the Food when all the corresponding 4 spaces are used.

cards.name: Itinerant Laborers
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately take a "Sow" action.

cards.name: Jack-of-all-Trades
cards.text: Immediately discard all the Occupations that you have played. (All their effects are lost.) Once in each Round, you can pay 1 Food to use an Occupation that has been played by another player. You receive all benefits except for any that are given when the card is played or at the end of the game. As soon as you play another Occupation, you must discard the Jack-of-all-Trades.

cards.name: Jeanneke-Pis
cards.text: Your Well is an additional Action space for you only. Whenever you use your Well, you activate its effect again. (Wells are cards whose name ends with "Well".)

cards.name: Jenever Distillery
cards.text: When you play this card, place 1 to 4 Wood from your supply on this card. You can move this Wood back to your supply at any time. In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 1 Food for each Wood on this card (without removing the Wood).

cards.name: Job Contract
cards.text: If both are unoccupied, you can use the "Day Laborer" and the adjacent "Lessons" action space with a single person (in that order). Afterward, both spaces are considered occupied.

cards.name: Job Seeker
cards.text: Once in play, this card does not count as an Occupation for any purpose. Whenever, at the start of a round, you have fewer Occupations than any 2 other players, you may pay 1 Food to immediately play an Occupation. (Occupations played this way may not be returned to the player's hand.)

cards.name: Joiner of the Sea
cards.text: Each time another player uses the "Fishing"/"Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can give them 1 wood to get 2 food/3 food from the general supply.

cards.name: Joinery
cards.text: Harvest: At most 1 time Wood â†’ 2 Food Scoring: 3/5/7 Wood â†’ 1/2/3 bonus points

cards.name: Joinery
cards.text: In each Harvest, you can use the Joinery to convert at most 1 Wood to 2 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 3/5/7 Wood.

cards.name: Journeyman
cards.text: Once you have a Stone house, you can pay 1 Food at the start of each round for 1 animal of your choice.

cards.name: Journeyman Bricklayer
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 stone. Each time another player renovates to stone or builds a stone room, you get 1 stone.

cards.name: Journeyman Thatcher
cards.text: Immediately build 1 room by paying the same resources you would have to pay for the "Build room" Action, minus 1 Reed. (A Journeyman does not count as a played Occupation.)

cards.name: Joy House
cards.text: Immediately after each Work phase, you may pay 1 Food to place 1 of your people on the Joy House instead of your home. Whenever you use a person from the Joy House, you may pay 1 Food to use 2 vertically adjacent Action spaces. Use the top one first then the bottom one. (People in the Joy House also use a room in your home)

cards.name: Juggler
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Player" action on an Action space, you can choose to take twice as much Food as is on the card. If you do this, you must give one Food each to the Magician, Conjurer, Street Musician, Puppeteer, Acrobat, Dancer, Animal Trainer and Storyteller.

cards.name: Junior Artist
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you can pay 1 food to use an unoccupied "Traveling Players" or "Lessons" action space with the same person.

cards.name: Junk Room
cards.text: Whenever you play an Improvement (including this one), you receive 1 Food afterward.

cards.name: Junk Room
cards.text: Each time after you build an improvement, including this one, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Keg
cards.text: Once all the Family members have been placed in this round, you may place a Guest marker to carry out an additional Action.

cards.name: Kettle
cards.text: At any time, you can exchange 1/3/5 grain for 3/4/5 food and 0/1/2 bonus points.

cards.name: Keys
cards.text: You can use the "Build room(s) and/or Build stable(s)" Action space, even if another player has already placed a person on it.

cards.name: Kids Corner
cards.text: Your home may hold 1 additional animal. You may keep more than 1 type of animal in your home.

cards.name: Kindling
cards.text: You may build Major Improvement Fireplaces and Cooking Hearths with a "Minor Improvement" action. Pay 1 Clay less for each.

cards.name: Kitchen Maid
cards.text: Once you have built a Cooking Hearth, alternate placing 1 Food and 1 Grain on each remaining even numbered Round space. Start with 1 Food. At the start of these rounds, you receive the item. (If you already have a Cooking Hearth when you play this card, place the goods immediately.)

cards.name: Kitchen Table
cards.text: For you, all "Bake Bread" actions now read "Bake Bread or place 1 Food from your supply on Kitchen Table." At any time, you may return 1 Food from this card to your supply and take a "Bake Bread" Action.

cards.name: Knapper
cards.text: Each time before you use an action space card on round spaces 5 to 7, you get 1 stone.

cards.name: Knight
cards.text: In the Field phase of the last Harvest, multiply the number of your Stone rooms by the number of your Cattle. You receive this many Food. If you receive more Food from the Knight alone than is needed to feed your family, take the excess in Bonus pts, 1 to 1 up to 5

cards.name: La Grace Fountain
cards.text: Place 1 Food on as many remaining Round spaces as you have Sheep. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. This card counts as a Well.

cards.name: Ladder
cards.text: You need 1 less Reed to extend or renovate your home or to build the Water Mill, Half-timbered House, Chicken Coop, Holiday Home, Mansion or Corn Storehouse.

cards.name: Lady in Waiting
cards.text: If you play this card during Stage 1, place 1 person still in your supply on Round 12. At the start of this round, you can pay 2 Food to move this person into your home whether or not you have room. It counts as an adult Family member and may take actions starting Round 12.

cards.name: Lamp Oil
cards.text: Whenever you play an Occupation, you receive 1 Food before you pay the cost of the Occupation.

cards.name: Land Agent
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Vegetable" Action space, you also receive 1 Grain. When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable from the supply.

cards.name: Land Consolidation
cards.text: At any time, you can exchange 3 grain in a field for 1 vegetable in that field.

cards.name: Landing Net
cards.text: Whenever you receive Reed on an Action space, you receive an additional 2 Food. This is reduced to 1 Food if you receive other building resources as well as Reed.

cards.name: Landscape Design
cards.text: Your fields no longer need to be orthogonally adjacent to each other. Fields plowed at the same time must be adjacent. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 3/4/5 fields that are not orthogonally adjacent to another field.

cards.name: Landscape Gardener
cards.text: When you Sow, you may Sow on this card as if it were 2 fields. When you play this card, you may take a "Sow" action. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

cards.name: Lantern Wonder
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Negative point for each card in your hand. (Cards must be played and cannot be discarded.)

cards.name: Large Greenhouse
cards.text: Add 5, 7, and 9 to the current Round and place 1 Vegetable on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these Rounds, you receive the Vegetable.

cards.name: Large Greenhouse
cards.text: Add 4, 7, and 9 to the current round and place 1 vegetable on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the vegetable.

cards.name: Large-Scale Farmer
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Farm Expansion" or "Major Improvement" action space while the other is unoccupied, you can pay 1 food to use that other space with the same person.

cards.name: Lasso
cards.text: You can place exactly two people immediately after one another, if at least one of them uses a "Wild boar", "Cattle" or "Sheep" Action space. (This does not apply to the "Either 1 Sheep and 1 Food or 1 Wild boar..." Action space from the 5-player game.)

cards.name: Late Bloomer
cards.text: Whenever you have fewer Family members than all of the other players and you have room in your home, you may immediately take a "Family growth" action. Place the offspring in an empty room. This Family member is not considered a newborn and may take an action the same round.

cards.name: Late Sleeper
cards.text: At the start of each round, announce whether or not you will sleep late. If you sleep late, you place all of your people after everyone else has placed all of theirs, but you may also place a Guest token. (If you choose not to sleep late, you place your people normally.)

cards.name: Lawn Fertilzer
cards.text: Your pastures of size 1 can hold up to 3 animals of the same type. (With a stable, they can hold up to 6 animals of the same type.)

cards.name: Lawyer
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 different building resources of your choice. From Round 13 on, you may use the Round 13 Action space even if it is occupied by another player.

cards.name: Layabout
cards.text: Once you have played this card, you may not take part in the next Harvest. (You also do not need to feed your family during that Harvest.)

cards.name: Lazy Sowman
cards.text: Each time you decline an unconditional "Sow" action on your turn, you can immediately place another person on an action space of your choice (even if it is occupied).

cards.name: Lederhosen
cards.text: For each Sheep that you convert to Food, place 1 Food from the general Supply on this card. If, at the end of the game, you have at least as many Food on the Lederhosen as you have Family members, you receive 2 Bonus points; if you have twice as many, you receive 3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Left Liberal
cards.text: Whenever you use 1 of the 6 leftmost Action spaces on the first game board, you receive 1 additional Wood.

cards.name: Legworker
cards.text: Each time you use an action space that is orthogonally adjacent to another action space occupied by one of your people, you get 1 wood.

cards.name: Lemon Trader
cards.text: Twice per round, you may exchange 1 Grain from your supply for 1 building resource, or 1 Vegetable from your supply for 2 different building resources.

cards.name: Lettuce Patch
cards.text: This card is a field that can only grow vegetables. You can immediately turn each vegetable you harvested from this card into 4 food.

cards.name: Lieutenant General
cards.text: For each field tile that another player places next to an existing field tile, you get 1 food from the general supply. In round 14, you get 1 grain instead.

cards.name: Lifting Machine
cards.text: At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can move 1 vegetable from one of your fields to your supply. (This is not considered a field phase.)

cards.name: Lighthouse
cards.text: The Lighthouse provides room for 1 Family member.

cards.name: Linen Weaver
cards.text: At the start of each round, this Occupation is passed left to the next player. It only counts as a played Occupation for the player who has it. All their Improvement costs are reduced by 1 Wood. When the original player has it, their Improvement costs are reduced by 1 Clay, 1 Stone, and 1 Reed also.

cards.name: Lion's Mound
cards.text: You may only play this card after Round 13/11/9/7/4 in a 1/2/3/4/5 player game. At the end of each Work phase, you receive 1 Bonus point if no other player occupies an Action space with a lower round number than you do. (Using the Round 1 space guarantees you the point.)

cards.name: Liquid Manure
cards.text: Whenever you Sow, place 1 additional Grain or Vegetable from the general supply on your newly planted fields.

cards.name: Little Peasant
cards.text: You immediately get 1 stone. As long as you live in a wooden house with exactly 2 rooms, actions spacesâ€”excluding Meeting Placeâ€”are not considered occupied for you.

cards.name: Little Stick Knitter
cards.text: From Round 5 on, each time you use the "sheep Market" accumulation space, you can also take a "Family Growth with Room Only" action.

cards.name: Livestock Keeper
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Wild boar. If you already have a Wild boar, you receive 1 Cattle instead. In the Breeding phase of each Harvest, you may pay 1 Food to receive 2 offspring of exactly 1 animal type that breeds instead of 1.

cards.name: Livestock Sustainer
cards.text: For each major improvement built by the other players, you can keep 1 animal on this card (max. 8). You can keep different types here.

cards.name: Loam Pit
cards.text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, you also get 3 clay.

cards.name: Lodger
cards.text: This card provides room for one person, but only until the returning home phase of round 9. If, by then, there is no room elsewhere for that person, remove it from play.

cards.name: Loess Gardener
cards.text: Each time you use the "Clay Pit" accumulation space, you can also buy 1 vegetable for 1 food.

cards.name: Loom
cards.text: Whenever you have at least 1/4/7 Sheep during the Field phase of a Harvest, you receive 1/2/3 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for every 3 Sheep.

cards.name: Loppers
cards.text: Each time you build 1 or more fences, you can also use this card to exchange 1 wood and 1 fence in your supply for 2 food and 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Lord of the Manor
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 bonus point for each scoring category where you have scored the maximum 4 points. (The bonus point is also awarded for 4 fenced stables.)

cards.name: Loudmouth
cards.text: Each time you take at least 4 building resources or 4 animals from an accumulation space, you also get 1 food.

cards.name: Lovable Vagabond
cards.text: Whenever you have no more Food during the Feeding phase of a Harvest and should take one of more Begging cards, you receive one fewer Begging card.

cards.name: Love for Agriculture
cards.text: You can sow crops in pastures covering 1 or 2 farmyard spaces. If you do, these pastures are also considered fields and hold 1 and 2 animals less, respectively.

cards.name: Love Garden
cards.text: At the end of a Work phase, whenever you have more rooms than people and all "Family growth" and "Build room(s)" Action spaces are occupied, you immediately receive a Family member token as a newborn.

cards.name: Love Letter
cards.text: If you use a "Family growth" action 1/2/3 rounds after playing this card, you also receive 2/3/5 Food. (Mark the 3rd round with an Arrow marker.)

cards.name: Love Messenger
cards.text: In the next round and in Round 13 and 14, only you can take a "Family growth" Action space with your first person. (Any player can take it with their second person or higher.)

cards.name: Lover
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately carry out a "Family growth even without room" action (Similar to the Round card from Stage 5). Playing this card costs you an additional 4 Food.

cards.name: Lover's Tryst
cards.text: If you play this Minor Improvement on the "Starting player" Action space, instead of taking Starting player, you may take a "Family growth" action. You must have room in your home.

cards.name: Lumber
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 3 Wood.

cards.name: Lumber Mill
cards.text: Pay 1 Wood less for all Major and Minor Improvements.

cards.name: Lumber Mill
cards.text: Every improvement costs you 1 wood less.

cards.name: Lumber Virtuoso
cards.text: Each harvest in which you have at least 5 wood in your supply, you can discard down to 5 wood to take a "Build Stables" or "Build Wood Rooms" action by paying the usual costs.

cards.name: Lumberjack
cards.text: You immediately get 1 wood. Additionally, place 1 wood on each of the next round spaces, up to the number of fences you built. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.

cards.name: Lutenist
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Traveling Players" Action space with a person, you receive 1 Food. Immediately afterwards, you may buy exactly 1 Vegetable for 2 Food. (If you use the Action space yourself, there is no benefit.)

cards.name: Lutenist
cards.text: Each time another player uses the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you get 1 food and 1 wood. Immediately after, you can buy exactly 1 vegetable for 2 food.

cards.name: Luxurious Hostel
cards.text: During scoring, if you then have more stone rooms than people, you get 4 bonus points. You can only use one card to get bonus points for your stone house.

cards.name: Lynchet
cards.text: In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 food for each harvested field tile that is orthogonally adjacent to your house.

cards.name: Madonna Statue
cards.text: The Madonna Statue has no effect. (You must remove Improvements that are on the table in front of you. You may not discard cards from your hand. It is irrelevant whether you remove Major or Minor Improvements.)

cards.name: Magic Beans
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Vegetables.

cards.name: Magician
cards.text: Whenever you use your last person to choose the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you receive an additional 1 Grain and 1 Food.

cards.name: Magnate
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately receive 2 Stone. At the end of the game, the Player(s) with the most Building resources receive(s) 3 Bonus points.

cards.name: Maid
cards.text: Once you have built a Clay hut, place 1 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. (If you already have a Clay hut or a Stone house when you play this card, place the Food immediately)

cards.name: Maidservant
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space or one of its neighbors ("Day Laborer", "Take 1 Reed", or the Round 4 Action space), you receive 1 additional Food for each person occupying any of these 4 spaces excluding the person you just placed.

cards.name: Mail Coach Driver
cards.text: From now until the end of the game, the other players only receive goods from Action spaces when they return their Family members to their home. (This card applies to goods that are on Action spaces as well as goods that are taken from the Supply, but not to goods that are received from cards.)

cards.name: Mailman
cards.text: Place 2 Wood, 2 Clay, 1 Reed, and 1 Stone on four different revealed Action spaces respectively (occupied or unoccupied). Afterward, any player (including you) who uses one of these spaces may also take the extra resource(s) by paying you 1 Food first.

cards.name: Maintenance Premium
cards.text: Place 3 food on this card. Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you get 1 food from this card. Each time you renovate restock this card to 3 food.

cards.name: Mandoline
cards.text: Once per round, you can pay 1 vegetable to get 1 bonus point. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Manger
cards.text: During scoring, if your pastures cover at least 6/7/8/10 farm yard spaces, you get 1/2/3/4 bonus points.

cards.name: Manger
cards.text: At the end of the game, if your pastures occupy 6/7/8/9+ farmyard spaces, you receive 1/2/3/4 Bonus points.

cards.name: Manservant
cards.text: When you build a Stone house, place 3 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. (If you already have a Stone house when you play this card, place the Food immediately.)

cards.name: Mansion
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus points for each room in your Stone house. (In total, you receive 4 points per room instead of the usual 2 points.)

cards.name: Mantlepiece
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 bonus point for each complete round left to play. You may no longer renovate your house.

cards.name: Manual Labourer
cards.text: At the end of each round in which you received exactly 1 type of building resource (in any way), you also receive 1 more building resource of that type.

cards.name: Manufacturer
cards.text: Once you have a Clay hut or a Stone house, the Joiner, Pottery and Basketmaker's Workshop are Minor Improvements for you and their cost is reduced by 2 building resources of your choice.

cards.name: Manure
cards.text: At the end of each round that does not end with a Harvest, you can (optionally) take 1 Grain or Vegetable from each of your fields and place it in your personal supply.

cards.name: Market Crier
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action, you can take an additional 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable. If you do this, the other players each receive 1 Grain from the supply.

cards.name: Market Fountain
cards.text: At the start of the next Work phase, place 1 Food on each of the next 6 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. This card counts as a Well.

cards.name: Market Square
cards.text: When you play this card, place 4 Building resources of your choice from the general supply on it. Whenever any player (including you) receives Building resources from an Action space, they may exchange one for a different resource on this card. Any player who does this must pay you 1 Food.

cards.name: Market Stall
cards.text: After the field phase of each harvest, you can exchange 1 grain plus 1 fence (both from your supply) for 5 food.

cards.name: Market Stall
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Market Woman
cards.text: Whenever you receive Vegetables through a Family member's action or through a Minor Improvement, you receive an additional 2 Grain.

cards.name: Marly Machine
cards.text: At the beginning of a turn, whenever at least one player (including you) gets at least 1 Food from a Well, you also get 1 Food.

cards.name: Marriage Counselor
cards.text: Whenever, at the start of a round, another player has at least 2 more Family members than you or all other players have at least 1 more Family member than you, you may pay 1 Food to use 1 Guest token that round.

cards.name: Marsh
cards.text: When you play this card, you may return 2 different animals to the general supply to Plow 2 fields.

cards.name: Martial Artist
cards.text: At the start of each Harvest, you may discard up to 2 Minor Improvements from your hand to receive 2 Food each.

cards.name: Mason
cards.text: Once during the game, at any time after your Stone house reaches at least 4 rooms, you may extend it by 1 room at no cost.

cards.name: Master Baker
cards.text: Whenever another player Bakes bread, you can Bake bread if you have a Baking Improvement with the bread symbol. If you take a Bake action yourself (not using this card), you receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Master Baker's Apprentice
cards.text: When you play this card, mark a revealed Action space with an Arrow marker. This Action space now has the added text "and/or Bake Bread." Whenever another player Bakes bread using this space, you receive 1 Food from the general supply. When you play this card, you may also take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Master Brewer
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, the Master Brewer can convert up to 1 Grain to 3 Food.

cards.name: Master Bricklayer
cards.text: Each time you build a major improvement, reduce the stone cost by the number of rooms you have built onto you initial house.

cards.name: Master Builder
cards.text: Once during the game, at any time after your home reaches at least 5 rooms, you may extend it by 1 room at no cost.

cards.name: Master Carpenter.
cards.text: You can build fences around your rooms by fencing all 4 sides of a room. You may not fence more than 1 room each round. Each fenced room can hold an additional Family member. Fenced rooms are not pastures.

cards.name: Master Cook
cards.text: Each round, instead of placing your first Family member on an Action space, you may place it on this card and receive 2 Food and 1 Guest token to place that round. (You may not do this if you will be placing more people after your first without another player placing in between.)

cards.name: Master Detective
cards.text: Reveal the Round card that would enter play 3 Rounds after the current Round. If it is an Accumulation space, place goods on it as if starting a Round. Immediately move the person used to play this occupation onto the revealed space and take the action if possible. During the Returning home phase, hide the Round card again.

cards.name: Master Forester
cards.text: Include the "2 Wood" Action card from the 3-player game as an additional forest. At the start of each round, place 2 Wood on the card. Any player who uses this action must pay you 2 Food.

cards.name: Master Hora
cards.text: Immediately before each time you place a person on an action space with the (meeple) symbol on the game board extension, you can buy 1 vegetable for 1 food.

cards.name: Master Shepherd
cards.text: Place 1 Sheep on each of the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Sheep.

cards.name: Master Stableman
cards.text: Whenever you use a person's action to take 2 or more animals from an Accumulation space, you can also build up to 2 stables, at a cost of 1 Wood each, before taking the animals.

cards.name: Master Workman
cards.text: Each time before you use an action space card on round spaces 1/2/3/4, you get 1 wood/clay/reed/stone.

cards.name: Mastermind
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus Point for each card with a Bonus point symbol that you play after this one. (An example of a Bonus point symbol appears on the bottom of this card.)

cards.name: Matchmaker
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Wood, 1 building resource of your choice, 1 Sheep, 1 Wild Boar, 1 Food, 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable. Also, you may receive 2 Bonus points. In the Returning home phase of this round, remove 1 of your Family members from the game completely.

cards.name: Material Deliveryman
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) takes 5/6/7/8+ goods from an accumulation space, you get 1 wood/clay/reed/stone from the general supply.

cards.name: Material Hub
cards.text: Immediately place 2 of each building resource on this card. Each time any player (including you) takes at least 5 wood, 4 clay, 3 reed, or 3 stone, you get 1 of that building resource from this card.

cards.name: Materne Jam
cards.text: At the start of each harvest, you may show and discard 1 Minor Improvement card from your hand. If you do, you receive 1 Building resource from the general supply of a type that would be needed to play the discarded card.

cards.name: Mathematician
cards.text: From Round 6, if there are Wood Action spaces with the same amount of Wood after refilling each round (at the end of phase 2), you can take 1 Wood from one of those spaces. This also applies to Clay Action spaces. In 5 player games, this also applies to Stone Action spaces. You can take only 1 resource per round.

cards.name: Maypole
cards.text: Play this card before the end of Round 4. When you play this card, place one of your unbuilt fences upright on an unused farmyard space. If you have not knocked it over by the end of the game, you earn 2 Bonus points. (The farmyard space counts as "used".) (If another player knocks it over, you can replace it)

cards.name: Meat Pie
cards.text: Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread, you may pay 1 additional Grain and 1 animal for 3 Bonus points. When you play this card, you may also take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Meat Seller
cards.text: If you have an Oven, you can change your animals into Food an any time. Take 2 Food for each Sheep, 3 for each Wild boar and 4 for each Cattle.

cards.name: Meat Supplier
cards.text: At the start of each Harvest, you can exchange 1 Wild boar or Cattle for 1 Bonus point. If you do this, all players receive 1 Food from the general supply.

cards.name: Meeting Post
cards.text: When you play this card, every player must place 1 Occupation from their hand face up on the board. Add random Occupations from the deck until there are 5. Whenever any player plays an Occupation, that player may play 1 of these Occupations instead of 1 from their hand. If so, you get any Food paid.

cards.name: Member of a Co-operative
cards.text: Whenever another player performs a "Family growth" action, you may place 1 Food from the supply on this card. Once during a 3/4/5 player game, you may pay 3/4/5 Food from this card to play your next "Family growth" action as "Family growth even without room".

cards.name: Mendicant
cards.text: At the end of the game, you can discard up to 2 Begging card without losing points for them.

cards.name: Merchant
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Minor Improvement" or "Minor or Major Improvement" action, you can pay 1 Food to use the action a second time.

cards.name: Middleman
cards.text: Place 1 stone and 1 food on all action spaces with the (meeple) symbol on the game board extension. Next time you place a person on them, you get the goods.

cards.name: Midwife
cards.text: Whenever another player has a larger family than you after s/he has offspring, you receive 1 Food. If s/he has at least 2 more Family members that you, you receive 2 Food. (The Food is taken from the supply, not from the other player.)

cards.name: Migrant Workers
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you may immediately afterward pay 1 Food to Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Military Leader
cards.text: When you play this card, you may not place any of your persons in Round 13 and 14. At the end of the game, you receive 13 Bonus points. You do not take part in the Harvest Phases at the end of Round 13 and 14. Play this card before Round 13.

cards.name: Milk Jug
cards.text: Whenever any player uses the "Take 1 Cattle" Action space, you receive 3 Food and each other player receives 1 Food.

cards.name: Milk Jug
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) uses the "Cattle Market" accumulation space, you get 3 food, and each other player gets 1 food.

cards.name: Milking Hand
cards.text: In the Field phase of the Harvest, you receive 1/2/3 Food for having at least 1/3/5 Cattle, without having to give up the Cattle. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for every 2 Cattle.

cards.name: Milking Parlor
cards.text: When you play this card, if you have at least 1/3/4 sheep, you immediately get 2/3/4 food. The same applies if you have at least 1/2/3 cattle.

cards.name: Milking Place
cards.text: In the feeding phase of each harvest, you get 1 food. You can no longer hold animals in your house (not even via another card).

cards.name: Milking Shed
cards.text: In each Harvest, at the beginning of the Field phase, count the total number of Sheep and Cattle in all players' farms. You receive 1 Food for each fifth Sheep and for each third Cattle.

cards.name: Milking Stool
cards.text: Whenever you have at least 1/3/5 Cattle during the Field phase of a Harvest, you receive 1/2/3 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1 bonus point for every 2 Cattle.

cards.name: Mill Wheel
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grain Utilization" action space while the "Fishing" accumulation space is occupied, you get an additional 2 food.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread, you receive 2 additional Food.

cards.name: Millwright
cards.text: You immediately get 1 grain. Each time you build fences, stables, and rooms, or renovate your house, you can replace up to 2 building resources of any type with 1 grain each.

cards.name: Millwright
cards.text: You immediately get 1 grain. Each time you build fences, stables, and rooms, or renovate your house, you can replace up to 2 building resources of any type with 1 grain each.

cards.name: Miner
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you can take all the Stone markers from one of the "1 Stone" Action spaces (stage 2 or stage 4) in the Returning home phase (phase 4).

cards.name: Mineral Feeder
cards.text: At the start of each round that does not end with a harvest, if you have at least 1 sheep in a pasture, you get 1 grain.

cards.name: Mineralogist
cards.text: Each time you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you also get 1 of the other good, stone/clay.

cards.name: Mini Pasture
cards.text: Immediately fence a farmyard space, without paying wood for the fences. (If you already have pastures, the new one must be adjacent to an existing one.)

cards.name: Mini Pasture
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately Fence one space in your farmyard. (You do not need to pay Wood for the fences.)

cards.name: Minimalist
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 9/6/4/2 Bonus points for having 0/1/2/3 Improvements in front of you.

cards.name: Minimum Wage
cards.text: Once each round, whenever you have no Food in your personal supply, you receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Mining Hammer
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food. Each time you renovate, you can also build a stable without paying wood.

cards.name: Mink Breeder
cards.text: In each round from Round 5 on, the first player to place their second person on the same gameboard as their first person must first pay you 1 Food.

cards.name: Minstrel
cards.text: At the start of each returning home phase, if only one action space card on round space 1 to 4 is unoccupied, you can use that action space.

cards.name: Miser
cards.text: Whenever you use a "Build Room(s)" action on an Action space, you may pay 1 Wood/ Clay/ Stone less and 1 Reed less if you build exactly 1 Wood/ Clay/ Stone room. (It is irrelevant whether you build stables.)

cards.name: Moldboard Plow
cards.text: Twice during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" action, you may Plow 2 fields instead of 1. This does not apply to the "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action.

cards.name: Mole Plow
cards.text: Each time you use the "Farmland" or "Cultivation" action space, you can plow 1 additional field.

cards.name: Monastic Vows
cards.text: At the end of each Work phase, you may take a Begging card. If you do, you may immediately receive 3 Food and place a Guest token. Afterward, return the Guest token.

cards.name: Mooch
cards.text: When you play this card, choose another player. Until the end of the next Harvest, you may convert animals, Vegetables, Grain, and building resources to Food as if you owned the chosen player's Improvements in addition to yours. (The chosen player may use their Improvements normally.)

cards.name: Moonshine
cards.text: Randomly select an occupation in your hand. Either play it for an occupation cost of 2 food, or give it to the player to your left.

cards.name: Moral Crusader
cards.text: Immediately before the start of each round, if there are goods on the remaining round space that are promised to you, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Mother of Twins
cards.text: When you have Family growth, you can pay 3 Food to bring 2 new Family members instead of 1 into the game. You need only have space for 1 Family member in your home.

cards.name: Mother of Two
cards.text: As long as you have exactly 4 family members, whenever you place your second person in a Work phase, you may place it between 2 adjacent and unoccupied Round cards from Rounds 1 to 7. If you do, take both actions consecutively in any order. Both Action spaces count as occupied afterwards.

cards.name: Mountain Cave
cards.text: Each Harvest, you may use the Mountain Cave to exchange up to 1 Wood for 1 Stone.

cards.name: Mountain Hiker
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use an accumulation space on the game board extension, you can buy 1 stone for 1 food.

cards.name: Mountain Shepherd
cards.text: Each time you use either "Quarry" accumulation space, you immediately get an additional 1 sheep from the general supply.

cards.name: Muck Rake
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for exactly 1 unfenced stable holding exactly 1 sheep. The same applies to wild boar and cattle, if held in different unfenced stables.

cards.name: Mud Patch
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wild boar. You can hold 1 wild boar on each of your unplanted field tiles.

cards.name: Mud Wallower
cards.text: Each time you use an accumulation space, place 1 clay from the general supply on this card. You must immediately exchange 4 clay on this card for 1 wild boar, held by this card.

cards.name: Muddy Puddles
cards.text: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 wild boar, 1 food, 1 cattle, 1 food, and 1 sheep on this card. At any time, you can pay 1 clay to take the top good.

cards.name: Mummy's Boy
cards.text: Once per round, when placing a person after your first two, you can place it on the action space with your 2nd person and use that space again. (Mark the action space).

cards.name: Mushroom Collector
cards.text: Whenever you use a Family member's action to take Wood from an Action space, you can leave 1 of the Wood on the space and take 2 Food in exchange.

cards.name: Musketeer
cards.text: Place an Arrow marker in the intersection between 4 Action spaces. At the end of each Work phase, if 2/3/4 of those spaces are occupied by your Family members, you receive 1 Sheep / Wild boar / Cattle.

cards.name: Navvy
cards.text: When you play this card, you may immediately pay 1 Food for 1 Grain. Once each round, whenever you Sow, you may Plow 1 field immediately afterward.

cards.name: Necklace
cards.text: Whenever at the end of a Work phase, you have at least 2 Family members occupying 2 orthogonally adjacent Action spaces, you receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Needlework Teacher
cards.text: Whenever any player uses the "Starting Player" Action space, if you still have at least 2 unused persons in your home afterwards (including Guests), you receive 2 Food from the general supply.

cards.name: Nest Site
cards.text: Each time 1 reed is placed on a non-empty "Reed Bank" accumulation space during the preparation phase, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Net Fisherman
cards.text: If one of your people uses an Action space that provides Reed, you can take all the Food markers from the "Fishing" space in the Returning home phase. (Phase 4).

cards.name: Neutrality
cards.text: In the next Round, you can only place your People after the other Players have placed all of theirs. For each Person that you place late, you receive 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: New Market
cards.text: Each time you use an action space card on round spaces 8 to 11, you get 1 additional food.

cards.name: New Purchase
cards.text: Before the start of each round that ends with a harvest, you can buy one of each of the following crops: 2 Food â†’ 1 Grain; 4 Food â†’ 1 Vegetable

cards.name: Newly-Plowed Field
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately plow 1 field, which needs not be adjacent to another field.

cards.name: Night Watch
cards.text: The Night Watch is an additional Action space for all. In the Replenish phase of each round, add 1 Grain to this card. A player who uses this action must pay 2 Food to the general supply and receives the Grain. Some or all of this Grain may be immediately exchanged for Bonus points, 1 for 1.

cards.name: Night-School Student
cards.text: Each returning home phase in which no player returns a person from a "Lessons" action space, you can play an occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food.

cards.name: Nightworker
cards.text: Before the start of each work phase, you can place a person on an accumulation space of a building resource not in your supply. (Then proceed with the start player.)

cards.name: No Potato
cards.text: Until the end of the game, Vegetables give you 1 Food less. For every harvest remaining when you play this card, you receive 1 Bonus point. Begging cards included in prereq.

cards.name: No Son of Man
cards.text: You receive 1 Wood and may immediately place another person.

cards.name: North Sea Fisherman
cards.text: Whenever you use the most recent Round card, you can take all the Food from the "Fishing" Action space without using a person. Whenever another player uses the "Fishing" Action space, they receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Nutrition Expert
cards.text: At the start of each round, you can exchange a set comprised of 1 animal of any type, 1 grain, and 1 vegetable for 5 food and 2 bonus points.

cards.name: Oak Cask
cards.text: When you play this card, place 1 Food from the general supply on it. During the Field phase of each Harvest, add 1 Food from the general supply to this card if it has Food on it. At any time, you may take all of the Food from this card.

cards.name: Obedient Brother
cards.text: As long as you have exactly 4 Family members, whenever you place your third person in a Round you may place your fourth person immediately afterwards, even on the same Action space. (Guests do not count as Family members.)

cards.name: Oceanographer
cards.text: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 Vegetable, 1 Stone, 1 Grain, 1 Clay, 1 Wood on this card. Whenever you Plow exactly 1 field, you may receive the top item.

cards.name: Off-Siter
cards.text: Once the total printed building cost of all the major improvements you have is at least 9 building resources, this card provides room for 1 person for the rest of the game.

cards.name: Office
cards.text: At any time, you may exchange 1 Clay for 1 Stone. At any time you may exchange 1 Grain in your supply for 1 Vegetable. At any time you may exchange 1 Wild boar for 1 Cattle.

cards.name: Old Master
cards.text: At the start of each Work phase in Rounds 3 to 7, you receive 1 Wood. If there are at least 6 Wood on the "Take 3 Wood" Action space, you receive 1 Stone instead of 1 Wood.

cards.name: Oldest Occupation
cards.text: From Round 5, whenever any player uses the "Day Laborer" Action space, they may pay you 2 Food to immediately take a "Family Growth" action. (They must have room in their home. If you use Day Laborer, you may grow for free.)

cards.name: On-Site Reverend
cards.text: At the start of each harvest, you get 1 building resource of your choice.

cards.name: Only Child
cards.text: If there are still 3/6/9 full Rounds to be played, you immediately receive 1/2/3 Wood. You receive 3 Bonus points if you have exactly 3 Family members on your farmyard at the end of the game. (Guest markers are not counted as Family members.)

cards.name: Open Air Farmer
cards.text: When you play this card, you remove exactly 3 stables in your supply from play to build a pasture covering 2 farmyard spaces. You only need to pay a total of 2 wood for fences

cards.name: Open Gate
cards.text: At the start of the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you may return 1 Sheep to the general supply to receive 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: Opinion Leader
cards.text: At the start of each Round, you can mark one Action space of your choice with an Arrow (Claim) marker. Each player can use this Action space during this Round. (This cannot be used on Action spaces on which Goods are placed). Remove the Arrow marker at the end of each Round.

cards.name: Opportunist
cards.text: Whenever you use your last action in a round to take one or more types of building resources that have not yet been taken this Work phase, you receive 1 additional resource of one of those types.

cards.name: Orchard
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each of the next Round spaces up to the number of planted fields in your farmyard. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Organic Farmer
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each pasture that contains at least 1 animal, but could contain at least 3 more animals than it does. (This also applies to the Forest Pasture.)

cards.name: Outhouse
cards.text: The Outhouse has no effect. You can only build it if at least one other player has fewer than 2 Occupations. (It is irrelevant how many Occupations you have played.)

cards.name: Outrider
cards.text: Whenever you use the most recent Round card with one of your people, you receive 1 additional Grain.

cards.name: Outskirts Director
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grove" or "Hollow" accumulation space, you can place 2 reed from the general supply on the other space. If you do, you can immediately place another person.

cards.name: Oven Firing Boy
cards.text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you get an additional "Bake Bread" action.

cards.name: Oven Site
cards.text: When you play this card, you get 2 wood and you can immediately build the "Clay Oven" or "Stone Oven" major improvement. Either way, it only costs you 1 clay and 1 stone.

cards.name: Overhaul
cards.text: Immediately raze all of your fences, add up to 3 fences from your supply, and rebuild them. (You do not lose any animals during this.)

cards.name: Overwinterer
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain. At the end of each Harvest, you may buy up to 1 Vegetable for 2 Food.

cards.name: Ox Cart
cards.text: The first time you have 1 Cattle, you may immediately Plow 1 field for each Harvest remaining. (If you already have Cattle when you play this card, Plow immediately.)

cards.name: Ox Team
cards.text: When you play this card, count how many complete rounds are left to be played. You can Plow this many Fields, up to a maximum of 3.

cards.name: Oyster Eater
cards.text: Whenever any player uses the "Fishing" Action space, you must receive 1 Bonus point. Afterward, if you still have at least 1 person in your home, you must skip placing a person on one of your turns in that round. (You still get to place the person on a later turn).

cards.name: Oyster Eater
cards.text: Each time the "Fishing" accumulation space is used, you get 1 bonus point and must skip placing your next person that round. (You can place the person on a later turn.)

cards.name: Packaging Artist
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain. Each time you get a "Minor Improvement" action, you can take a "Bake Bread" action instead.

cards.name: Paddocks
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately build (at no cost) up to 4 fences within an existing pasture.

cards.name: Pan Baker
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grain Utilization" action space, you also get 2 clay and 1 wood.

cards.name: Pancake Pan
cards.text: If you have a Cooking Improvement, you may convert 1 Grain into 2 Food at any time.

cards.name: Paper Knife
cards.text: Select 3 occupations in your hand. Select one of them randomly, which you can play immediately without paying an occupation cost.

cards.name: Paper Maker
cards.text: Immediately before playing each occupation after this one, you can pay 1 wood total to get 1 food for each occupation you have in front of you.

cards.name: Par Force Hunting
cards.text: Add 4 and 7 to the current round and place 1 Wild boar on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you can pay 1 Food to take the Wild boar.

cards.name: Park Bench
cards.text: The player on you left chooses 1 of your Unused farmyard spaces. Place 1 Wood from the general supply on this space. It counts as used and you can not build anything on it. (In a Solo game randomly choose a space.)

cards.name: Park Cemetery
cards.text: Place 3 Stone on the "Plow 1 field" Action space from the general supply. Any player who uses that space may also receive 1 Stone from it. If there is no Stone on that space, you may discard this card and Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Parlor
cards.text: Immediately change 1 room at no cost into a Stone room. (You will never need to renovate this room. Your home is still considered the material of your other rooms.)

cards.name: Parquet Setter
cards.text: At the end of each Work phase in which you reduced the number of your unused farmyard spaces, you receive 1 Wood. If you reduced it by 2 or more spaces, you also receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Parrot Breeder
cards.text: On your turn, if you pay 1 grain to the general supply, you can use the same action space that the player to your right has just used on their turn.

cards.name: Part-Time Worker
cards.text: Each time you use an accumulation space with exactly 2/4/6 goods on it, you can leave 1/2/3 goods on the space. If you do, you get 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle.

cards.name: Party Organizer
cards.text: As soon as the next player but you gains their 5th person, you immediately get 8 food (not retroactively). During scoring, if only you have 5 people, you get 3 bonus points.

cards.name: Pasteurization Expert
cards.text: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 Cattle, Sheep, Wild boar, Sheep on this card. You receive the top item when you receive that type of animal outside of the Breeding phase of Harvest.

cards.name: Pastor
cards.text: If, when you play this card or later in the game, you are the last player to have only 2 rooms in your home, you receive 3 Wood, 2 Clay, 1 Reed and 1 Stone.

cards.name: Pasture Master
cards.text: Each time you renovate, you get 2 food and 1 additional animal of the respective type in each of your pastures with stable.

cards.name: Patch Caregiver
cards.text: When you play this card, you can choose to buy 1 grain for 1 food, or 1 vegetable for 3 food. This card is a field.

cards.name: Patch Caretaker
cards.text: Each time you use an accumulation space while already having used another accumulation space for the same type of good that work phase, you also get 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Patron
cards.text: In the future, whenever you play an Occupation, you receive 2 Food before you pay the costs of the Occupation.

cards.name: Pattern Maker
cards.text: Whenever another player renovates, you may exchange exactly 2 Wood for 1 Grain, 1 Food and 1 Bonus point. (Write down the Bonus point. If you renovate, you get no benefit from this card.)

cards.name: Pattern Maker
cards.text: Each time another player renovates, you can exchange exactly 2 wood for 1 grain, 1 food, and 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Paved Road
cards.text: The player with the most valuable street receives 2 Bonus points when scoring. (This Paved Road is more valuable than the Clay Path that costs 3 Clay which is more valuable than the Wooden Path that costs 1 Wood.)

cards.name: Pavior
cards.text: At the end of each preparation phase, if you have at least 1 stone in your supply, you get 1 food. In round 14, you get 1 vegetable instead.

cards.name: Pawnbroker
cards.text: At any time, you may convert all the printed Victory points (if any) of an Improvement in front of you to 3 Food per point. After, you may not return or remove the Improvement and you no longer receive its Victory points. If Pawnbroker gets turned face down or discarded, you still lose the points.

cards.name: Paymaster
cards.text: Each time another player uses a food accumulation space, you can give them 1 grain from your supply to get 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Pear Peeler
cards.text: Whenever you use an action to take Wood from an Action space, you may leave 1/2/3 Wood on the space and take 1 Grain/ Vegetable/ Grain and Vegetable in exchange.

cards.name: Pearl Seeker
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space you receive 1 additional Stone. Also, you can use Food that you take from the Action space (but not Fishing cards) to buy more Stone. Each Stone costs 2 Food.

cards.name: Peasants Boutique
cards.text: Every harvest you may convert 1 Reed into 4 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for having 1/3/4 Reed. You do not receive additional Bonus points from the Basket Maker's Workshop.

cards.name: Pellet Press
cards.text: Once per round, you can pay 1 reed. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Pelt Roof
cards.text: For each Wild boar, Cattle, or 2 Sheep you convert into Food, you may place 1 Reed from the general supply on this card. You may use this Reed to extend or renovate your home.

cards.name: Pelts
cards.text: For each Animal that you slaughter and return to the general supply, you may place 1 Food from your personal supply in 1 of your rooms. You may have a maximum of 1 Food in each room. You cannot use these Food any more, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.

cards.name: Perennial Rye
cards.text: Each round that does not end with a harvest, you can pay 1 grain to breed exactly 1 type of animal. (This is not considered a breeding phase.)

cards.name: Permaculturist
cards.text: You may sow Grain on Unused farmyard spaces. Planted spaces count as Grain fields and do not need to be adjacent to your existing plowed fields. You may move Grain from these fields to the general supply at any time and you must before scoring (or if this card gets removed or turned face down).

cards.name: Perpetual Student
cards.text: Whenever you play an Occupation card, you can ask another player to randomly draw one of your cards instead of choosing one yourself. If you do this, you receive 3 Food before you pay the costs of the card, but you must play the card that the other player draws. if you are unable to pay the costs of the card, you must draw Begging cards for any missing Food.

cards.name: Pest Exterminator
cards.text: If you have no built fences, place 1 of your fences on each of the 14 round cards, both revealed and unrevealed. Whenever you use an Action space with your fence on it, you may return the fence to your supply. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each fence returned after the first 6.

cards.name: Pet Broker
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 sheep. You can keep 1 sheep on each occupation in front of you.

cards.name: Pet Grower
cards.text: Each time you use an animal accumulation space, if afterward you have no animal in your house, you also get 1 sheep.

cards.name: Pet Lover
cards.text: Each time you use an accumulation space providing exactly 1 animal, you can leave it on the space and get one from the general supply instead, as well as 3 food and 1 grain.

cards.name: Pet Lover
cards.text: Each time you use an accumulation space providing exactly 1 animal, you can leave it on the space and get one from the general supply instead, as well as 3 food and 1 grain.

cards.name: Petrified Wood
cards.text: Immediately exchange up to 3 wood for 1 stone each.

cards.name: Petting Zoo
cards.text: At the end of the game, if you have all the animal types in your farm, you receive 1 Bonus point if you also have at least 2 Sheep and 1 Bonus point if you also have at least 2 Wild boar.

cards.name: Pieceworker
cards.text: Whenever you receive Wood, Clay, Reed, Stone or Grain on an Action space, you can buy one more of the same good for 1 Food. Whenever you receive Vegetable(s) on an Action space, you can buy one more for 2 Food.

cards.name: Pig Breeder
cards.text: Your Wild boar breed at the end of Round 12, if there is room for the piglet. When you play this card, you receive 1 Wild boar.

cards.name: Pig Catcher
cards.text: Whenever you use a person to take Wood that is on an Action space, you can leave 2 of the Wood on the space and take a Wild boar instead.

cards.name: Pig Owner
cards.text: The first time after you play this card that you have 5 wild boars on your farm, you immediately get 3 bonus points.

cards.name: Pig Stalker
cards.text: Each time you use an animal accumulation space, if you occupy either the action space immediately above or below that accumulation space, you also get 1 wild boar.

cards.name: Pig Wallow
cards.text: Immediately return 1 empty field to the general supply to fence a single farmyard space (in the same or different space). (Normal fencing rules still apply.) You do not need to pay Wood for the fences.

cards.name: Pig Whisperer
cards.text: Add 4,7 and 10 to the current round and place 1 Wild boar on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Wild boar.

cards.name: Pigswill
cards.text: Each time you use the "Fencing" action space, you also get 1 wild boar.

cards.name: Pilgrim
cards.text: You receive 2 Food before you pay the costs of playing this Occupation. At the start of a round, if you have no building resources, you may take 1 building resource from the supply. At the start of a round, if you have no Food, you may take 1 Food from the supply. (At any time, you may move resources from your personal supply to the general supply.)

cards.name: Pilgrimage Site
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space for all players. A player who uses this Action must pay you 1 Grain to receive 1 Vegetable and 1 Stone from the general supply and 1 Bonus point. If you use the Pilgrimage Site yourself, pay the Grain to the general supply instead.

cards.name: Pillar Biter
cards.text: Whenever another player builds 1 or more fences, you may immediately build 3/4 fences by paying 2/3 Wood. (You must obey fence rules.)

cards.name: Pine Forest
cards.text: At the start of each round, you may place 1 Wood on this card if you have zero Wood in your supply. When this card has 5 Wood, move the Wood from this card to your supply. (You may not give Wood to the general supply for nothing)

cards.name: Pioneering Spirit
cards.text: This card is an action space for you only. In rounds 3-5, it provides a "renovation" action. In rounds 6-8, it provides your choice of 1 vegetable, wild boar, or cattle.

cards.name: Pipe Smoker
cards.text: Whenever you have at least 1 planted Grain field at the start of a Harvest, you receive 2 Wood.

cards.name: Pitchfork
cards.text: Whenever you extend or renovate your home, you may pay with Reed directly from Accumulation spaces.

cards.name: Pitchfork
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space, if the "Farmland" action space is occupied you also get 3 food.

cards.name: Plane
cards.text: Whenever you turn 1 Wood into Food using the Joinery, Sawmill or Cabinetmaker, you receive 1 additional Food. You can choose instead to turn a second Wood into exactly 2 Food.

cards.name: Plant Fertilizer
cards.text: In each field with exactly 1 good, you can immediately place 1 additional good of the same type.

cards.name: Planter Box
cards.text: Whenever you Sow, each of the fields you Sow that is orthogonally adjacent to a room in your home gets an additional 2 Grain or 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Plentiful Fields
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Food for each planted plowed field in your farmyard.

cards.name: Plow Driver
cards.text: Once you have a Stone house, you can pay 1 Food at the start of each round to Plow (at most) 1 field.

cards.name: Plow Hero
cards.text: Each time you use the "Farmland" or "Cultivation" action space with the first person you place in a round, you can plow 1 additional field for 1 food.

cards.name: Plow Maker
cards.text: Whenever you use either the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action spaces, you can pay 1 Food to Plow 1 additional field.

cards.name: Plowman
cards.text: Add 4,7, and 10 to the current round and place 1 field on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you can Plow that 1 field by paying 1 Food.

cards.name: Plowsmith
cards.text: Each time another player takes at least 4 wood from an accumulation space, you can immediately pay 1 food to plow 1 field.

cards.name: Plum Patch
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each of the next Round spaces, up to the number of planted fields in your farmyard. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Plumber
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Major Improvement" action space, you can take a "renovation" action, paying 2 clay or 2 stone less for the renovation.

cards.name: Politician
cards.text: Twice each round, you may exchange 1 Reed for 1 Stone, or 1 Stone for 1 Reed. When you play this card, you receive 1 Stone.

cards.name: Pond Hut
cards.text: Place 1 food on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Pond Watchman
cards.text: At the end of a round, after all other players have taken their actions, you may pay 1 Food to move one of your people that used the "Fishing" Action space this round to a free Wood Action space and take that action.

cards.name: Poorhouse
cards.text: At the start of each round, randomly choose 1 player among the players with the least Food markers in their personal supply, to receive 1 Food. If you have the least, then you receive the Food.

cards.name: Poppy Field
cards.text: You immediately receive 1 Grain and 1 Vegetable. The player on your left chooses 1 of your Unused farmyard spaces. Mark it with a green Arrow marker. This space must remain unused until all other spaces are used.

cards.name: Porter
cards.text: Whenever you take at least 4 of the same Building resource from an Action space, you receive 1 additional Building resource of that type and 1 Food from the general supply.

cards.name: Porter
cards.text: Each time you take at least 4 of the same building resource from an accumulation space, you get 1additional building resource of the accumulating type and 1 food.

cards.name: Portmonger
cards.text: Each time you take 1/2/3+ food from a food accumulation space, you also get 1 vegetable/grain/reed.

cards.name: Potato Dibber
cards.text: Whenever you Sow fields with Vegetables, place 1 additional Vegetable on each field that you Sow.

cards.name: Potato Digger
cards.text: When you play this card, if you have at least 2/4/5 unplanted field tiles, you immediately get 1/2/3 vegetables.

cards.name: Potato Eater
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, your people need only 1 Food each if the Food comes from Vegetables converted in that Feeding phase. (People who are not fed with Vegetables feed normally.)

cards.name: Potato Harvester
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 3 food. For each vegetable you get from your fields during the field phase of the harvest, you get 1 additional food.

cards.name: Potato Harvester
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 3 Food. For each Vegetable that you receive from your fields in the Field phase of Harvest, you receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Potato Planter
cards.text: At the end of each work phase in which you occupy the "Clay Pit" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space while the respective other is unoccupied, you get 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Potato Ridger
cards.text: Each time after you harvest 1+ vegetables, if you then have 3+ vegetables in your supply, you can turn exactly 1 vegetable into 6 food. With 4+ vegetables, you must do so.

cards.name: Potter
cards.text: In each Harvest, the Potter can convert up to 1 Clay to 2 Food.

cards.name: Potter Ceramics
cards.text: Each time before you take a "Bake Bread" action, you can exchange 1 clay for 1 grain.

cards.name: Potter's Wheel
cards.text: Whenever you convert 1 Clay into Food using the Pottery or Potter, you receive 1 additional Food. The Pottery is now a Minor Improvement for you.

cards.name: Potter's Yard
cards.text: Immediately place 1 clay on each unused space in your farmyard. Each time you turn a space into a used space, you get the clay and you can immediately exchange it for 2 food.

cards.name: Potters Market
cards.text: At any time, you can pay 4 clay and 2 food. If you do, place 1 vegetable on each of the next 2 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the vegetable.

cards.name: Pottery
cards.text: Harvest: At most 1 time Clay â†’ 2 Food Scoring: 3/5/7 Clay â†’ 1/2/3 bonus points

cards.name: Pottery
cards.text: In each Harvest, you can use the Pottery to convert at most 1 Clay to 2 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 3/5/7 Clay.

cards.name: Pottery Yard
cards.text: During the scoring, if there are at least 2 orthogonally adjacent unused spaces in your farm, you get 2 bonus points. (You still get the negative points for those unused spaces.

cards.name: Powerhouse
cards.text: Whenever you have at least 3/5 Stone in your supply at the start of the Work phase, you receive 1/2 Food.

cards.name: Prefect
cards.text: You receive 1 Food for each Occupation and for each Improvement used by any player to convert building resources to Food during Harvest.

cards.name: Priest
cards.text: When you play this card, if you have a Clay hut with exactly 2 rooms, you receive 4 Clay, 3 Reed and 2 Stone.

cards.name: Priest
cards.text: When you play this card, if you live in a clay house with exactly 2 rooms, you immediately get 3 clay, 2 reed, and 2 stone.

cards.name: Private Forest
cards.text: Place 1 wood on each remaining even-numbered round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.

cards.name: Private Forest
cards.text: Place 1 Wood on each remaining even-numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Wood.

cards.name: Private Market
cards.text: Once per round, you may exchange 2 Food for a building resource of your choice.

cards.name: Private School
cards.text: This card is an additional Action Space for all players. Any player who uses the Private School must pay you 1 Food to play an Occupation. All players must still pay any additional costs for their occupation (Chief, Lover, etc.).

cards.name: Private Teacher
cards.text: Each time you use the "Grain Seeds" action space when any "Lessons" action space is occupied, you can also play an occupation for an occupation cost of 1 food.

cards.name: Prize-winning Sheep
cards.text: You immediately receive 1 Building resource of your choice.

cards.name: Professor
cards.text: After you play this card, discard all the remaining Occupations in your hand and draw 7 new Occupations. You can play an additional Occupation immediately for 2 Food. (You must pay any additional costs of the new Occupation).

cards.name: Prolific Writer
cards.text: You receive 2 Food before you pay the costs of playing this Occupation. In the Returning home phase of each Round, you must choose 1 player among those who built or played a new card that round. That player receives 1 Food from the general supply. (You may choose yourself if possible.)

cards.name: Prosecutor
cards.text: If you have fewer Improvements than 2/3/4 other players, you may pay 1/2/3 building resource less of your choice when you play an Improvement.

cards.name: Protest Singer
cards.text: (Your system has no limits.) You may keep 1 animal on each unused space on your farmyard. (The spaces still count as unused.) These animals do not participate in the Breeding phase of Harvest.

cards.name: Pub Owner
cards.text: Immediately, when you play this card, and at the end of each work phase, in which the "Forest", "Clay Pit", and "Reed Bank" accumulation spaces are all occupied, you get 1 grain.

cards.name: Publican
cards.text: Each time before another player takes an unconditional "Sow" action, you can give them 1 grain from your supply to get 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Pulley
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space you may immediately afterward build one room. (Pay costs for the room normally.)

cards.name: Pulverizer Plow
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use a clay accumulation space, you can pay 1 clay to plow 1 field. If you do, place that 1 clay on the accumulation space.

cards.name: Pumpkin Pie
cards.text: Whenever you Bake 1 or more Grain into bread, you may pay 1 additional Grain and 1 Vegetable for 3 Bonus points. When you play this card, you can also take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Pumpkin Seed Oil
cards.text: Three times during the game (at most once per round), you can place 1 Vegetable on this card and receive 3 Food in exchange. The Vegetable(s) on this card are counted in the scoring at the end of the game.

cards.name: Punner
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the Harrow or a Plow, you can immediately Plow 1 field as well. (If you use the Harrow or a Plow yourself, you do not get any advantage.)

cards.name: Puppeteer
cards.text: Whenever another player chooses the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you can pay 1 Food to play an Occupation.

cards.name: Pure Breeder
cards.text: You immediately get 1 wood. After each round that does not end with a harvest, you can breed exactly one type of animal. (This is not considered a breeding phase.)

cards.name: Putcher Maker
cards.text: At any time, you can exchange 1 reed for 2 food.

cards.name: Quarry
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action, you receive an additional 3 Stone.

cards.name: Quarryman
cards.text: You can use the Quarryman at any time to convert Stone to Food. For each Stone you convert, take 2 Food.

cards.name: Racing Stable Manager
cards.text: Whenever you build at least 1 stable, you may also pay 1 Food to immediately Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Raft
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Food or 1 Reed.

cards.name: Rainmaker
cards.text: Whenever you play an Improvement, you may immediately afterward add 1 additional good (of the sown type) on 1 sown field of your choice.

cards.name: Rake
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 2 Bonus points if you have at least 5 fields. If you have played the Harrow, Punner, Yoke or a Plow, you require at least 6 fields.

cards.name: Ram
cards.text: The Ram counts as a Sheep in your farm for scoring and breeding, but must be fed 1 Food in the Feeding phase of each Harvest or it is discarded. Your Sheep breed at the end of Rounds 6, 8, 10, and 12.

cards.name: Rammed Clay
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 clay. You can use clay instead of wood to build fences.

cards.name: Ranch
cards.text: For each Round that has not yet begun when you play this card, you receive 1 Bonus point and 2 Food. (Write the Bonus point(s) on the scoring pad.)

cards.name: Ranch Provost
cards.text: If there are still 3/6/9 complete rounds left to play, you immediately get 2/3/4 wood. During scoring, each player with a pasture of highest capacity gets 3 bonus points.

cards.name: Rancher
cards.text: Whenever, at the start of a round, you have fewer unused farmyards than any of the other players, you receive 1 Wood. (If there is a tie, you get nothing.)

cards.name: Raspberries
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on up to 3 Unused farmyard spaces from the general supply. When the space is used, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Ratcatcher
cards.text: In rounds 10 and 12, all other players may not place 1 of their family's Offspring* (if they have any).(You yourself may place all your Family members.)This card may only be played until the end of Round 9. (*) Offspring are a player's 3rd, 4th, and 5th Family members.

cards.name: Rationalist
cards.text: Whenever you play an Improvement and you would pay Stone as a building material, you may replace that Stone with the same amount of Clay if you pay an additional 1 Food.

cards.name: Ravenous Hunger
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use the "Vegetable Seeds" action space, you can place another person on an accumulation space and get 1 additional good of the accumulating type.

cards.name: Ravensberger Spinning Mill
cards.text: When you play this card, each other player may take 2 Food from the supply. For each player that takes 2 Food, you may pay 1 Building resource to the supply for 1 Bonus point. All paid resources must be different.

cards.name: Reader
cards.text: As soon as you have 6 occupations in front of you (including this one), this cards provides room for one person. In the draft variant, you need 7 occupations to play this.

cards.name: Reap Hook
cards.text: Place 1 grain on each of the next 3 of the round spaces 4, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 14. At the start of these rounds, you get the grain.

cards.name: Reclamation Plow
cards.text: After the next time you take animals from an accumulation space and accommodate all of them on your farm, you can plow 1 field.

cards.name: Recluse
cards.text: At the end of a Work phase, whenever one or more of your people are the only people on a column of the board, you receive 1 Food. You can only receive 1 Food from the Recluse each round. (For example, rounds 12 and 13 form a column.)

cards.name: Recreational Carpenter
cards.text: At the end of each work phase in which you did not use the "Meeting Place" action space, you can take a "Build Rooms" action without placing a person.

cards.name: Recruitment
cards.text: Provided you have room in your house, each time you get a "Minor Improvement" action, you can take a "Family Growth" action instead.

cards.name: Recycled Brick
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) renovates to stone, you get 1 clay for each newly renovated room.

cards.name: Recycled Brick
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) renovates to stone, you get 1 clay for each newly renovated room.

cards.name: Reed Beds
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 Field" Action space, you receive 1 Reed.

cards.name: Reed Belt
cards.text: Place 1 reed on each of the remaining space for rounds 5, 8, 10, and 12. At the start of these rounds, you get the reed.

cards.name: Reed Buyer
cards.text: Whenever Reed is taken for the first time in a round, you may give the player who takes it 1 Food in exchange for 1 of the Reed. The other player receives an additional 1 Food from the supply as compensation. (The other player cannot refuse this exchange.)(If you are the first person to take Reed in a round, you do not get any advantage from the Reed Buyer.)

cards.name: Reed Collector
cards.text: Place 1 Reed on each of the next 4 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Reed.

cards.name: Reed Exchange
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Reed.

cards.name: Reed Hut
cards.text: Place one Family member token that you have not yet brought into the game onto this card, where it will live for the rest of the game. It can be used to take actions (starting from the round when you play this card) and must be fed, but it is not worth any points while living in the Reed Hut. (You can move this person into your home later, using a "Family growth" action.)

cards.name: Reed Nursery
cards.text: You may Sow and harvest Reed in your fields as if it were Grain. At the end of the game, you may exchange 1/4/6/8 Reed from your supply or from your fields for 1/2/3/4 Bonus points.

cards.name: Reed Pond
cards.text: Place 1 reed on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the reed.

cards.name: Reed Roof Renovator
cards.text: Each time another player renovates, you immediately get 1 reed from the general supply. When you play this card in a 3-player game, you immediately get 1 reed.

cards.name: Reed Sale
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 3 Food.

cards.name: Reed Seller
cards.text: At any time, you can turn 1 reed into 3 food. Any other player can prevent this by buying the reed for 2 food from you. If multiple players are interested, choose one.

cards.name: Reed-Hatted Toad
cards.text: Add 5, 7, 9, 11, and 13 to the current round and place 1 reed on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the reed.

cards.name: Reeve
cards.text: Take 1/2/3/4 Wood if there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play. At the end of the game, all players with the most played Occupation cards receive 3 Bonus points each.

cards.name: Reformer
cards.text: You may keep any 1 animal on each of your played Occupation cards.

cards.name: Remodeler
cards.text: When you renovate your Wooden hut, you may first return 1 built stable to extend your hut by 1 Wooden room for free before paying the costs of the Renovation. (The stable can be rebuilt later)

cards.name: Remodeling
cards.text: You immediately get 1 clay for each clay room and for each major improvement you have.

cards.name: Remodeling
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately return a stable from your farmyard to your supply and extend your Wooden hut by 1 room. (The room does not cost anything, but you must pay the cost shown on this card.)

cards.name: Renovation Company
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 3 clay. Immediately after, you can renovate without paying any building resources.

cards.name: Renovation Preparer
cards.text: For each new wood/clay room you build, you get 2 clay/2 stone.

cards.name: Renovator
cards.text: Pay 2 less Clay to renovate to a Clay hut, and pay 2 less Stone to renovate to a Stone house.

cards.name: Resource Analyzer
cards.text: Before the start of each round, if you have more building resources than all other players of at least two types, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Resource Collector
cards.text: Place 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed, and 1 Stone on the next 4 Round spaces in any order you choose. At the start of those rounds, you receive the resource.

cards.name: Resource Lender
cards.text: Whenever you receive Building resources from an Action space, instead of placing them in your supply, you may add 1 resource of 1 type received and place them all on the next Round spaces with 1 per space (in any order and discard any excess). At the start of these rounds, you receive the resource.

cards.name: Resource Recycler
cards.text: Each time another player renovates to stone, if you live in a clay house, you can pay 2 food to build a clay room at no additional cost.

cards.name: Resource Seller
cards.text: Pile (from bottom to top) 1 Stone, Clay, Stone, Clay, Reed, Clay, Wood on this card. You receive the top marker when you receive that type of building resource.

cards.name: Retail Dealer
cards.text: Place 3 grain and 3 food on this card. Each time you use the "Resource Market" action space, you also get 1 grain and 1 food from this card.

cards.name: Retirement
