cards.text: Immediately turn all of your Occupations before you face down. At the start of each round, you receive 1 Food as long as you have no face up Occupations. All effects of the face down cards are forfeited but they still count as played Occupations.

cards.name: Retraining
cards.text: At the end of each turn in which you renovate, you can exchange your Joinery for the Pottery or your Pottery for the Basketmaker's Workshop.

cards.name: Returnee
cards.text: At the end of each Work phase, place 1 Grain from the general supply on the last Action space you used. In the next round, if you use that Action space, you receive the Grain first. If you do not, discard the Grain.

cards.name: Riding Plow
cards.text: Twice during the game, when you use either the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action, you can Plow 3 fields instead of 1.

cards.name: Ringmaster
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you may either play a Minor Improvement or you may pay 1 Grain to build a Major Improvement immediately afterward. (Pay costs for the Improvement normally.)

cards.name: Riparian Builder
cards.text: Each time another player uses the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can build a room: if you build a clay/stone room, you get a discount of 1 clay/2 stone.

cards.name: River Port
cards.text: At the start of the Work phase of each round, check which Action space holds the maximum number of a single good. You may buy one good of that type from the general supply for 1 Food. In case of a tie, you can choose between those types of goods.

cards.name: Riverbank Gardener
cards.text: Each time you use the "Riverbank Forest" accumulation space, you also get 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Riverine Shepherd
cards.text: Each time you use the "Sheep Market" or "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can also take 1 good from the respective other accumulation space, if possible.

cards.name: Robber
cards.text: Once during each Round, when it is your turn, you may skip placing a Family Member. Instead, choose to take 1 Food or 1 Wood from the Supply. You can only skip your turn if at least 1 other player has 1 or more Person tokens to place.

cards.name: Rock Pyramid
cards.text: Whenever you build a Stone room, you can Plow up to 1 field. If you paid at least 1 Stone for that room, you may Plow up to 2 fields instead.

cards.name: Rocky Terrain
cards.text: Each time you plow a field (tile or card), you can also buy 1 stone for 1 food.

cards.name: Roll-Over Plow
cards.text: At any time, if you have at least 3 planted fields, you can discard all goods from one of those fields to plow 1 field.

cards.name: Rolling Pin
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, if you have more clay than wood in your supply, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Roof Ballaster
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately pay 1 food to get 1 stone for each room you have.

cards.name: Roof Examiner
cards.text: When you play this card, if you have 1/2/3/4 major improvements, you immediately get 2/3/4/5 reed.

cards.name: Roof Ladder
cards.text: Each time you renovate, you pay 1 fewer reed and, at the end of the action, you get 1 stone.

cards.name: Ropemaker
cards.text: At the end of each harvest, you get 1 reed from the general supply.

cards.name: Rotherham Plow
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 Field" Action space, you may Plow 2 fields if they are not diagonally or orthogonally adjacent to each other instead of 1.

cards.name: Rough Baker
cards.text: Whenever you Bake bread, you may use the Clay Oven like the Stone Oven and vice verse. When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain and you can immediately take a "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Roughcaster
cards.text: Each time you build at least 1 clay room or renovate your house from clay to stone, you also get 3 food.

cards.name: Row Boat
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Fishing" Action space, you may move 1 of your already placed people to "Fishing" too and receive 1 Food from the general supply. (Thus, you free an Action space. You do not take the "Fishing" action.)

cards.name: Royal Wood
cards.text: At the end of each turn in which you use the "Farm Expansion" action space or build an improvement, you get 1 wood back for every 2 wood paid during those actions (rounded down).

cards.name: Rubenesque Woman
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you must pay 1 additional Food. Whenever you use an Accumulation space with your second person in a round, you receive 1 additional good of the accumulating type.

cards.name: Ruins
cards.text: Place 4 Stone on this card from the general supply. In the Field phase of each Harvest, you may move 1 Stone from this card to your supply.

cards.name: Rustic
cards.text: For each clay room you build, you get 2 food and 1 bonus point. (this does not apply to stone rooms and renovated wood rooms.)

cards.name: Sack Cart
cards.text: Place 1 grain each on the remaining spaces for rounds 5, 8, 11, and 14. At the start of these rounds, you get the grain.

cards.name: Sailboat Constructor
cards.text: Place 4 stacks of resources on this card: 3 Wood, 3 Clay, 2 Stone, and 1 Grain with 1 Vegetable. In the Field phase of each Harvest you can buy (some or all of) these stacks. Pay 2/3/4/5 Food for the 1st/ 2nd/ 3rd/ 4th stack you buy.

cards.name: Saint Nicholas
cards.text: Count how many Family members have been born during the game so far, and immediately take that many Food (maximum 6). (New Offspring, who are still on the "Family growth" space already count as Family members.) All players with the fewest Offspring (which could include you) immediately receive 1 Vegetable each.

cards.name: Salter
cards.text: At any time, you can pay 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle from you farm. If you do, place 1 food on each of the next 3/5/7 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Salvation Army Officer
cards.text: Whenever, at the start of a round before phase 1, another player has no Food markers, you may give them 1 Food from your personal supply. If you do this, you receive your choice of 1 Grain, 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed, or 1 Sheep from the general supply.

cards.name: Sample Stable Maker
cards.text: At the start of each returning home phase, you can return a built stable to your supply to get 1 wood, 1 grain, 1 food, and a "Minor Improvement" action.

cards.name: Sausage Grinder
cards.text: Whenever you convert animals into Food, you receive 1 additional Food for each animal.

cards.name: Sawhorse
cards.text: The next stable you place in your farmyard, as well as your 3rd, 6th, 9th, 12th, and 15th fence, costs you nothing. (You can only place fences if they enclose a complete pasture.)

cards.name: Sawmill
cards.text: Each Harvest, you may convert up to 1 Wood to 3 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/4/5 Wood. (A repurchased Joinery does not give any additional Bonus points, but can be used to convert an additional 1 Wood each Harvest.)

cards.name: Saxophone
cards.text: Your remaining Family members leave the house and flee to different unused Action spaces on a single game board that is not occupied by your first person. Take those actions immediately in any order.

cards.name: Scales
cards.text: Each time after you place an improvement or occupation in front of you, if you then have the same number of improvements and occupations in play, you get 2 food.

cards.name: Scarecrow
cards.text: Whenever you Sow, you can pay 1 Wood and Sow 2 Grain instead of 1 on an empty field.

cards.name: Scenery Painter
cards.text: As long as the middle 3 spaces on your farmyard are all unused, you receive 1 Food from the general supply at the start of each odd-numbered Round. (The middle spaces are those surrounded by exactly 8 other spaces.)

cards.name: Schlachter Church
cards.text: Whenever another player converts an animal to Food with a Cooking Improvement, place it on this card. At any time, you may convert all the animals on this card to 1 Food each. Afterward, this card loses its function but still counts as an Improvement.

cards.name: Schnapps Distillery
cards.text: In each feeding phase, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 vegetable into 5 food. During scoring, you get 1 bonus point each for your 5th and 6th vegetable.

cards.name: Schnaps Distiller
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you can convert up to 1 Vegetable to 5 Food.

cards.name: Schnaps Distillery
cards.text: During the Feeding phase of the Harvest, you can use the Schnaps Distillery to convert at most 1 Vegetable into 4 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point each for your 5th and 6th Vegetables.

cards.name: Schnitzel Mallet
cards.text: For each Cattle that you turn to Food using a Cooking Improvement, you receive 1 additional Food and 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: Scholar
cards.text: Once you have a Stone house, at the start of a round, you can always either pay 1 Food to play an Occupation card or play an Improvement card by paying its costs.

cards.name: School Dropout
cards.text: In each Work phase in which you used a "Family growth" action and afterward you didn't use a Round 1-14 Action space, you may take an action with the new offspring and it no longer counts as "newborn".

cards.name: Schoolhouse
cards.text: At any time, instead of playing 1 Minor or Major Improvement, you may play 1 Occupation. The price of this Occupation is 1 Food.

cards.name: Schoolmaster
cards.text: Whenever another player uses a "Family growth" action, they must first pay you 1/2 Food if they have 2-5/6+ Food markers in their personal supply.

cards.name: Scribbler
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "Day Laborer" action, you both receive 1 additional Food. In each round that "Day Laborer" is not used, add 1 Food from the general supply to this card. Whenever you play an Occupation, you may pay any costs using Food from this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3/4 Bonus points for 4/6/8/10+ Food on this card.

cards.name: Scullery
cards.text: At the start of each round, if you live in a wooden house, you get 1 food.

cards.name: Sculptor
cards.text: Whenever you take only Clay and/or Stone from an accumulating Action space, you receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Sculptor
cards.text: Each time you use a clay accumulation space, you also get 1 food. Each time you use a stone accumulation space, you also get 1 grain.

cards.name: Sculptors Son
cards.text: If you have the Joinery/ Pottery/ Basketmaker's Workshop or their upgrades, you receive an additional 2 Wood/ 2 Clay/ 1 Reed whenever you use a Family member's action to take only Wood/ Clay/ Reed.

cards.name: Sculpture
cards.text: You can only play this card if there are more complete rounds left to play than you have unused farmyard spaces.

cards.name: Sculpture Course
cards.text: At the end of each round that does not end with a harvest, you can use this card to exchange your choice of 1 wood for 2 food, or 1 stone for 4 food.

cards.name: Scythe
cards.text: You may Sow fields even if they already contain resources. Place the new resources on top of the existing ones. You cannot Sow different resources on a single field.

cards.name: Scythe Worker
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain. In the field phase of each harvest, you can harvest 1 additional grain from each of your grain fields.

cards.name: Seasonal Plants
cards.text: Whenever you Sow during an even-numbered round, add 1 additional resource of the appropriate type to 1 field you just sowed.

cards.name: Seasonal Worker
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you receive 1 additional Grain. From Round 6, you can choose to receive 1 Vegetable instead.

cards.name: Seatmate
cards.text: You can use the action space on round space 13 even if it is occupied by one or more people of the players to your immediate left and right.

cards.name: Seaweed Fertilizer
cards.text: Each time after you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 grain from the general supply. From round 11 on, you can get 1 vegetable instead.

cards.name: Second Spouse
cards.text: You can use the "Urgent Wish for Children" action space (from round 12-13) even if it is occupied by the first person another player placed.

cards.name: Seducer
cards.text: When you play this card in round 5 or later, you can immediately pay 1 stone, 1 grain, 1 vegetable, and 1 sheep to take a "Family Growth Even without Room" action.

cards.name: Seed Master
cards.text: At any time, you may pay 1 Food to convert 1 Grain in your supply to 1 Vegetable. At any time, you may convert 1 Vegetable in your supply to 1 Grain.

cards.name: Seed Pellets
cards.text: Each time before you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 grain.

cards.name: Seed Researcher
cards.text: Each time any people return from both the "Grain Seeds" and "Vegetable Seeds" action spaces, you get 2 food and you can play 1 occupation, without paying an occupation cost.

cards.name: Seed Scatterer
cards.text: Whenever you Harvest no more than 1 Grain during the Field phase of a Harvest, you may immediately sow that Grain. You may use this Occupation card as if it were a field. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

cards.name: Seed Seller
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" Action space, you receive 1 additional Grain. When you play this card, you receive 1 Grain.

cards.name: Seed Spreader
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, you may immediately afterward Sow 1 Grain or 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Seed Trader
cards.text: Place 2 grain and 2 vegetables on this card. You can buy them at any time. Each grain costs 2 food; each vegetable costs 3 food.

cards.name: Seed Trader
cards.text: Place 2 Grain and 2 Vegetables on this card. You may buy them at any time. Each Grain costs 2 Food, each Vegetable costs 3 Food.

cards.name: Seeress
cards.text: You immediately receive 1 Stone from the Supply and look at the top 3 cards in the Round card pile, then return them in your choice of order. (You need not match these cards to the Phase of the game.) In addition, at any time during the game, you can look at the top Round card.

cards.name: Senior Teacher
cards.text: Each time another player pays food on a "Lessons" action space, you get exactly 1 of that food.

cards.name: Sequestrator
cards.text: Place 3 reed and 4 clay on this card. The next player to have 3 pastures/5 field tiles get the 3 reed/4 clay (not retroactively).

cards.name: Serf
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Sow and/or Bake bread" action, you receive 1 Grain before taking the action. Alternatively, you can exchange 1 Grain for 1 Vegetable

cards.name: Shack
cards.text: Whenever you start a round in a Wooden Hut, you receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Shared Wall
cards.text: Your home now creates a natural border for pasture(s). You may not extend your home into pastures created in this way. (You may still build all 15 fences.)

cards.name: Shaving Horse
cards.text: Each time after you obtain at least 1 wood, if you then have 5 or more wood in your supply, you can exchange 1 wood for 3 food. With 7 or more wood, you must do so.

cards.name: Sheep Agent
cards.text: You can keep 1 sheep on each occupation card in front of you (including this one), unless it is already able to hold animals.

cards.name: Sheep Farmer
cards.text: Whenever you take Sheep with one of your people, you receive an additional Sheep from the supply. You can exchange 3 Sheep for 1 Cattle and 1 Wild boar at any time (except during the breeding phase.)

cards.name: Sheep Herder
cards.text: When you play this card, you may immediately build 1 stable without paying Wood. You can keep up to 2 Sheep on exactly 1 Unused space in your farmyard. (The space still counts as unused.)

cards.name: Sheep Inspector
cards.text: Once per work phase, after you complete a person action, you can pay 1 sheep and 2 food to return another person you placed home.

cards.name: Sheep Keeper
cards.text: You can only play this card if you have less than 7 sheep. Once this game, when you have 7 sheep on your farm, you immediately get 3 bonus points and 2 food.

cards.name: Sheep Market
cards.text: At the beginning of each Harvest, you may exchange 1 Grain or Vegetable for 1 Sheep. Alternatively, you may exchange 1 Sheep for 1 Grain or Vegetable.

cards.name: Sheep Provider
cards.text: Each time any player (including you) uses the "Sheep Market" accumulation space, you get 1 grain.

cards.name: Sheep Walker
cards.text: At any time, you can exchange 1 sheep for either 1 wild boar, 1 vegetable, or 1 stone.

cards.name: Sheep Well
cards.text: Place 1 food on each of the next round spaces, up to the number of sheep you have. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Sheep Whisperer
cards.text: Add 4,7,9 and 11 to the current round and place 1 Sheep on each corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Sheep.

cards.name: Sheepdog
cards.text: You may keep up to 2 Sheep on each Unused space in your farmyard. (The spaces still count as unused.) You may not keep any animal other than Sheep in your home. The Sheepdog must be fed 1 Food each Harvest. (You must beg if you don't have enough Food).

cards.name: Sheepskin Rug
cards.text: At the end of the game, if you own a Fireplace, you receive 2 Bonus points.

cards.name: Shelter
cards.text: You can immediately build a stable at no cost, but only if you place it in a pasture covering exactly 1 farmyard space.

cards.name: Shelter in the Field
cards.text: This card can hold 1 Family member who can only use the "Take 1 Grain", "Take 1 Vegetable", "Plow 1 field" or "Sow and/or Bake" Action spaces. This Family member cannot be moved to your home.

cards.name: Shepherd
cards.text: During each Harvest, if you have at least 4 Sheep during the Breeding phase, you receive 2 lambs instead of 1 as long as you have room for them.

cards.name: Shepherd Boy
cards.text: Once you live in a Stone house, place 1 Sheep on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Sheep. (If you already live in a Stone house, place the Sheep immediately.)

cards.name: Shepherd with Flock
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space for you only. When you use this Action space, you double the number of Sheep on your farmyard. You receive at most as many new Sheep as you have Unused farmyard spaces.

cards.name: Shepherd's Crook
cards.text: Each time you fence a new pasture covering at least 4 farmyard spaces, you immediately get 2 sheep on this pasture.

cards.name: Shepherd's Pipe
cards.text: You can hold up to 2 additional Sheep in each of the pastures where you keep Sheep. You can keep up to 2 Sheep in each unfenced stable.

cards.name: Shifting Cultivation
cards.text: Immediately plow 1 field.

cards.name: Shifting Cultivator
cards.text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space, you can also play 3 food to plow 1 field.

cards.name: Shoreforester
cards.text: When you play this card and each time 1 reed is placed on an empty "Reed Bank" accumulation space in the preparation phase, you get 1 wood.

cards.name: Shovel
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you may immediately afterward take the "Sow" action.

cards.name: Shovel Bearer
cards.text: Each time you use the "Clay Pit" or "Hollow" accumulation space, you also get a number of food equal to the amount of clay on the respective other accumulation space.

cards.name: Shovel Worker
cards.text: In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 1/2/3/4 Food if you have 2/3/4/5 pastures.

cards.name: Sickle
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 3 Bonus points if you have at least 5 plowed fields, 8 Grain and 4 Vegetables. (Planted Grain and Vegetables count).

cards.name: Sidekick
cards.text: Immediately after each time you place a person on an action space card, you can pay 1 food to place another person on the card immediately left to it (and so on).

cards.name: Silage
cards.text: In each returning home phase after which there is no harvest, you can pay exactly 1 grainâ€”even from a field-to breed exactly one type of animal.

cards.name: Silo Girl
cards.text: Once you live in a Stone house, place 1 Grain on each remaining even Round space and 1 Vegetable on each remaining odd Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the resources. (If you already live in a Stone house, place the resources immediately.)

cards.name: Silokeeper
cards.text: Each time you use the action space card that has been revealed right before the most recent harvest, you also get 1 grain.

cards.name: Simple Fireplace
cards.text: At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 2 Food Sheep: 1 Food Wild Boar: 2 Food Cattle: 3 Food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 2 Food.

cards.name: Singer
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 (same or different) building resources of your choice.

cards.name: Single-Sided Plow
cards.text: Once during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" action, you may Plow 2 fields instead of 1. Additionally, you can Sow these new fields (1 or 2), but only with Vegetables. (This does not apply to the "Plow and/or Sow" action.)

cards.name: Site Manager
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately build a major improvement. When paying its cost, you can replace up to 1 building resource of each type with 1 food each.

cards.name: Ski Instructor
cards.text: Whenever another player has Family Growth, he must pay you 1 Food (or beg for the Food, if necessary). You must immediately turn the Ski Instructor face-down when you grow your Family. You no longer receive its benefits, but it still counts as a played Occupation.

cards.name: Skillful Renovator
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood and 1 clay. Each time after you renovate, you get a number of wood equal to the number of people you placed that round.

cards.name: Skybridge
cards.text: Immediately place Stone from your supply between any adjacent rooms of your home. Between each 2 rooms you may place exactly 1 Stone. In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you receive 1 Grain for each placed Stone. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each placed Stone.

cards.name: Slapdash Renovation
cards.text: At the end of any turn where you placed a person on a "Renovation" Action space, you may return that person to your farm. (That person takes another action later in the round.)

cards.name: Slaughterhouse
cards.text: Whenever another player turns 1 or more animals into Food, you receive 1 Food from the supply. During the Feeding phase of the Harvest, you are the last player to take a turn (so you can benefit if others players slaughter.)(If you slaughter, you receive no advantage.)

cards.name: Slaughterman
cards.text: Whenever another player converts animals to Food, you receive 1 Food from the supply. In the Feeding phase, you are the last player to feed your family (so you can benefit if other players slaughter.)(If you slaughter, you receive no additional Food.)

cards.name: Sleeping Corner
cards.text: You can use any "Family growth" Action space, even if another player has already placed a person there.

cards.name: Slurry Spreader
cards.text: In the breeding phase of each harvest, if you get newborn animals of at least two types, you also get a "Sow" action.

cards.name: Slurry Spreader
cards.text: In the field phase of each harvest, each time you take the last grain/vegetable from a field, you also get 2 food/1 food.

cards.name: Small Animal Breeder
cards.text: Before the start of each round, if you have food equal to or higher than the current round number (e.g., 8+ food in round 8), you get 1 food.

cards.name: Small Basket
cards.text: Each time you use the "Reed Bank" accumulation space, you can pay 1 reed to get 1 vegetable. If you do in a game with 4+ players, place that 1 reed on the accumulation space.

cards.name: Small Greenhouse
cards.text: Add 4 and 7 to the current round and place 1 vegetable on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you can buy the vegetable for 1 food.

cards.name: Small Potter's Oven
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 5 food. Each time before you get a "Bake Bread" action, you can build the "Clay Oven" or "stone Oven" major improvement.

cards.name: Small Trader
cards.text: Each time you take a "Major or Minor Improvement" action to play an improvement from your hand, you also get 3 food.

cards.name: Small-scale Farmer
cards.text: As long as your home has exactly 2 rooms, you receive 1 Wood at the start of each Round (even before Phase 1).

cards.name: Small-scale Farmer
cards.text: As long as you live in a house with exactly 2 rooms, at the start of each round, you get 1 wood.

cards.name: Smallholder
cards.text: Your pastures that can hold up to 2 animals can hold 3 animals. Also, while you have at most 2 Fields, add 1 extra Grain or Vegetable when you Sow.

cards.name: Smoking Mantlepiece
cards.text: When you play this card, you get 1 Bonus point per complete Round left to be played. You cannot use any more Renovation actions.

cards.name: Snitch
cards.text: Immediately flip 1 Occupation that you have played face down. In exchange, you can choose to take either 5 Food or 1 Cattle from the Supply. You lose all effects of the face down occupation. (For future Occupations and Improvements, this Occupation continues to count as "played".)

cards.name: Social Benefits
cards.text: Immediately after the feeding phase of each harvest, if you have no food left, you get 1 wood and 1 clay.

cards.name: Social Climber
cards.text: Whenever you are the first player to renovate to a Clay hut or a Stone house, you receive 3 Stone. If you are the second, you receive 2 Stone, the third, you receive 1 Stone. (This is not given for renovations performed before you played this card.)

cards.name: Soda Producer
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space or the adjacent "1 Reed" Action with a person, place 1 Stone from the general supply on this card. You may only use the Stone on this card to build a Well. (Wells are improvements that have their name end with the word "well".)

cards.name: Sofa
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 4/2 Bonus points if your home has at most 2/3 rooms.

cards.name: Soil Scientist
cards.text: Each time after you use a clay/stone accumulation space, you can place 1 stone/2 clay from your supply on the space to get 2 grain/1 vegetable, respectively.

cards.name: Soldier
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each stone-wood pair in your supply. You cannot score additional points for the resources scored with this card.

cards.name: Songwriter
cards.text: Place 3 Food and 1 Grain on this card. The first time another player takes the "Traveling Players" action, you receive 1 Food. You receive 1 Grain the second time and 2 Food the third time. When this card is empty and another player takes the action, you receive 1 Vegetable from the general supply.

cards.name: Sower
cards.text: Each time you build a major improvement, place 1 reed from the general supply on that card. At any time, you can move the reed to your supply or exchange it for a "Sow" action.

cards.name: Sower
cards.text: You may immediately Sow each Vegetable that you receive outside the Harvest phase and would otherwise place in your Supply.

cards.name: Sowing Director
cards.text: Each time after another player uses the "Grain Utilization" action space, you get a "Sow" action.

cards.name: Sowing Master
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 wood. Each time after you use an action space with the "Sow" action, you get 2 food.

cards.name: Sparrenburg Castle
cards.text: Whenever anyone uses a Wood/Stone Accumulation space, place 1 Wood/Stone from the general supply on this card. Whenever you place a person on a "Renovation" Action space, take up to 5 resources from this card. (Before scoring, discard all the resources from this card.)

cards.name: Spars
cards.text: Whenever you build a Room or Renovate your home, you may receive 1 Negative point instead of paying the required 1 or 2 Reed. In a 2 or 3 player game, you may only play this Minor Improvement on the "1 Major or Minor Improvement" Action space.

cards.name: Special Food
cards.text: The next time you take animals from an accumulation space and accommodate all of them on your farm, you get 1 bonus point for each of these animals.

cards.name: Speculoos Bakery
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action on an Action space, you may also exchange 1 Grain for 1 Guest token to place in the same round. (Return the Guest token after using.)

cards.name: Spices
cards.text: Whenever you convert Vegetables to Food using a Fireplace, Cooking Hearth or Cooking Corner, you receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Spielefest
cards.text: The Spielefest is an Action space for all players. Whenever a player visits the Spielefest, he pays the owner of this card 1 Food and receives 2 Bonus points. (You can visit the Spielefest yourself.)

cards.name: Spielwiese
cards.text: Reveal 2 Occupations randomly from the deck and add them to your hand. Look at the player size number on each card (either 1, 3, or 4). Take as many different Building resources as the smaller of the two numbers.

cards.name: Spin Doctor
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can place another person on an action space of your choice, regardless whether or not the action space is occupied.

cards.name: Spindle
cards.text: Whenever you have 3/5 Sheep during the Field phase of a Harvest, you receive 1/2 additional Food.

cards.name: Spinney
cards.text: Whenever another player uses the "3 Wood" Action space, s/he must give you one of the Wood. (This does not apply to the "4 Wood" Action space in the 5-player game.)

cards.name: Spit Roast
cards.text: Whenever you convert at least 1 animal to Food during the Feeding phase of the Harvest, you receive 1 additional Food.

cards.name: Spittoon
cards.text: Steal 2 Food markers from your left or right neighbor (your choice) and give them this card which they add to their hand. (*Rounds without Harvest are 1,2,3,5,6,8,10, and 12)

cards.name: Stable
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately build 1 stable. (The stable does not cost anything, but you must pay the cost shown to play this card.)

cards.name: Stable Architect
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each unfenced stable in your farmyard.

cards.name: Stable Architect
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1 bonus point for each unfenced stable in your farmyard.

cards.name: Stable Cleaner
cards.text: At any time, you can take the "Build Stables" action without placing a person. If you do, each stable costs you 1 wood and 1 food.

cards.name: Stable Deliveryman
cards.text: Add 3, 5, 7 and 9 to the current round and place up to 1 of your stables on each remaining corresponding Round space. At the start of these rounds you may pay 1 Wood to build that stable immediately. (If you don't, return that stable to your supply. Until then you cannot build that stable.)

cards.name: Stable Manure
cards.text: In the field phase of each harvest, you can harvest 1 additional good from a number of fields equal to the number of unfenced stables you have.

cards.name: Stable Master
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately build exactly 1 stable for 1 wood. Exactly one of your unfenced stables can hold up to 3 animals of one type.

cards.name: Stable Master
cards.text: When you play this card, you can immediately build exactly 1 stable for 1 wood. Exactly one of your unfenced stables can hold up to 3 animals of one type.

cards.name: Stable Milker
cards.text: Each time you build at least 2 stables on the same turn, you also get 1 cattle.

cards.name: Stable Planner
cards.text: Add 3, 6, and 9 to the current round. You can place 1 stable on each corresponding round space. A the start of these rounds (not earlier), you can build the stable at no cost.

cards.name: Stable Sergeant
cards.text: When you play this card, you can pay 2 food to get 1 sheep, 1 wild boar, and 1 cattle, but only if you can accommodate all three animals on your farm.

cards.name: Stable Tree
cards.text: Each time you build 1 or more stables on your turn, place 1 wood on each of the next 3 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.

cards.name: Stable Yard
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 food for each completed round left to play. At any time, you can exchange 1 sheep plus 1 wild boar for 1 cattle.

cards.name: Stablehand
cards.text: Whenever you build at least 1 fence, you also receive 1 stable which you must build immediately. (This may be built inside or outside the fenced area.)(You do not need to pay any Wood for the stable.)

cards.name: Stablemaster
cards.text: One (and only one) of your unfenced stables may hold up to 3 animals of the same type.

cards.name: Stage
cards.text: Whenever you have a person on all 3 gameboards at the end of a Work phase, you receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Stage Star
cards.text: If you play this card in Stage 1, you immediately receive 6 wood. Whenever another player uses the "Traveling Player" action, you must pay him 1 Wood if you have any in your supply.

cards.name: Stagehand
cards.text: Each time another player uses the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you can take your choice of a "Build Fences", "Build Stables", or "Build Rooms" action.

cards.name: Stall Holder
cards.text: Once per round, if you have 0/1/2/3/4 unfenced stables on your farm, you can exchange 2 grain for 1 bonus point and 1/2/3/4/5 food.

cards.name: Star Classification Meal
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each remaining Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Steam Engine
cards.text: Whenever you use an accumulation space with the last person you place each Work phase, you can also take a "Bake bread" Action afterwards. (Accumulation spaces are those Action spaces on which goods or Food accumulate.)

cards.name: Steam Machine
cards.text: Each work phase, if the last action space you use is an accumulation space, you can immediately afterward take a "Bake Bread" action.

cards.name: Steam Plow
cards.text: Immediately after each returning home phase, you can pay 2 wood and 1 food to use the "Farmland" action space without placing a person.

cards.name: Steamer
cards.text: At any time, you can convert pairs of goods to Food as follows: 1 Grain + 1 Vegetable to 5 Food 1 Grain + 1 Sheep to 4 Food 1 Grain + 1 Wild boar to 5 Food 1 Grain + 1 Cattle to 6 Food

cards.name: Steel Plow
cards.text: Once during the game, when you use either the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" Action space, you can Plow up to 4 fields instead of 1.

cards.name: Stew
cards.text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, also place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Stock Protector
cards.text: Each time before you use the "Fencing" action space, you get 2 wood. Immediately after that "Fencing" action, you can place another person.

cards.name: Stockman
cards.text: You receive 1 Cattle when you build your second stable, 1 Wild boar when you build your third and 1 Sheep when you build your fourth. (If you build several stables at once, you my be entitled to take several animals as well.)

cards.name: Stockpile
cards.text: At the beginning of each round (before Phase 1), if you have exactly 0-1/2-3/4-5/6+ Food in your personal supply, you receive 1 Wood/Clay/Reed/Stone. (You may give Food to the general supply at any time.)

cards.name: Stockyard
cards.text: This card can hold up to 3 animals of the same type. (It is not considered a pasture).

cards.name: Stone Bank
cards.text: Whenever you take Stone from a Stone Accumulation space, you may take 1 Stone only and leave any remaining Stone. Place the 1 Stone on this card. The Stone cost of all Improvements is reduced by the number of Stone on this card for you.

cards.name: Stone Breaker
cards.text: At any time, you can Renovate your Clay hut to a Stone house without using the "Renovation" Action space. (You must still pay the costs of the renovation.)

cards.name: Stone Buyer
cards.text: Whenever Stone is taken for the first time in a round, you may give the player who takes it 1 Food in exchange for 1 of the Stone. The other player receives an additional 1 Food from the supply. (The other player cannot refuse this exchange.)(If you are the first player to take Stone in a round, you do not get any advantage from the Stone Buyer.)

cards.name: Stone Carrier
cards.text: Whenever you take Stone with an action, you can also take 1 additional Stone. If you also receive other building resources, this costs you 1 Food.

cards.name: Stone Cart
cards.text: Place 1 Stone on each remaining even-numbered Round space. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Stone.

cards.name: Stone Carver
cards.text: In each Harvest, the Stone Carver can convert up to 1 Stone to 3 Food.

cards.name: Stone Clawer
cards.text: Each time you plow at least 1 field, you also get 1 stone.

cards.name: Stone Clearing
cards.text: Immediately place 1 stone on each of your empty fields. Harvest them during the next field phase. These fields are considered planted until then.

cards.name: Stone Company
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use a "Quarry" accumulation space, you get a "Major or Minor Improvement" action during which you must spend at least 1 stone.

cards.name: Stone Crane
cards.text: Whenever another player builds a room or renovates, you may immediately perform this action yourself (without placing a Family member). Pay the costs using 1 less building resource of your choice.

cards.name: Stone Curator
cards.text: Whenever you use a Stone Accumulation space, you receive 1 additional Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for every 2 rooms in your Stone house and every 2 Improvements with a printed Stone cost.

cards.name: Stone Custodian
cards.text: At the end of each work phase, if 1 stone accumulation space has stone left, you get 1 grain If 2 stone accumulation spaces have stone left, you get 1 vegetable instead.

cards.name: Stone Deliveryman
cards.text: Place 1 Stone on each of the spaces for Rounds 8, 10, 12, and 14. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Stone.

cards.name: Stone Exchange
cards.text: When you play this card, take 2 Stone.

cards.name: Stone House Extension
cards.text: When you play this card, immediately extend your Stone house by 1 room. (The room does not cost anything, but you must pay the cost shown to play this card.)

cards.name: Stone House Reconstruction
cards.text: You can Renovate your Clay hut to a Stone house at any time without using the "Renovate" action. (You must still pay for the Renovation.)

cards.name: Stone Importer
cards.text: In the breeding phase of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th harvest, you can use this card to buy exactly 2 stone for 2/2/3/3/4/1 food.

cards.name: Stone Kitchen
cards.text: At any time, you may convert goods to Food as follows: Vegetables: 4 food Sheep: 2 food Boar: 3 food Cattle: 4 food Whenever you use the "Bake bread" action, you may convert: Grain: 3 food each.

cards.name: Stone Oven
cards.text: "Bake Bread" action: Up to 2 times Grain â†’ 4 Food When you build this improvement, you can immediately take a "Bake Bread" action.

cards.name: Stone Tongs
cards.text: Each time you use a stone accumulation space, you get 1 additional stone.

cards.name: Stone Trader
cards.text: Whenever you use an action to take Stone, you may immediately afterward pay 1 Food to play an Improvement that has a printed Stone cost. (Pay costs for the Improvement normally.)

cards.name: Stonecutter
cards.text: All Improvements, Rooms and Renovations cost 1 Stone less.

cards.name: Stonecutter's Hall
cards.text: In each Harvest, you can use the Stonecutter's Hall to convert at most 1 Stone to 3 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/4/5 Stone.

cards.name: Stonepiler
cards.text: Whenever you build fences or stables, you may pay some or all of the cost in Stone with each Stone worth 2 Wood.

cards.name: Storage Barn
cards.text: If you have the Well, Joinery, Pottery, and/or Basketmaker's Workshop, you immediately get 1 stone, 1 wood, 1 clay, and/or 1 reed, respectively.

cards.name: Storage Shed
cards.text: Remove 1 built stable and place it on this card (you may not build it again later). Whenever you play a Minor Improvement, take 1 Building resource of your choice from the general supply before paying the costs of the Improvement.

cards.name: Store of Experience
cards.text: If you have 0-4/5/6/7 occupations left in hand, you immediately get 1 stone/reed/clay/wood.

cards.name: Storehouse Clerk
cards.text: Whenever you have at least 5 Stone at the start of a round, you receive 1 extra Stone. If you have at least 6 Reed, you receive 1 Reed. If you have at least 7 Clay, you receive 1 Clay. If you have at least 8 Wood, you receive 1 Wood.

cards.name: Storehouse Keeper
cards.text: Whenever you use a Family member's action to take Reed and Stone, you also receive your choice of 1 Clay or 1 Grain.

cards.name: Storehouse Minder
cards.text: When you play this card, you may place 1 to 4 building resources of different types on it from your supply. At the start of each Harvest, choose up to 2 resource types currently on this card and add 1 of each from the general supply. Each round, you may take all the resources of any 1 type remaining.

cards.name: Storehouse Steward
cards.text: Each time you take exactly 2/3/4/5 food from a food accumulation space, you also get 1 stone/reed/clay/wood. (If you take 6 or more food, you do not get a bonus good).

cards.name: Storeroom
cards.text: During scoring, you get 1/2 bonus point for each pair of grain plus vegetable you have (considering all crops in your supply and fields), rounded up.

cards.name: Stork's Nest
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, if you have more rooms than people, you can pay 1 food to take a "Family Growth" action.

cards.name: Storyteller
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space, you can leave 1 Food on the space and take 1 Vegetable instead.

cards.name: Straw Manure
cards.text: Before the field phase of each harvest, you can pay 1 grain from your supply to add 1 vegetable to each of up to 2 vegetable fields.

cards.name: Straw-Thatched Hut
cards.text: Whenever you add a room to your Clay hut, you can pay 2 Clay, 1 Grain and 1 Food instead of 5 Clay and 2 Reed.

cards.name: Straw-thatched Roof
cards.text: You no longer need Reed when you extend or renovate your home.

cards.name: Strawberry Patch
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each of the next 3 Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Street Chansonnier
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Traveling Players" Action with a person, you may immediately afterwards place a second person on the Action space to receive 2 Grain and 1 Vegetable. (The second person is not using the "Traveling Players" Action.)

cards.name: Street Musician
cards.text: You receive 1 Grain whenever another player takes the "Traveling Players" action on an Action space.

cards.name: Stroller
cards.text: Pile 6 building resources of your choice, but including at least 1 of each type, on this card in any order. During the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive the top item.

cards.name: Stuck Cart
cards.text: Immediately place and use all the Family members that are in your home. (Afterward, play continues as normal. This card can only be played during the Work phase.)

cards.name: Studio
cards.text: In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, you can use the Studio to convert either 1 Wood, Clay, or Stone into Food. You receive 2 Food for Wood or Clay and 3 Food for Stone.

cards.name: Studio
cards.text: In the feeding phase of each harvest, you can use this card to turn exactly 1 wood/clay/stone into 2/2/3 food.

cards.name: Studio Boat
cards.text: Each time you use the "Traveling Players" accumulation space, you also get 1 bonus point. In games with 1-3 players, this card is considered "Traveling Players" (same effect as "Fishing").

cards.name: Stump-Jump Plow
cards.text: Once you live in a Clay hut or Stone house, whenever you use a Family member's action to take Wood you can pay 1 Food to Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Styrian Oak
cards.text: Place 5 Food from the general Supply on the Styrian Oak. At the start of each Round, you can return 1 Food to the general Supply. Once during the game, at any time, you can pay the number of Food (0 to 5) remaining on the Styrian Oak to receive 6 Wood from the Supply.

cards.name: Substitute Teacher
cards.text: Each time all three "Lessons" action spaces are occupied, you can use this card with a person to get your choice of 1 building resource or 1 crop of each type.

cards.name: Suffragette
cards.text: Each Work phase on your first turn, you may pay 2 food to place both your first and second person immediately one after another. If you do this, you must place each person on a different game board. (Then, when it's your second turn, you place your third person.)

cards.name: Sugar Baker
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Grain Utilization" action space, you can buy 1 bonus point for 1 food. Place the food on the action space (for the next visitor).

cards.name: Summer House
cards.text: During scoring, if you live in a stone house, you get 2 bonus points for each unused farmyard space orthogonally adjacent to your house. (You still lose the points for these unused spaces.)

cards.name: Sunday School
cards.text: Place a marker on the next round. During that round, you place 1 fewer Family member. At the end of that round, remove the marker and play 2 Occupations for free.

cards.name: Sunday Worker
cards.text: Once during Rounds 7 and 14, you may pay 1 Food to take one of your peoples' actions twice. If you use an Accumulation space with that action, you get double the amount of Goods and/or Food.

cards.name: Sunrise Admirer
cards.text: At the start of each of the next 3 rounds, you may pay 2 Food to Plow 1 of the three Eastern-most spaces on your farmyard (the farm side opposite your home) if they are unused. (Normal plowing rules still apply.) If you choose not to, discard the Sunrise Admirer.

cards.name: Sunrise Herder
cards.text: Once each round, you may skip placing your first Family member and receive 1 animal. You must pay 1 Food if you receive a Cattle. (You place the person later. You may only do this if every player has at least 1 person still to place.)

cards.name: Supply Boat
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Fishing" accumulation space, you can choose to buy 1 grain for 1 food, or 1 vegetable for 3 food.

cards.name: Surrealist
cards.text: Reed and Food count as 1 build point each, Wood as 2, Clay as 3 and Stone as 4. Whenever you use a "Major Improvement" Action, you may build a Major Improvement from the bottom row (Clay oven to Basketmaker's Workshop) by spending goods worth at least 9 build points instead of the regular cost.

cards.name: Survivalist
cards.text: (Your Family will eat anything.) In the Feeding phase of each Harvest, the Survivalist can convert up to 1 of each Building material (Wood, Clay, Reed, and Stone) to 2 Food each. In each Harvest you use this, place 1 of these Food on the "Fishing" Action space.

cards.name: Swagman
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use the "Farm Expansion" or "Grain Seeds" action space, you can use the respective other space with the same person (even if it is occupied).

cards.name: Swan Lake
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on the next 5 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Sweep
cards.text: Each time before you use the action space card left of the card that has been most recently placed on a round space, you get 2 clay.

cards.name: Sweeper
cards.text: Each time you use an action space with the (meeple) symbol, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.

cards.name: Swimming Class
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, if you return a person from the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 2 bonus points for each newborn that you return home.

cards.name: Swimming Studio
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you may also convert up to 1 Wood to 3 Food.

cards.name: Swineherd
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Wild boar" Action space, you receive 1 additional Wild Boar from the supply. (The "Take 1 Wild Boar" Action is added in Stage 3.)

cards.name: Swing Plow
cards.text: Twice during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" action, you can Plow 3 fields instead of 1. The Swing Plow cannot be used with the "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action.

cards.name: Sycophant
cards.text: Any other player that uses the "Take 1 Grain" Action space must first pay you 1 Food. In addition, you receive 1 Food from the supply, even when you take the Grain yourself.

cards.name: Systems Theorist
cards.text: Whenever you build at least 1 stable, you receive 1 Food. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/3/4 stables adjacent to each other.

cards.name: Tag-Along
cards.text: Immediately after each time another player uses the "Resource Market" action space, you can also place a person there to take the action as well.

cards.name: Tanner
cards.text: When you convert Wild boar or Cattle to Food, you can choose to place them on this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1/2/3 Bonus points for 2/4/6 slaughtered Wild boar as well as for 2/3/4 Cattle.

cards.name: Tapestry Weaver
cards.text: Whenever you have at least 3 Sheep during the Field phase of a Harvest, place 1 Food from the general supply in your home. You may only place 1 Food per room. You cannot use these Food, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.

cards.name: Task Artisan
cards.text: When you play this card and each time a stone accumulation space appears on a round space in the preparation phase, you get 1 wood and a "Minor Improvement" action.

cards.name: Taster
cards.text: Whenever another player is the Starting player, you can pay him/her 2 Food at the start of the round and be the first to place a Family member. After that, play starts with the Starting player as usual. (If you are the Starting player, you do not get any advantage.)

cards.name: Tasting
cards.text: Each time you use a "Lessons" action space, before paying the occupation cost, you can exchange 1 grain for 4 food.

cards.name: Tavern
cards.text: The Tavern is an additional Action space. Whenever another player uses it, s/he receives 3 Food. Whenever you use it, you can choose either to take 3 Food or to score 2 Bonus points. (If another player uses the Tavern, you do not receive anything from it.)

cards.name: Tavern Keeper
cards.text: At the start of each Harvest you receive 1 Food and 1 Grain if you have at least 1 room in your home that is not occupied by a Family member. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus Point for every empty room.

cards.name: Tax Collector
cards.text: Whenever another player pays building resources to build a Major Improvement, you receive 1 resource of those paid (of your choice). You may pay 1 food to the general supply to receive another of the resources paid.

cards.name: Taxidermist
cards.text: When you convert Animals to Food, you can place (some of) them on this card instead of returning them to the Supply. The card can hold a maximum of 1 Sheep, 1 Wild boar and 1 Cattle. These animals are counted in scoring.

cards.name: Tea House
cards.text: Once per round, you can skip placing your second person and get 1 food instead. (You can place the person later that round.)

cards.name: Teacher of Nations
cards.text: All players can pay 1 Food less when they play an Occupation. Whenever one of the other players use this discount, you receive 1 Food from the Supply.

cards.name: Teacher's Desk
cards.text: Each time you use the "Major Improvement" or "House Redevelopment" action space, you can also play 1 occupation at an occupation cost of 1 food.

cards.name: Telegram
cards.text: Add 1 to the current round for each fence in your supply and mark the corresponding round space. In that round only, you can place a person from your supply.

cards.name: Tenant Farmer
cards.text: You immediately receive a loan of one of each type of animal. Before scoring, return the 3 animals. For each animal that you cannot or do not want to return, you lose 1 point.

cards.name: Thatcher
cards.text: Pay 1 Reed less to Build each room, for each Renovation, and for each of the Water Mill, Half-timbered House, Chicken Coop, Holiday Home, Mansion and Corn Storehouse.

cards.name: The 52nd Latitude
cards.text: Immediately place 1 Stone from the general supply on 1 unused farmyard space. (It now counts as used.) At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each empty plowed field orthogonally adjacent to this Stone.

cards.name: The Port Le Havre
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Bake Bread" Action, you may convert 1/2 Clay into 1/2 Stone.

cards.name: The Sun Farmer
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Grain" action, you receive 1 additional Sheep. Whenever you use the accumulating "Sheep" action, you receive 1 additional Grain.

cards.name: Therapist
cards.text: When you play this card, you can pay 2 Food to immediately play 1 further Occupation. Whenever another player plays an Occupation, you can pay him 1 Food. He must then, if possible, play a different Occupation card instead.

cards.name: Thick Forest
cards.text: Place 1 wood on each remaining even-numbered round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood.

cards.name: Three-Field Rotation
cards.text: At the start of the field phase of each harvest, if you have at least 1 grain field, 1 vegetable field, and 1 empty field, you get 3 food.

cards.name: Thresher
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Sow and/or Bake bread", "Plow 1 Field", or "Plow and/or Sow" Action spaces, you may buy 1 Grain for 1 Food before taking the action.

cards.name: Threshing Board
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" actions, you can also take the "Bake bread" action.

cards.name: Threshing Machine Plow
cards.text: Once during the game, when you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, you may Plow all 3 middle spaces on your farmyard instead of Plowing 1 field. (The middle 3 spaces are those surrounded by exactly 8 other spaces.)

cards.name: Throwing Axe
cards.text: Each time you use a wood accumulation space while there is at least 1 wild boar on the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you also get 2 food.

cards.name: Tile Maker
cards.text: If there are 1/3/6/9 rounds to play you receive 1/2/3/4 Clay. At the end of the game all players with a Clay hut receive 2 Bonus points. (This card does not give Bonus points for a Stone house.)

cards.name: Timber Shingle Maker
cards.text: When you renovate to stone, you can place up to 1 wood from your supply in each of your rooms. During scoring, each such wood is worth 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Timetable
cards.text: Place 1 building resource of each type on this card. These building resources can only be used to pay for Minor Improvements.

cards.name: Tinkerer
cards.text: This card is an additional Action space for you only. You may only use it with the first person you place in each Work phase to receive 1 Stone, 1 Reed, 1 Clay and 1 Wood from the general supply.

cards.name: Tinsmith
cards.text: You can convert Clay into Food at any time. You receive 1 Food per Clay. If any player has build a Well (including the Village Well), you receive 3 Food for every 2 Clay.

cards.name: Tinsmith Master
cards.text: You can hold 1 additional animal in each pasture without a stable. Each time you sow in a field, you can place 1 additional crop of the respective type in that field.

cards.name: Toad
cards.text: Add 5, 7, 9, 11, and 13 to the current round and place 1 reed on each corresponding round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the reed.

cards.name: Toolbox
cards.text: In the work phase, after each turn in which you build at least 1 room, stable, or fence, you can build the "Joinery", "pottery", or Basketmaker's Workshop" major improvement.

cards.name: Top-Outer
cards.text: Each time the "House Building" action space on the game board extension is used, you get all of the food from the "Traveling Players" accumulation space.

cards.name: Tower Builder
cards.text: If you are the only player to have only 2 rooms in your home and you use a "Build rooms" action on an Action space to build at least 1 room, you may build 1 additional room for free.

cards.name: Towhead
cards.text: Place the "After Family growth also 1 Minor Improvement" Action space face-down on Round 6. In Round 5, you can use it as if it were already face-up (in addition to the regular new Action space in Round 5).

cards.name: Town Clerk
cards.text: Each time a major improvement is built, place 1 food on this card. Once this game, you can turn this card face down to get the food on it.

cards.name: Trade Teacher
cards.text: Each time after you use a "Lesson" action space, you can buy up to 2 different goods: grain, stone, sheep, and wild boar for 1 food each; cattle and vegetable for 2 food each.

cards.name: Trailblazer
cards.text: At the start of each round, if you have no empty plowed fields on your farm, you may pay 1 Food to Plow 1 field.

cards.name: Transactor
cards.text: Immediately before the final harvest at the end of round 14, you can take all the building resources that are left on the entire game board.

cards.name: Trap Builder
cards.text: Each time you use the "Day Laborer" action space, place 1 food, 1 food, and 1 wild boar on the next 3 round spaces, respectively. At the start of these rounds, you get the good.

cards.name: Trapper
cards.text: Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, if this is the 2nd/3rd/4th occupied wood accumulation space that round, you can buy 1 sheep/wild boar/cattle for 1 food.

cards.name: Trappist Beer
cards.text: At the start of each Harvest, you may pay 1 Grain to skip all 3 phases of that Harvest.

cards.name: Travel Agent
cards.text: Place 1 Grain, 1 Wood, 1 Clay, 1 Reed and 1 Sheep on this card. Whenever any player uses the "Starting Player" Action, you may take 1 good from this card before the Action is taken.

cards.name: Traveling Salesman
cards.text: Whenever you select the "Minor Improvement" action on an Action space, you can play a Major instead of a Minor Improvement. If you select the "Major or Minor Improvement" action, you can play 2 Minor Improvements.

cards.name: Tree Collector
cards.text: Whenever another player takes 1 to 3 Wood from a Wood Accumulation space with a person, you receive 1 Wood from the general supply. (When you take Wood, you receive no benefit.)

cards.name: Tree Cutter
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 1 Wood. Whenever you receive 3 or more items of the same type (excluding Wood) from an Accumulation space, you receive 1 Wood. (Accumulation spaces are Action spaces where Goods or Food accumulate.)

cards.name: Tree Cutter
cards.text: Each time you use an accumulation space providing at least 3 goods of the same type except wood, you get an additional 1 wood. (Food is also considered a good.)

cards.name: Tree Farm Joiner
cards.text: Place 1 wood on each of the next 2 odd-numbered round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the wood and, immediately afterward, a "Minor Improvement" action.

cards.name: Tree Guard
cards.text: Each time after you use a wood accumulation space, you can place 4 wood from your supply on that space to get 2 stone, 1 clay, 1 reed, and 1 grain.

cards.name: Tree House
cards.text: Once you no longer live in a Wooden Hut, one of your rooms can hold an additional Family member.

cards.name: Tree Inspector
cards.text: This card is a "1 Wood" accumulation space for you only. Each time the newly revealed action space card is a "Quarry" accumulation space, you must discard all wood from this card.

cards.name: Treegardener
cards.text: In the field phase of each harvest, you get 1 wood and you can buy up to 2 additional wood for 1 food each.

cards.name: Trees for the Citizens
cards.text: If you have the Joinery or Sawmill, you do not have to pay the Wood cost for this card. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for every 2 Improvements in front of you that have a printed Wood cost.

cards.name: Trellis
cards.text: Each time before you use the "Pig Market" accumulation space, you can take a "Build Fences" action. (You must pay wood for the fences as usual.)

cards.name: Trellises
cards.text: Immediately place 1 food on each of the next round spaces, up to the number of fences you have built. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Trimmer
cards.text: In each work phase, after you enclose at least one farmyard space, you get 2 stone. (Subdividing an existing pasture does not count.)

cards.name: Trip to the Lake
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space, you receive an additional 1 Food and 1 Wood.

cards.name: Trout Pool
cards.text: At the start of each work phase, if there are at least 3 food on the "Fishing" accumulation space, you get 1 food from the general supply.

cards.name: Trowel
cards.text: At any time, you can renovate your house to stone. From a wooden house, this costs 1 stone, 1 reed, and 1 food per room. From a clay house, this costs 1 stone per room.

cards.name: Truffle Digger
cards.text: Whenever you use a Family member's Action to take Wood and you have 1/2/3 Wild boar, you receive 1/2/3 additional Food.

cards.name: Truffle Searcher
cards.text: This card can hold a number of wild boar equal to the number of completed feeding phases.

cards.name: Tuileries Garden
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Plow 1 field" Action space, you may immediately afterward take 1 Grain or 1 Vegetable from the general supply and Sow it.

cards.name: Tulip Field
cards.text: Immediately place 4 Food from the general supply on 1 of your empty fields. In the Field phase of each Harvest, move 1 of these Food to your personal supply. You cannot Sow this field until it is empty again.

cards.name: Tumbrel
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 2 food. Each time after you take an unconditional "Sow" action, you get 1 food for each stable you have.

cards.name: Turkey Breeder
cards.text: You may immediately build up to 4 fences and 1 stable for free. At the end of the final Harvest, you must return 4 Wood to the general supply. If you cannot, you must take 1 Begging Card for each Wood you cannot return.

cards.name: Turner
cards.text: At any time, you can use the Turner to convert any number of Wood to 1 Food each.

cards.name: Turnip Farmer
cards.text: At the start of the returning home phase of each round, if both the "Day Laborer" and "Grain Seeds" action spaces are occupied, you get 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Turnip Field
cards.text: When you Sow, you can plant Vegetables on this card as you would on a field. When you play this card, you can also take the "Sow" action. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

cards.name: Turnwrest Plow
cards.text: Once during the game, when you use either "Plow 1 field" or "Plow 1 field and/or Sow" action, you can Plow 3 fields instead of 1.

cards.name: Tutor
cards.text: At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each Occupation that you play after this one.

cards.name: Twin Researcher
cards.text: Each time you use one of the two accumulation spaces for the same type of good containing exactly the same number of goods, you can also buy 1 bonus point for 1 food.

cards.name: Undergardener
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Day Laborer" Action space, you also receive 1 Vegetable.

cards.name: Undergrowth
cards.text: You immediately receive 2 Wood.

cards.name: Understudy
cards.text: Whenever an Action space is occupied by exactly one of your Family members, you may use that Action space again with a second Family member. (Newborns count as Family members).

cards.name: Undisturbed Pond
cards.text: Place 1 Food on each of the next Round spaces, up to the number of completed rounds. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Unicycle Driver
cards.text: At the start of each round, you may pay 1 Stone to place 1 of your unused fences as a road between 2 orthogonally adjacent Action spaces. At the end of each Work phase, you may use 1 empty Action space with a road to one occupied by you.

cards.name: Unusual Architecture
cards.text: Whenever you extend your home with 1 or more Rooms, you receive 2 Food for each new Room.

cards.name: Upscale Lifestyle
cards.text: You immediately get 5 clay and a "Renovation" action. If you take the action, you must pay the renovation cost.

cards.name: Value Assets
cards.text: After each harvest, you can buy exactly one of the following goods: 1 Food â†’ 1 Wood; 1 Food â†’ 1 Clay; 2 Food â†’ 1 Reed; 2 Food â†’ 1 Stone

cards.name: Vampire
cards.text: Play this card only if the player on your right just used an Accumulation space on the previous turn. You immediately use the same Action and receive the same amount of items. Take the items from the general supply.

cards.name: Vegetable Garden
cards.text: When you Sow, you can plant Vegetables on this card as you would on a field. When you play this card, it starts with 2 Vegetables planted on it from the general supply. After those Vegetables are harvested, it can be Sowed again. (This card does not count as a field when scoring.)

cards.name: Vegetable Harvest
cards.text: If you have an Oven, you can convert Vegetables into Food at any time. Take 4 Food for each Vegetable.

cards.name: Vegetable Scoop
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Take 1 Vegetable" action, you receive 1 additional Vegetable.

cards.name: Vegetable Seller
cards.text: At any time, you can convert 1 Vegetable from your supply or borrowed from the general supply into 2 Food. For each borrowed Vegetable not returned before scoring, receive 1 Begging card. (For each borrowed Vegetable, put 1 Vegetable from the general supply on a begging card as a reminder.)

cards.name: Vegetable Slicer
cards.text: Each time you upgrade a Fireplace to a Cooking Hearth, you immediately get 2 wood and 1 vegetable (not retroactively).

cards.name: Vegetarian
cards.text: For each Grain or Vegetable you convert to Food (in any manner), you receive 1 additional Food. You may not convert animals to Food for the rest of the game.

cards.name: Venus of Dolni Vestonice
cards.text: Whenever you use the action space "Family Growth and Minor Improvement", you may carry out the family growth action twice with that person. (The Action space becomes available in Rounds 5-7. Even if you take the Action twice, you can build at most 1 Minor Improvement.)

cards.name: Veterinarian
cards.text: When you play this card, place 4 Sheep, 3 Wild boar and 2 Cattle in a container. At the start of each round, draw two animals. If they are the same, keep one. Return the 1 or 2 animals to the container.

cards.name: Village Beauty
cards.text: At any time, you can play 3 Food to take a "Family growth" action without placing one of your Family members. You must have room in your home. You can use the Newborn to take action from the following round.

cards.name: Village Druid
cards.text: In the future, whenever you play an Occupation, you receive 1 Sheep afterward.

cards.name: Village Elder
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, all players with the most played Improvements receive 3 Bonus points each.

cards.name: Village Farmer
cards.text: If there are still 1/3/6/9 rounds to play, you immediately receive 1/2/3/4 Wood. At the end of the game, all players who have the most plowed fields receive 3 Bonus points each.

cards.name: Village Fool
cards.text: At the start of each round, you may place 1 card face down from your hand under Village Fool. That card can no longer be used for the rest of the game. At the end of the game, you receive 1 Bonus point for each card under Village Fool except the 3rd, 5th, 7th and 9th.

cards.name: Village Idiot
cards.text: The Village Idiot is your lone occupation. Each time another player uses the "Meeting Place" action space, you get 1 wood and 1 food.

cards.name: Village Peasant
cards.text: At the start of scoring, you get a number of vegetables equal to the smallest of the numbers of major improvements, minor improvements, and occupations you have.

cards.name: Village School
cards.text: Once per turn, when paying a cost, you may discard 1 card from your hand to pay 1 less Building resource of your choice.

cards.name: Village Teacher
cards.text: Immediately after each time you use a "Lessons" action space, if this is the 1st/2nd/3rd occupied Lessons action space that round, you get 1 food/grain/vegetable.

cards.name: Village Well
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on the next 3 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Vineyard
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Sow" action, you can plant up to 3 Food on this card. Up to 3 Food may be planted on it in total. These Food are Sowed in the same way as Grain and are harvested during the Harvest. (This card does not count as a Field when scoring).

cards.name: Virtuous Hero
cards.text: If no other player has 1 of your fences, you can give each player 1 fence from your supply. Whenever one of these players takes goods (no food) from an Accumulation space, you can take back your fence from that player and get 1 Food from the general supply and that player gets 1 good of that type from the general supply.

cards.name: Wage
cards.text: You immediately get 2 food and 1 additional food for each major improvement you have from the bottom row of the supply board.

cards.name: Wagon Fort
cards.text: For each empty space on your Farmyard, you can pay 1 Wood and place 1 of your unbuilt Fences on it. You can take any of these Fences back into your supply at any time. If the Fences are still there at the end of the game, the spaces count as used.

cards.name: Walking Boots
cards.text: You immediately get 2 food. You must immediately place a person from your supply. If you do, in the next returning home phase, you must remove that person from play.

cards.name: Wall Builder
cards.text: Each time you build at least 1 room, you can place 1 food on each of the next 4 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Waltzer
cards.text: You can place 2 People one after another, as long as both Action spaces are on the same board and adjoin one another. (not diagonally)

cards.name: Wash Woman
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space with exactly 3 Food on it, you receive an additional 1 Grain and 1 building resource of your choice.

cards.name: Water Carrier
cards.text: Once any player has built the Well, place 1 Food on the remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food. (If the Well has already been built, place the Food immediately.)

cards.name: Water House
cards.text: In the Replenish phase of each round (Phase 2), place 1 additional Food on the "Fishing" Action space. Whenever another player uses the "Fishing" Action space, they must pay you 2 Food from that Action space.

cards.name: Water Mill
cards.text: After the Field phase of a Harvest, each player can use the Water Mill to convert up to 1 Grain to 3 Food. Each player that uses the Water Mill must give you 1 of the Food.

cards.name: Water Worker
cards.text: Whenever you use the "Fishing" Action space or one of its neighbors, "Day Laborer", "Take 1 Reed", or the Round 4 Action space, you receive 1 additional Reed.

cards.name: Water Worker
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Fishing" accumulation space or one of the three orthogonally adjacent actions spaces, you get 1 additional reed.

cards.name: Water Worker
cards.text: Each time after you use the "Fishing" accumulation space or one of the three orthogonally adjacent action spaces, you get 1 additional reed.

cards.name: Watering Can
cards.text: Immediately add 1 Grain from the supply to each of your planted Grain fields and 1 Vegetable to each of your planted Vegetable fields.

cards.name: Weakling
cards.text: Each time it is your turn in the work phase, if there are one or more accumulation spaces with 5+ goods on them and you do not use any of them, you get 1 vegetable.

cards.name: Wealthiest European
cards.text: If this is your first Occupation, immediately take 1 building resource of your choice for each completed round of the game.

cards.name: Wealthy Man
cards.text: At the start of each of the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th/6th harvest, if you have at least 1/2/3/4/5/6 grain fields, you get 1 bonus point.

cards.name: Weaver
cards.text: Whenever you have at least 2 Sheep at the start of the Work phase, you receive 1 Food.

cards.name: Weekend Worker
cards.text: Whenever you renovate, you can build 1 additional room by paying 1 Reed, 1 of the basic Building resource for the hut (Wood or Clay) and 2 Building resources of the new home type (Clay or Stone).

cards.name: Weekly Market
cards.text: When you play this card, you receive 2 Vegetables.

cards.name: Well
cards.text: Place 1 food on each of the next 5 round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Well
cards.text: Place 1 Food each on the next 5 remaining Round spaces. At the start of these rounds, you receive the Food.

cards.name: Well Builder
cards.text: For you, the Well is not a Major but a Minor Improvement and costs only 1 Stone and 1 Wood to build.

cards.name: Well Inspector
cards.text: From Round 4, as long as the Major Improvement "Well" has not been built yet, you receive 1 Food at the start of each Round (even before Phase 1).

cards.name: Wet Nurse
cards.text: Whenever you Build room(s), you may grow your family by up to the number of rooms that you build. This costs 1 Food per person. (The newborns are only available to take actions in the next round.)

cards.name: Wheedler
cards.text: Whenever you receive Food from an Action space, you receive 1 additional Food. This benefit does not apply to Food gained due to an Improvement or Occupation.

cards.name: Wheel Plow
cards.text: Once this game, when you use the "Farmland" or Cultivation" action space with the first person you place in a round, you can plow 2 additional fields.

cards.name: Wheelbarrow Pusher
cards.text: Whenever you use a person's action to take exactly 1 resource from a Building resource Accumulation space, you receive an additional 1 Building resource of your choice or 1 Food. In a 4 or 5 player game, you instead receive an additional 1 Building resource of your choice and 1 Food.

cards.name: Wheelmaker
cards.text: When you play this card, if you have another occupation in play and more wood than all other players combined, you immediately get wood from the general supply until you have 15 wood.

cards.name: Whisky Distiller
cards.text: At any time, you can pay 1 grain. If you do, add 2 to the current round and place 4 food on the corresponding round space. At the start of that round, you get the food.

cards.name: White Brazilian
cards.text: Play this card only if your top 5 farmyard spaces are unused. Place 1 stable and 1 Wild boar on the leftmost or rightmost farmyard space in this row. Flip a coin. If the coin lands heads, keep both the Wild boar and stable, otherwise keep only the stable.

cards.name: Wholesale Market
cards.text: Place 1 food on each remaining round space. At the start of these rounds, you get the food.

cards.name: Wholesaler
cards.text: Place 1 vegetable, 1 wild boar, 1 stone, and 1 cattle on this card. Each time you use an action space card on round spaces 8 to 11, you get the corresponding good from this card.

cards.name: Wild Boar Hunt
cards.text: In the Replenish phase of each even-numbered round, place 1 additional Wild boar on the "Take 1 Wild boar" Action space. Every round, other players can only use the "Take 1 Wild boar" Action space with their first person.

cards.name: Wild Boar Hunter
cards.text: In the returning home phase of each round, if at least 3 wood accumulation spaces are occupied, you can pay 1 wood to get 1 wild boar.

cards.name: Wild Breeding
cards.text: Immediately add 1 animal of the appropriate type to each Accumulation space containing 2 or more animals. If you have space on your farm, you may take 1 of the added animals.

cards.name: Wild Game
cards.text: You immediately receive 5 Food.

cards.name: Wildlife Reserve
cards.text: This card can hold up to 1 Sheep, 1 Wild boar and 1 Cattle. (This card does not count as a pasture when scoring.)

cards.name: Windmill
cards.text: At any time, you can convert Grain to 2 Food (without having to Bake bread.)

cards.name: Wine Cellar
cards.text: Immediately convert 1 unfenced Stable into a Wine Cellar by tipping it onto its side. You cannot hold animals in the Stable anymore. In the Field phase of each Harvest, you receive 2 Food from the Supply. The space is counted as used. The Wine Cellar is not counted as a Stable. If you fence the space, you can use it as a Pasture.

cards.name: Wine Closet
cards.text: You immediately receive 1 Vegetable. Once each round, you may move 1 Vegetable from your supply onto a future Round space. If it is at least 5 rounds away, add 1 Vegetable from the general supply. At the start of that round, you must convert each of those Vegetables to 2 Food or 1 Bonus point.

cards.name: Winnowing Fan
cards.text: After the field phase of each harvest, you can use a baking improvement but only to turn exactly 1 grain into food. (This is not considered a "Bake Bread" action.)

cards.name: Winter Caretaker
cards.text: When you play this card, you immediately get 1 grain. At the end of each harvest, you can buy exactly 1 vegetable for 2 food.

cards.name: Winter Deadwood
cards.text: When you play this card, you may either pay 1 Wood for 1 Bonus point or receive 1 Wood and pass this card to the player on your left who adds it to his/her hand.

cards.name: Winter Garden
cards.text: You may Sow 1 of your rooms as if it were 1 field. Whenever you have an animal in your home (including House Goat), move all resources planted in this room to the general supply. Harvest resources from your room as normal and additionally at the end of Rounds 6, 8, 10 and 12.

cards.name: Wintercrafter
cards.text: Between the Field and Feeding phases of each Harvest, you may play a Minor Improvement or pay 2 Food to build a Major Improvement. (Pay costs normally).

cards.name: Witch of Haarlem
cards.text: Whenever you take Wood/ Clay/ Reed/ Sheep/ Wild Boar/ Food from an Accumulation space, you may convert exactly 1 of them into 1 Clay/ Reed/ Stone/ Wild Boar/ Cattle/ Grain (respectively).

cards.name: Witches' Dance Ground
cards.text: Place this card on or beside your farm. If you place it beside your farm, you gain 2 extra farmyard spaces (to be scored as normal) and you receive 1 Bonus point. If you place it on your farm, cover two orthogonally adjacent unused spaces which no longer count as part of your farm.

cards.name: Woman Weighing Pearls
